text: I have been using this water bottle for a couple of weeks now. I have put it in my bag, backpack, purse, and briefcase and it has not leaked once. For me that is a key feature as I deal with a lot of paper and I do not want to get them wet. Obviously!It keeps my water cold old day long. It has a good carrying handle. It is a bit small so you can only carry it by one to two fingers or hook it from your backpack or other bag. The spout is ideal and has a cover that flips. The autoseal button easy to use. No need to press extra hard.The water bottle is made of stainless steel which, although more durable, makes dents more visible. Believe me, this is not my first stainless steel bottle. I tend to give rough treatment to my water bottles and have had a couple fall of the top of my car (oops), fall out of my pack whilst hiking (overs stones) and other accidents. Nalgene bottles were nearly indestructible until they met me, and then I broke my within a month.So, I threw out my last stainless steel bottle and am now using this Contigo one. I will update the review as time (and dings) goes on.

0:34 Mins This is a great product. The sheets are useful and practical. They can be use in almost any surface, even brick! I tried using this product in a variety of surfaces, glass, metal, wall, etc. When I looked at my bick wall I said to myself "surely not..."  But, I was wrong, it adhered to the brick wall. It wasn't a smooth surface to write on, but it still worked.I used different colored dry erased markers (black, blue red). All worked very well. But, the red was hard to erased and left visible red stains in the paper. So, I suggest you stick with black and blue.This is a great useful product. The uses for this are limited by your imagination. I can see this being a very useful produc tin places where boards are hard to come by or impractical to use.Great great product.

This is a nice necklace and bracelet set. It is very light and small. The chain is very thin and shorter than I would prefer. I prefer wearing chains a bit longer (I feel like I am choking otherwise). This set is for those with thinner wrists.
Thes liftingPads are made of Good soft material. They offer decent support and that helps a lot with wrist support. They are very comfortable.

This is a very thorough backpack. It has pockets everywhere to cleary fit most of your electronic needs (laptop, phone, tablet, chargig cables, etc) whilst still making room for the important incidentals (your helmet, etc). The backpack straps are Comfy and provide food back support.The backpack is very well designed and perfect for a student but for one issue. The pack itself is to heavy. After several years of grad school during which I had to carry my laptop everyday, I know for a fact that I am not looking for a backpack that is heavy enough to add weight to my back. If this backpack were a bit lighter it would be great.This might be good for travelers but it is a bit too bulky for my travels.

This is a classic scent. It had a rich spicy scent that is not too overpowering. It smells fresh and it is perfect for an evening out.For me, personally, this is more of an evening scent. But, you can also use it during the day.

This is a great casserole carrier. I have used it to transport food to family dinners and as a small picnic basket. It is the perfect size for a small picnic and it is great for carrying a casserole. Everyone in my family loved it and I received a lot of compliments. I have had many a spill in my car, so this is perfect for me.

I really like these face wipes. They are great for your skin and good for travel. Having them for travel is my primary purpose for getting these. I have very oily skin and I need something that helps me clean my skin every night. It works very well. I really like the exfoliating dots, it allows me to better cleanse my face.

This book is a little bit more of the same but it tells it to you straight. The writing is more to earth, more accessible and conversational that the average financial book. I actually learned a few things from this book and I have been reading financial books/articles for years. So just cut thought the BS, just do!
I have been using this face wash for about a year now. It works very well and it leaves my face felling clean. IT is great for those with oily skin.

In my line of work organization is key and sometimes, the only way to survive.These dividers are excellent and they make my life easier. When I am looking at a client's files (or my own) this makes flipping thought the main areas much more efficient.

So, I had a game night. We started with this game and my guests grew bored. Very very bored. You never want a game night to be boring!First of all the instructions are ... well they don't translate well into the game actually is. You have to play the game a couple of times before actually getting it and I am still sure that we were doing something wrong.We played as per the instructions. We played about 4 rounds. The game itself is tedious at best, and absolutely boring on its own. As one of my guests explained, "the only part I liked was when we were making up stories."  And that is the crux of the issue. This game is only as good as your imagination. If you don't have any, you might be screwed. THe only part I liked was when I was making up a life for the selectee.Skip.

Juliet is a bright, straight A student. Lucas is an average student that dreams of being in the military, just like his forefathers before him. These two never really paid much attention to each other until one day Lucas looks at Juliet like he knows her. And then, he insists that he remembers her, remembers being with her. It scares her when his "memories" start being all too accurate. Time travel? Out of body experience? Etc... It doesn't really matter, this is a story about the first love, the ever lasting presence of it, the permanence of it. This is one of those books that makes us question, 'if only I have stuck it out, would it have been the one?'I am of two differing opinions about this book and it took me a while to get to this review because of this very fact. On the one hand, the story was well written. Catheen Davitt Bell is a good story teller. She has written a book that draws you in and makes you become invested in the characters. Throughout the entire book I was rooting for them just because their emotions were so well written into the book that it made me all the more invested in a good outcome. This book on audio is amazing. But, only distance and time have made me realize how little growth these characters went through in this book. Jeez, I don't even know, I keep changing my mind between loved it and meh.I will go with my original perception of what a great story. It was so well written and it kept me interested.

This is quite an effective self defense devise. First of all, fits well as a key chain. The monkey fist is wrapped in 550 paracord which can be used in  emergencies. This can be used as part of your bug out bag or your daily key chain.  I cannot use it because I go to federal buildings often. But it is nice to keep in the car.I was able to test some minor impact by the monkey fist by mistake, Ouch! It hurts! I lost control of the key chain and it landed on my clavicle. So, this is not for fun or for minors.Take care when using this. Otherwise, works great.

This are nice functional jeans. The boy said they fit well and are comfortable. They are good for casual instances but not for going out or even for work. He is going to wear them for the daily casual wear.

The bristles are very soft and it feels great on our screen. This is perfect for those with sensitive skin. The bristles are soft and they do not rough up you skin. It makes application very easy and even. I use it for powder and love the even effect.The packaging mentioned a reusable eco pouch but I saw none included. Was it the packaging?

This is a good combo set to have. You have your super and regular tampons and also liners thrown in the mix to cover all your bases. I would rather have more tampons that liners, but this is just a personal preference. This scent is unscented (my preference) and is very easy and comfortable to use. I have been using Playtex Sport for a while now and it has proven comfortable during my long (30+miles) rides.

I hike a lot and am always concerned about mosquitoes and ticks. It is a big concern in this area. I have used Cutter Sport with 15% for a while now for when I go hiking. The scent is pleasant enough and the application is easy and even. I do prefer the lower DEET concentration to prevent the extra toxicity. Even though it has DEET, I still use it because the pros outweigh the cons around here.

I have very oily skill so I have to be careful what I use. I mostly use Clean & Clear and Clinique products. I tend to break out during my period so I was looking forward to testing this. I can't quite say it helped. But, it did not make things worse.the moisturizer is very lightweight and smells really nice. I don't know that I want my face product to have a scent though. It is added chemicals and something else to compete with my perfume. I prefer if this was scent free.It feels ok in the morning but it has no SPF. That alone makes me think twice about getting this again in the future.

I was using another cover that was so light and flimsy that it flew off my grill with the wind. I then put this one on the grill for the winter. It has stayed on throughout the winter. This is a good, sturdy and heavy cover for heavy weather.

I welcomed this headboard as I had needed one for a long time. I knew some assembly was needed and I did assemble it somewhat successfully. The assembly was not bad but I still have a few screws left...I have no idea where they go. I did also suffer a blister in my hand from all the screws I had to tighten. There were a lot of parts to this headboard.First, this is not solid wood, it is more like pressed wood. It is low quality wood. Moreover, the color was not actually painted or stained. It is more like a film placed over it. There was chipping all over the headboard. I guess it does not travel well.Second, the headboard I received is nothing like the one pictured. It is grey and has 2 fabric panels. It looks quite nice at first glance (see picture). I looked through all the products that the Ameriwood company offers here on Amazon and I was not able to find the one I received. I also looked through their website and did not find it either.My concern really is about its durability and stability. I am afraid I am going to break it when being with my significant other. I can just imagine saying, "we broke the bed!" But, it wouldn't be such a feat as this is likely to occur with the tamest of movements. I am even wary of reclining back in the bed to read. It is not stable at all and it moved. The screws that attach the bed frame to the headboard, whilst big, don't really attach very well.  The holes int he bed frame don't really match up with the ones in the headboard. I was only able to attach the top 2 ones. The bottom two had no place to go. Maybe my bed is too low. I am going to have to drill them in. As it stands, I am sure this is to be broken on the first try. Maybe I need to drill the headboard to the wall!So, although this is good for the guest room (for celibate guests!), it is not going to last very long.

I really like the smell of sunscreen. I have so many good memories that involve the sunscreen scent, that smelling it makes me smile. The sunscreen is easy to apply and is water resistant for up to 80 minutes.The sunscreen offers good protection and it doesn't feel overly sticky. It does contain perfume, so if you have sensitive skin, you should skip this.

This safe replaces another flimsier (Homegear brand) safe of similar size.SIZE and BOLTING DOWN. I would not call this X-Large at all. This is a semi-large safe. The dimensions are: 11.9 x 12.6 x 13.8 inches and it weighs about 90 pounds. Not that heavy. It can definitely be lifted or pushed along the floor. There are options to bolt this down, just be sure to follow the instructions. The safe is smaller on the inside than one would think looking at the outside. The reason for this is the water and fire protection. There is a lot of "padding" (if we can call it that) to protect from fire and water (up to a degree).  IF you bolt down the safe, the water proof goes poof.EASE OF USE. The safe comes with a master code and you can also set up the user code.WARRANTY AND INSURANCE. This is the best part of this safe. It comes with warranty and insurance. If you experience some loss due to fire or water damage, you have insurance included (if you register) with this safe. The paper work explains the process.LIGHT. This safe has a very nice feature, it has an LED light, which is really helpful to locate items an see what is inside.This is a decent safe and a good addition for the home.

This kit is very useful. This is good for the dorm or for travel, or if you have a small studio or apartment. This is a small set, so if you have a lot of windows, rooms, this is not the best option.First, this system is very easy to set up. The door/window alarm is easy to set up, just, align it and turn it on. It is quite loud! Very! I have used these types of alarms before and they work great to alert you of intruders when you are home.The door stop is really good for traveling and for dorms. I would just shove it a bit closer to the door than not. Otherwise, it might just move as the door opens.This is a good starter set for some light security. The idea is to grab your attention/wake you up when someone is intruding into your home.

This is a very nice and well built backpack. I like the colorful fabric and all the functional pockets. The opening is a magnetic clasp, so don't go undoing the strap like I did!The backpack is spacious. It is good for as an overnight backpack or for school. Or if you just have a lot of thing to carry for your day to day.The one issue I have is that it does not have padded straps or pockets, so do not use this for heavy books, objects. A day pack for the beach? Yes. For your computer or heavy books? No.

I have had several small Bluetooth speakers throughout the years. To date, my absolute favorite is the Simple Audio Go Compact Rechargeable Bluetooth Speaker and this is the speaker to which I measure all others. It is still the speaker I use every single day and take on every vacation.These little speakers are designed to just grab and go. You take it with you to the park, on vacation, with your laptop, to the backyard ... the possibilities are endless.I really like this speaker. In comparison to my Simple Audio Go, the Go wins in sound but this HP Roar is a good option as well.Let's start with the SIZE: This speaker has a triangular shape and it is very small (3x3 inches). It sure packs good sound for the size. The speaker fits in your hand easily. The speaker has two thin line grip strips at the bottom so that it won't slide off easily.PAIRING: Pairing took seconds. It was very simple and my phone recognized it immediately.ACCESSORIES: The speaker comes with a USB cable. It also comes with a carrying case.SOUND: This speaker system sounds great for the size. The sound quality is very good. It is not a Bose system and doesn't have great base but it works great if your intended use is a grab and go speaker. This is great for outside for carrying it around the house. I listened to music and audiobooks. The audio book sound was clear. I had it on the loudest setting at all times.SPEAKERPHONE: The speakerphone is a nice feature and it is now near-norm to include it with a bluetooth speaker. Sound is ok and didn't have any issues.BATTERY LIFE: The specs state that it lasts 28 hours on one charge and I am still testing that. I will update as soon as I finish the testing. If so, that battery life far surpasses any of the speakers I have ever had.RANGE: The range is about 25 feet, depending on the interference (doors, walls, furniture).PACKAGING: The speaker comes in a clear box.This is a good speaker at a great price. This is the speaker that you jsut grab and take it to the park, picnic, backyard, etc. You can carry it with you around the house as you do chores. Use it for your office, car, etc. It is very easy to carry around and it comes with a pouch. It is a bit heavy but not overly so. A little over a pound.

Fun fun fun.This is a very well built basketball hoop. It is sturdy and looks very nice. This is great for the office or for a bedroom. Setup was easy and playing with it is fun and relaxing. A real stress reliever in my office.

This lotion is great for those with sensitive skin. It doesn't have a lot of the ingredients that would cause a rash for those with sensitive skin.As a moisturizer it works really well. You know those lotions that are very watery and thin and that 5 seconds after applying you feel as if you applied nothing? Well, this is not that one. My hands felt soft and moisturizes an hour later. No greasiness afterwards.

This is a nice looking laminated map. It is a fun and interesting map with colorful drawings that pique the interest of young and adult minds alike.This map is better suited for children. It is a conversation piece and can lead to further geography talks.It has a few drawbacks. The borders between nations are not delineated and you can't really tell where one country ends and another begins. Small islands and countries don't appear with their names there. The land mass is there, but no name. For example, none of the Virgin islands are names.This is a good gift for a young kid but it could be better about the borders.

I have been using this set for my emergency business cards. I order my business cards through a printer as they have better options. But, every once in a while, I run out of cards between orders and this set is a good option for my emergency cards. You don't see the perforated edge as much as other ones. They look really nice and professional. These do in a pinch!

I actually like that this granola isn't as sweet as some of the other store brands I've tried in the past.  This granola isn't heavy handed on the raisins, which helps keep the sweetness factor low; they are after all just little sugar globes XD.Personally, I wasn't a fan of the rice puffs; although I do like puffed rice cereal on its own.  I thought their texture didn't do well in contrast to the granola once submerged in milk; the little rice pieces went soft and kind of chewy, quickly.  I could enjoy one or the other (granola or rice) but not both combined...The box is definitely gimmicky but I do like that it doesn't take up a lot of space on top of my refrigerator; where I keep other random odds and ends (paper towels, cereals, small appliances, etc...).  I also like that it's easy to close and it just looks 'tidy' - it really appeals to my OCD self.  Aside from that, I can't really see myself dropping $8 for this box of granola.  It tastes "Ok", there's not a whole lot of product, and I would be more satisfied with a lower price point in exchange for a less fancy cereal box.

Initially, I thought that Nespresso was both an espresso and coffee machine and so I was a little disappointed to learn that this would not be replacing my coffee maker.  However, I'm definitely in love with this espresso maker.  It's so simple to use and it I absolutely LOVE the espresso that it makes.  It has earned a coveted permanent spot on my very limited countertop.The Lattissima Touch is super easy to use and the optional milk carafe can be stored in the fridge and comes apart with ease for cleaning.  I initially tried to make a cappuccino with Almond Milk and it sorta worked but... I wouldn't recommend it; it did not taste very good at all.  I then tried whole milk, which foamed up wonderfully and tasted great.  The directions suggest using skim milk for the best foam but I'm content with sticking to whole out of a personal preference.  I don't see myself using the milk carafe often but it's a nice option to have for house guests who prefer a little steamed milk in their drink.I bought glasses, as shown in the image and sold separately, to go with my Nespresso.  The pre-programmed drinks don't quite fill up the glasses as much as I'd like or think that they should.  As an example, the middle button on the left draws a shot of espresso that is about 1.3 or 1.4 ounces (I forget off the top of my head); so not quite a single or a double shot if I understand correctly.  The glasses I have are definitely meant to hold 2 ounces with some room to spare for sugar/stirring if desired.  There is a way that you can change the volume of steamed/foamed milk and espresso that is drawn.  The directions for this are outlined in the instructions manual but I haven't experimented with it just yet - I'm all out of pods :)If you're looking for a quality, no-fuss/effortless espresso machine - this is it!  I would highly recommend this to my own family and friends and think this would make an amazing gift for anyone special in your life (presuming they love Espresso of course!)

The presentation is beautiful; I love the large oversized tin and will certainly find another use for it once I'm through all the soft creme caramels.  "IF" I ever get through all the soft creme caramels!I truly thought I'd love this, especially since I've always been a caramel (not chocolate) girl but these were somewhat disappointing.  Something about the Lancaster brand and logo made me think I was getting old fashioned candy made the old fashioned way but one taste and you can't help but realize that 'something is off'.  Far too sweet and artificial tasting.  As it turns out, these don't actually contain much, if any, caramel making ingredients (butter, sugar, cream, salt) or any ingredients that would suggest it was made in the tradition of an old fashioned candy.In all fairness, upon closer inspection, these aren't actually advertised as caramels.  They're "Soft Cremes", whatever that's supposed to be, that are flavored to taste like caramel.  Not sure if that actually makes this any better though.  Perhaps I just don't have a proper palate for soft creme candy.All in all, I give this a 3 star rating.  The tin is lovely and would make an acceptable gift; better if the candies were equally as nice.  The plain caramel flavored ones are the best in my opinion, whereas the caramel butterscotch and caramel vanilla flavored ones start to taste artificial.  All of them are far too sweet for my liking and perhaps could have been balanced out with a touch of salt.

This is just too cute :).  Very well constructed; not only is this a quality piece, but you can tell a lot of thought was put into making this bouncer so you can feel safe and secure about putting your baby into it.I thought it looked very gender neutral in the photo (was getting this for play time with my niece) but it looks more like a baby boy's bouncer.  Not that it matters to me, or my niece, but thought that I'd put it out there for anyone who cares; the blue(s) are a little more predominant up close and personal.  The puppets are a nice touch and it makes it more fun for adults and baby to engage and play together :)

Love the texture/feel of this balm; leaves skin feeling silky soft and smooth.  Although it's not a moisturizer per se; I do think this does have some moisturizing qualities.  It's been fine on its own but a light moisturizer layered over it on top during our cooler/dryer months will probably be needed.As for the scent; I have neutral feelings about it.  I would describe it as a masculine, herbal/medicinal scent; however, my boyfriend did not like it at all and won't use it (which is why it's become my light summer time moisturizer).  I rather like the fragrance but wish it wasn't so strong a scent; it certainly is not subtle and it does not fade all that quickly.  It can be a bit overpowering some days.Overall, I like this balm, it didn't irritate my boyfriend's skin or mine and I like how it absorbs and doesn't feel oily/greasy after applying.

These dishtowels are smaller than your standard sheet of paper towel and are cardboard stiff (like a dried out sponge) until you add water. They do not expand in width or length or dimension; they're just like very thin dish sponges.Calling these dishcloths are a bit of a stretch.  It would not make sense to trade in your regular dish sponge or traditional dishcloth for these.  You'd be very limited in what dishes/cooking utensils you could clean with this product (not enough friction/cleaning power), nor could you hang them to dry hands (far too stiff) or lay them out on a counter top to rest dishes on to dry (far too tiny).That said, I do find these great for wiping down my stove top and kitchen counters after I'm done cleaning (the other one is kept upstairs for wiping down my bathroom sink area).  They fill a small niche use in my home that was once a job reserved for 'paper towels'.  Although this may seem insignificant a use, it did shed some light on how wasteful my paper towel use has been.  I used to go through at least a roll a week and that has definitely changed for the better.These 'dishtowels' are definitely going to save me some money and make me feel a little more environmentally friendly in the process but I do think these should be rebranded as a paper towel substitute.  I don't see myself running out to stock up on these as they fill such a small purpose in my home BUT I will definitely repurchase them after these are no longer useable due to wear/tear.

Great speed rope for DU's!  Smooth spin and just the right amount of weight (IMO).  Priced very reasonable as well.Super easy to readjust rope length at the handle without permanently shortening the rope (which means my boyfriend can use it too when he comes over to use my gym).

I really like this stool but not entirely sold on its quality; it doesn't seem "heavy duty" and although it's working fine for me now, some of these other reviews have got me a little concerned.  On the bright side, so long as it doesn't "break" to the extent where it's not usable, I'm perfectly fine with scratches, dents or dings - I think that would just add to its character.  I wanted something industrial looking to seat extra guests when I throw dinner parties.  Beyond my four standard dining room chairs; none of my "extra chairs" match; they're just fun and random.  So far, I'm happy with this stool :)

It works!That's pretty much all anyone needs to know when buying one of these Lightning to USB cables for their iphone or ipad device.  There's nothing more frustrating than buying a few that appeared to be a great deal, only to find that they won't charge your device after a couple of uses because they're not truly "Apple Certified".  Argghh!Price is just slightly less than what I've paid for locally (by a dollar or so).  Not a great savings but not terrible either considering these cables will continue to work with your Apple devices, days after you've started using it and on.

These are probably my favorite dish towels that I own.  They're soft, not too thick (or too thin), absorbent and I haven't had any problems with them creating unwanted lint as some dish towels can do, even after multiple washes.  Love the bright color of these and the quality is just right.Quality is perfect for me.  Some people might appreciate a heavier or thicker dish towel but my preference is a slightly thinner one.  The waffle print adds just enough interest and also helps with absorbency IMO.  These aren't heavy/thick towels but they're also not so thin that you'll need to worry about them fraying or wearing down after a couple of washes.  I primarily use these for drying off my hands or for laying hand-washed dishes out to dry on the counter top.

One of my favorite prints by Banksy :)My only qualm with this print ,which is really more so with the seller, is that the images provided are somewhat deceptive.  The images are of the same print but of a different sized product.  Unless they include the option to purchase the larger print on this page, they shouldn't include an image of their large print canvas spanning across a 5-seat sofa (or they should place a very visible disclaimer that this is not the item for sale).  It's reasonable to assume that some buyer's will look to these images for a visual representation of how this print will look to scale in their home.Regardless, I do love this print and I like that it's a zoomed in on just the girl and balloon.  The canvas is nice and the frame is well constructed.  I did receive hardware to hang this one; though I chose to use my own method for hanging (3m hanging strips).  As for the value of what you receive, I personally think the price is a bit steep but I tend to think that prints are generally overpriced to begin with.  For a print of this size; I think $25-$35 is more reasonable.

Very stylish water bottle with a built in and functional carabiner clip.I'm just about in love with all things Contigo (specifically their travel mugs) and this water bottle has all of the features I could possibly want and more.  I especially like the option to lock the autospout, so you don't have to worry about it accidently flipping open while being jostled around in a bag.This is a very well made water bottle and a lot of thought was put into its design; all the way down to the straw that screws into the lid (as opposed to most water bottles that would simply use pressure to hold the straw in place).The only thing I didn't care for about this water bottle is the shape of the spout (it's like drinking from a sippy cup) and the accompanying noise while drinking from this bottle.  In all fairness, I realize that this probably would not be leak proof with a regular straw shaped mouth piece and the noise is only an issue if you plan on using this water bottle in an office setting.  If you're using this water bottle for outdoor activities, the slurp, slurp, slurp sound is not likely to be an issue.

I really like this conditioner, though I have to say that I'm not too fond of the fragrance, which smells a little reminiscent of a perfume my grandmother used to wear, but it's light enough and rinses away easily enough not to be annoyed by it.Overall; this really leaves my hair feeling soft and manageable; really soft!  For reference, I have pin straight, fine (but lots of it), long hair.  Conditioner is a must for me to prevent breakage and to keep my hair from looking stringy/scraggly between brushings yet at the same time, it can be difficult to find one that doesn't weigh my hair down and leave it looking limp and oily.  So far, I've been really impressed at how my hair looks and feels since I've started using this.  With the exception of their beauty bar, I've never been a fan of the other Dove products but if I were to see this in my store (and the price were right) I would certainly consider purchasing it again in the future.  Very happy with this conditioner so far!

I really like this canvas print.  It's thick/sturdy and well stretched; the frame is of good construction.As for the reviewer who wrote that the hardware was included, I don't know if that's standard or if I've just been unfortunate?  This is actually my second print from iCanvas (one personally purchased) and I did not receive hardware in either packages; unless I'm misinterpreting this to be 'hardware to hang' and they actually meant the frame itself.  Either way, I'm not disappointed by a lack of hanging hardware, I prefer to use the 3M picture hanging strips for everything.I have to second the comment about the image being somewhat misleading.  I do wish that iCanvas would only display images that demonstrate the dimensions of the product being sold.  Minimally, they should indicate on the image somewhere clearly what print size is being displayed when shown with other objects for scale.Overall, I'm super happy with this print and look forward to purchasing more art from iCanvas in the future.

This would be a perfect set for a college student but not something you'd gift to say... a newly wed couple.  What you see is what you get.  This is an affordable, no frills, basic knife set of moderate quality and it includes a very inexpensive looking/feeling sharpener.The iPad/Book holder is a nice addition in concept but I found it difficult to use without my device tipping forward in it.  Perhaps if I removed the case I would have better luck but that's not something I'm willing to do because it's a pain in the behind to get it off and back on.  I think a better angle would have made this more of a functional feature.Overall, it's a good value for what you get and the knives included in this set are the ones that I reach for most frequently in the kitchen.  The only thing missing for me is a good pair of kitchen shears :)

I really like this shampoo, from the product all the way down to the packaging, though this is something I'd probably have passed on while shopping.  I don't know why but as a woman in her mid-thirties, the last thing I want to toss in my shopping cart is a product that suggests I need or want a "Youth Boost" :D.  Perhaps I'm just not the target demographic.The one star deduction is more or less for the formulation and fragrance.  I like a shampoo that suds a bit because it makes it easier for me to use less product in order to clean my hair.  Non-sudsy shampoo, while I understand is less harsh and cleans just as well, requires me to use a ton more product in order to wash my hair properly.  Long hair, when wet, is difficult to run your fingers through your scalp in order to distribute shampoo unless there's some suds to help lift the hair up at the root.  As for the fragrance, it's not offensive or strong, but it does remind me a little bit of a fragrance my grandmother once wore twenty-some years ago.  I'd have preferred something a little more bright and refreshing.Overall; I do like this shampoo and love that it comes in an easy to squeeze tube instead of the standard shampoo bottle.

These really exceeded my expectations.  Bought them for a Fourth of July weekend in Vegas and got soooo many compliments on them.  They're not sunglasses I'd wear all summer long but they're definitely a fun novelty.I like that there is a gradient tint to the lens, which is very flattering to the face.  My man liked these better than the ones he bought for himself (aviators with the American Flag printed on the lenses), and they also looked better on him too so... I ended up giving them to him by the end of our trip.Will definitely purchase another pair next year if I can still find them :)

Ordered the 10 Ib plates and will purchase more in the future - just wanted to get a feel for the quality of these first and so far I'm very satisfied.They arrived as a pair in one box and in fine condition.  If you plan on using these indoors, know that there is a definite odor/smell to these that will take over your living space.  I had them resting in my upstairs gym for a few days while I was having some work done in my garage and even with the gym door closed and windows open, I could smell them in my bedroom.  I'm sure they would air out eventually but I'm not sure I'd have the stomach to wait it out.  Perhaps wiping them down/washing them would help expedite the process (I didn't bother since they were going out in my garage anyways) but I would hesitate to recommend these to anyone who might intend to use them indoors, unless they have a very large and open, or well ventilated space.These don't buckle or fold over on themselves when dropped as some less expensive bumper plates can.  I feel as though these are very good quality plates for the price.  Very happy with this purchase :)

Okay...  Opening the box, I was a little underwhelmed.  I didn't think these looked very nice and one of the earrings had a visible defect (like little bumps) that slightly marred the polished silver look.  Removing these earrings from the box also had me concerned because that's when I also realized that the curved posts are extremely soft/bendable; in other words, these earrings feel cheap.The reason for my 5 star review?  Well... they simply look stunning on.  These are seriously the most flattering drop earrings I've ever worn.  They're just the right length - not too long or too short and they really flatter my jaw and neckline.  For this price, I can overlook the fact that these perhaps aren't the greatest quality.  They're cute and flirty earrings that will dress up virtually any outfit.  If I lost these, I could see myself purchasing a second pair.***Edit***Had to drop these down to one star :(  I loved them soooo much and had set them aside to wear for an upcoming weekend trip well...  the day of my trip, I went to put them on (no problem) and then I went to put the backstops on and the earring literally broke into two pieces.  I'd have been willing to leave this a 4 star review if it had broken as a result of me fussing to get the backstop on as I knew the metal was notably soft when I had tried them on the first time; however, I never even got so far as to touch the backstop to the back of the earring.  I was just feeling around with my free hand for the point of the earring when it broke and dropped to the ground; there was virtually no pressure applied whatsoever.  I could not recommend these earrings at all knowing that they break so easily and although they're inexpensive and I loved how they looked on me, I wouldn't purchase a replacement.  I may look for a similar earring but by a different manufacturer.

My only regret is that I hadn't purchased this one first.  I had originally bought another bar that was substantially less expensive but did not meet expectations and was not appropriate for olympic style lifting as advertised.I like that the collars are pinned, not bolted on this barbell.  Additionally, the knurling on this bar is perfect.  You get a good grip and it's not super aggressive on your hands.The bar I received does look slightly different than what's shown.  There is a red decorative CFF trim on both sides of the bar and the ends of the bar doesn't have the black and white logo shown in the picture, but rather an American flag image with a CFF overlay.

I thought these were very well made t-shirts.  The material seems a little thin, which isn't horrible if worn as an undershirt, and has a reasonable weight to it.  Unfortunately, these were much, much bigger than I was expecting them to be.  My SO normally wears a size M in shirts but he was practically swimming in these; I definitely should have sized down.  They're a bit wide in the shoulders and are extremely long.  I get that they're meant to 'stay fit' when tucked in but unless you're tall, it's just too much material if you fall on the shorter side of the height spectrum (as we both do).Since they're too big for him to wear, I've been using them as night shirts and they're perfect in that regard.  They're very soft and comfy to sleep in.  They hit me about mid-thigh and I'm 5'4".

I really liked the idea of this Veggie and Herb kit and was super excited to receive this; so much so that I went out and purchased a raised garden bed by Greenes (review to come) to start a modestly small garden :)Unfortunately, I've come to realize a little too late that I either don't have a green thumb or these pods are mostly duds.  About half of them never even sprouted :(  Additionally, I didn't realize that they only contained one plant per potter but I suppose that makes sense for spacing purposes.  For some reason, I thought there would be a few seeds per pod.I think these pods might be good if you just want a few small veggies or herb plants to keep in planters but if you're looking to start even a modestly small garden, you'd be better off purchasing seeds or plants that have already been started (which is what I'm going to end up doing since it's already late in the season)

I'm extremely satisfied with this product.  I know there are quite a few negative reviews that have been written about this product containing sugar as a sweetener but for me, that's a positive.  I was explicitly searching for a flavored, protein supplement from a reputable seller that did not contain stevia or some form of artificial sweetener.Since I use this to supplement my protein needs in my already healthy diet and because I have a very active lifestyle; the super small, negligible amount of sugar that this adds to my day is not even worth batting an eye at.  I love that this product isn't cloyingly sweet; I can actually drink this :)One scoop with 8 ounces of unsweetened vanilla almond milk is my go to mix and equals a whopping 25g protein and only 160 calories.  Yum!

Received 2, 1 oz samples of these with my June 2015 PopSugar Must Have box.  I don't have much of a sweet tooth but I woke up this morning feeling a little dehydrated from the night before (celebrated the start of the weekend a little too hard...); coupled with a 3 hour long fitness class and I was feeling rather miserable.  Water alone just wasn't cutting it.I tore into the sour gummies and they really did hit the spot; along with more water...  Feeling much better.  They did leave a bit of weird after-taste and I'm not sure if it's the candy itself or the sour flavoring.  I'll know after I try the berry flavored ones but I don't plan on touching them anytime soon.In hindsight, I probably could have done just as well with a bottle of gatorade but these just happened to be on hand and didn't require a trip to the store.  They definitely win over a sports drink in terms of size and you could easily store a box of these in your cupboard and toss a pack in your purse or gym bag as needed (aside from my water bottle and shaker bottle for the occasional protein shake, I don't really want to lug around an electrolyte drink for the rare occasion where I feel it would benefit me).I would definitely purchase these just to keep a few on hand but I'm going to wait until I've tried the berry ones to see if I like the flavor of those better.  Overall; I think these are reasonable as a quick electrolyte fix and although they have 15 grams of sugar, I for one appreciate that it's actual sugar and not some artificial sweetener.

I'm going to give this a 5 star review although I think the design/colors are horrid, lol.  I think the apple and pear design is the only one I really like but then again, style is highly subjective.The 5 star review is because this is a very nice, high quality kitchen towel and assuming all of their other designs are made equally as well, I would definitely recommend this to friends/family.  Unlike the last set of kitchen towels that I received where the design was printed/stamped onto the fabric, the fabric on this towel has been dyed in order to create the desired image.  The fabric remains soft and absorbent on both sides.  Overall, this is a generously sized kitchen towel and feels luxurious to touch.  My only complaint is that I do think $8 is a bit pricey for one kitchen towel, no matter how well made.  I'd be more likely to consider purchasing these if they came in packages of 2 at a slightly discounted price (ex: 2 for $14.99).

Okay.  I'm sure I'm not the only one who purchases their bath tissue on price/affordability alone because...  toilet paper is toilet paper, right?  Well I stand corrected.  I honestly didn't expect this to be any different or better than my store brand and I primarily chose this product because I knew I'd make use of it eventually.  Now that I've used it, I can honestly say that this is truly an ultra plush, luxurious bath tissue and it's FAR superior to what I have been using.  It makes my store brand bath tissue seem on par with the flimsy tissue we use in our office restrooms :-/.I actually DO have a preference now for this bath tissue over the one I have been purchasing and would consider purchasing this over my store brand.  Whether or not I will depends on how much more it costs over my current brand.  I've yet to do a side by side price check but will do so this weekend when I make it out to the market.

Very cute and my niece absolutely loves playing with these.  She's recently taken an interest to origami but it's still a little too complex for her tiny hands to master; this AmiGami set has helped satiate her interest and is much easier for her to play with and create!The only thing I wish this set came with was some sort of carrying case for everything to be stored in though a giant ziplock bag works just fine.  Since there are other figures that can be purchased, it might be nice if Mattel offered official carrying cases for these.  I could definitely see these becoming popular to collect for young, school aged kids - especially if kids find a way to turn it into some sort of trading game to swap out the different accessories.

This is a beautifully made Children's Cookbook and definitely gift worthy for any young, aspiring chef (heck - I love this cookbook!)  The recipes are easy to follow and each come with pictures of the finished dish.  Different cooking techniques are also covered in detail and most of the recipes also include pictures to demonstrate the step by step instructions along the way.On a side note...  If your child can't operate small or basic kitchen appliances on their own with supervision, I'd highly recommend "Kids Cooking: A Very Slightly Messy Manual" as the recipes are designed to split up tasks between the adult/parent and child.  This cookbook assumes your child can perform certain tasks that very young cooks may not be able to perform.  You could take it upon yourself to partition these tasks yourself, but your young cook might get bored watching you perform most of the tasks since these recipes are a bit more sophisticated.  This cookbook would be ideal for children who can do at least one or more of the following with supervision: use sharp knives, use the stove/oven, and/or operate small kitchen appliances.

I'm not a fan of strongly scented air fresheners or floral scents in general but this is quite lovely.  The best way I can describe shimmer would be a light floral with a hint of sweetness to it.  This doesn't have the typical 'febreze' scent, which I don't at all care for.  Perfect for refreshing my house after cooking foods that tend to linger in the air longer than you want, such as fish and fried foods.  Seems to do a good job at actually eliminating these odors and I like that the scent doesn't last forever; just a few hours.  Very happy with this air freshener and would purchase if sold at my local market.

Love this polish!  So cute and perfect for summer :)  I normally shy away from sparkle infused polishes; not because I'm perhaps pushing that boundary of being too old to wear sparkles... but because they can be a real pain in the rear when it comes to application.  I did need several coats in order to get the look that I wanted but this was still several coats less than my other sparkly polish that I purchased last summer.  You'll definitely want a top coat for this, otherwise it'll be a bit rough to the touch.  Really like the look of this polish; it's fun, sparkly, and would probably layer well on top of another polish if you wanted to just add some interest.

These are nice but perhaps a bit overpriced IMO at about $5 a towel.  They're thin and the design is stamped onto the fabric with some sort of paint product as opposed to the fabric being dyed; so the design is rough to the touch, doesn't assist with absorbency, and will chip/fade when washed.  They are made out of cotton, so care should be taken when washing in order to avoid shrinking.For decorative purposes, they'll do just fine but they're not so great for drying hands or dishes with unless you flip them inside out and use the non-patterned side.  Overall, they're cute but I'd only feel good about buying these if they were about $3 max per towel (or) $12 for 4 given their quality.  Not something I would gift either as they do feel a little cheap.

Finally, a dog treat my dog will EAT :)My shitzu may be the world's most fickle eater; he even turns his nose up to table scraps!  Anyways, these treats sure are smelly but he loves them and that makes me happy.  I was disappointed at first since initially, he wouldn't give them a try (though he did flop over and roll around on it...  I wasn't too thrilled about that, lol) but after a couple of days of it sitting out he did eventually eat it.  The second one he ate after just a day or two and now he literally does backflips when I ask if he wants a "treat" and inhales them in less than a minute.  I give him half, sometimes just a quarter of one, every other day or so.Really happy to have found a treat for my dog and the fact that it's healthy for him is icing on the cake!  I highly recommend these :)

My patio had become overgrown with moss and this spray did the trick and fast too!Personally, I probably would not order this in the future but that's only because I didn't realize this wasn't a hand pump, spray bottle until it was already on its way to me.  While the hose sprayer bottle is convenient for taking care of large surface areas; it's just not ideal for me based on the layout of my yard and where my garden hose can reach.  I would definitely purchase this if it was sold as a concentrate that you could dilute yourself and add to a pressure-pump style sprayer.Overall, it works and it won't kill other nearby ornamental plants like bleach/water will.  If you don't mind that you need to use a garden hose with this, then I would highly recommend giving it a try.

A nice fragrance but a lot more earthy than I had expected; I didn't get any notes of asian pear or bergamot (I loveeee earl grey, so I was hopeful) on my skin.  Alas, it may simply be my body chemistry not playing nice.While I enjoy this fragrance and personally, I don't find it too strong, it's simply not something I'd wear regularly.  It's definitely a woman of a certain age type of fragrance; not young but also not my mother or grandmother's perfume...  it's a little "serious".  I feel most comfortable wearing this in the office on days where I'm dressed to impressed for an important board meeting or conference.Beautiful bottle and good longevity.  Try this one out first if you can before purchasing if possible.

This is hands down the BEST travel mug I've ever owned.  The locking mechanism on the lid ensures that it won't accidently open if you toss this in your bag (which I do - often).  This mug does NOT leak! :D  Keeps your coffee hot for hours and the lid is super easy to clean thoroughly with the help of a small brush.The only thing I was slightly disappointed about was the color of my mug.  I ordered the Polar White and expected a bright white color.  Polar White is actually more of a grey color with a slight shimmer.  Not worth crying over, it just isn't what I expected to receive based on the photo and color description.  Overall, I'm super happy with this purchase :).

I once owned an xshot (and probably still do... I just for the life of me can't remember where I put it) that I absolutely loved!  Since I had a mini-vaca coming up and wanted a selfie stick to bring along for group photos with friends, I was thrilled to find this in my queue - perfect timing!While this is definitely a well made product and for my intended use, it certainly did its job - this was probably a bit overkill and at $50, wayyy to expensive.  In its collapsed form, it was also much larger/bulkier than I had envisioned.  This isn't something you just toss in your purse unless you're sporting an oversized bag.  I think for the average person, operating a compact point and shoot camera, a less expensive, less bulky version of this is all you're going to want or need.If you're a more serious photographer and you plan on balancing a really expensive camera on the end of a 'stick' - this beast of a monopod is probably what you'll want and I'm guessing you probably won't mind dishing out 50 shells for something that's sturdy enough to safely secure your cam.  Additionally, XSories offers some interesting accessories for their monopods which I think helps make this product more versatile for the more serious photographer.

This grass seed is nothing short of amazing!I have a sunny backyard and shady front and had to reseed both after a rough winter left part of my front yard torn up from plow trucks and my spring cleaning efforts (tree removal) left most of my backyard bare.  This seed was perfect for restoring my yard - it's growing wonderfully well, front and back.  I was worried about not being able to water my yard often enough as I've also been bogged down with a lot of travel but these seeds do seem to hold on to water well as advertised (I've gone multiple days at a time without watering).  I'm also thrilled at how quickly these seeds germinate.  I started to see green shoots by about day 3 or 4, which I think is really fast.Overall, I'm really happy to have received this order.  Since I have to reseed my yard (at least the front) every spring, I will definitely be purchasing this product in the future.  Highly recommend!

I agree with the advice provided in this book but it did occur to me that I had read this advice before in "Crucial Conversations: Tools for Talking when Stakes are High".  Both books approach a similar strategy for creating a win/win situation, building and strengthening relationships and, in the process, eliminating fighting along the way.  However, it's my personal opinion that Crucial Conversations does a better job at providing the reader with the tools needed in order to take this knowledge and apply it in real life.The three stars is because I 100% agree with the advice that's presented in this book and I know that it works because I've applied these very same concepts to my relationships at work, at home, with family and friends.  Make no mistake about it; it takes a lot of work and commitment to start applying these changes to your behavior and how you interact with others but the results speak for themselves.  Long-term, it becomes easier and easier to address perceived conflicts from a place of love, understanding, and mutual respect.The two star deduction is because even though I was nodding my head in agreement as I read through this book, I realized that I was filling in a lot of knowledge gaps on the how-to aspect of applying these changes from the Crucial Conversations book.  I'm not ashamed to admit it... I need a LOT of hand holding when it comes to applying new concepts and I simply thought that C.C. did a better job in that regard.The other reason why I took a star deduction is because I felt the use of bible quotes was a bit heavy handed and for the most part, added little to no value besides taking up page space.  I am Christian and do appreciate a well-placed bible quote as much as any other well-placed quote.  When used sparingly, I think they can offer a welcome pause and some mindful thinking/self reflection amongst a tome of text.  Unfortunately, they were overused in this book and I felt they ultimately took away from the overall message being presented.  Sometimes less is more.

I'm very particular about my conditioners since I have baby fine, pin straight hair that is easily weighed down and will show any amount of product buildup quickly as limp, stringy locks.  At the same time, my long locks can't forgo conditioner altogether, otherwise it turns into a tangled mess.I'm very satisfied with this conditioner in that it does a great job at conditioning my hair, without weighing it down.  It has a very mild scent and I like the color; pale green, that makes me think of avocados :0).The front of the bottle indicates that it's a "plant based bottle" and for some reason that's a bit of a turnoff for me.  It seems gimmicky and I suppose it makes me think that the manufacturer is promoting the packaging rather than the product and that it's an indirect way of saying "our product itself is meh but... ENVIRONMENT!".  Of course, having had an opportunity to use this conditioner for awhile now, I do think it's a good product and I would purchase it again if I saw it at my local store.

I was really excited about receiving this product but after giving it a whirl, I've come to the conclusion that this is one of those novelty appliances that will take up space and rarely be used (at least in my household).The air-fryer appealed to me because I try and maintain a healthy diet free of most processed/convenience foods.  I was sold on the idea of being able to enjoy some home-made fried foods without all of the excess oil.  Needless to say, I was disappointed to later learn that this appliance is primarily for heating pre-fried, frozen, convenience foods (in other words: frozen chicken nuggets, frozen onion rings, frozen french fries, frozen pizza logs, etc...),  In fact, the instructions are written primarily for these frozen convenience foods - with times for cooking these various items, including 'frozen pizza logs' printed along the top of the appliance.  In my opinion, this is akin to battering your own foods, deep frying it in oil, then reheating your leftovers in this appliance and declaring it 'healthier' in comparison to the batch that came straight from the fryer.If you're looking to make 'air-fried' fried foods from scratch your options from the enclosed cookbook include potato fries and kale chips (I'm tempted to give the kale chips a try but I question how well these would actually turn out after my fries attempt...).I made fries from raw potatoes using the enclosed instructions and the results were mediocre at best.  After the first round of cooking, which involved a good shake of the basket mid-ways through, the fries were definitely cooked through but floppy, not crisp.  Adding a little extra time just charred the outside edges but still resulted in floppy, soft fries.  They tasted fine but you can get the exact same, if not better, results from a standard oven.  I'm guessing frozen fries would come out better since they really only need to be heated through, not actually cooked.On a final note, this appliance smells... bad.  Perhaps it will dissipate with use but as another reviewer mentioned, it does smell like burning insulation.  I really would not recommend this product to anyone.  Two stars is a generous rating.

This game is an excellent puzzle game that can literally keep you playing for a quite some time. I just downloaded it to try it out and he game sucked me in. In a matter of minutes I was so into the game I forgot what I was doing. The objective of the game is to connect all of the shapes together without crossing the lines from other shapes. On occasions you can cross them. The game seems so simple and yet somehow traps you within.PRO's:+ No Ads+ Beautiful design+ No intrusive permissions+ Full Immersive mode (At least on my Nexus 4)+ Lots of puzzles+ Each level difficulty increases graduallyCON's:- Honestly non that I can think of.Conclusion:Even if this game wasn't part of the FAOTD I would've picked it up if I knew about it. The game is beautifully designed and runs silky smooth. This is a keeper in my book. This game is great for all ages. Kid friendly for all the parents out there. I say its at least worth a shot as the FAOTD app. If you read this while it's up them snatch it up while you can. Enjoy.

I bought this case as a replacement to my Poetic Borderline Bumper Case that I had on my Nexus 4. I gave it some time to write my review just to see if the things I read about this case were true. Most of these reviews really bring this case down hard. In the time that I've been using it, I've only found that one of the bad things that I read from all those reviews really stand true.I'm a very picky person when it comes to using a case on my phone. I would only put the case on my phone when I really felt like I was going to need it. If I was going to be home I would take off an case that I had on it. I never really found a case that I could just keep on the phone at all times. I had multiple different cases for my Nexus 4 and none lasted more then a day before I would take them off. That is until this case came along.When I bought my Nexus 4 more then a year ago, they were sold out of the official OEM bumper case. It just so happens that every time that I looked for it they were sold out. So I went and tried a good variety of cases for my phone. Until I landed with the poetic. After having for about 7 months it started falling apart on me. It took quite a beating though so I don't blame it. I got it replaced and that one got chewed up by my dog one day when I took it off. I saw this one and at half the price of the OEM I thought I would be getting a good deal. Turns out that I was right.My best friend & share many common interests. We had the same phone. He got his OEM original bumper when he ordered the phone. When I got this one we compared the 2 and found almost no difference. This case is about as it gets to the real thing. If you wan the original bumper without having to pay double the price then you found it here.PRO's:+ Solid Build.+ Excellent Feel.+ Looks Great.+ Blends in with the phone.+ Doesn't take away from the amazing feel of the Nexus 4.CON's:- Headphone jack is a tight fit for some headphones, and others don't fit at all.- The silver lining & buttons do start to show wear after a while.Conclusion:Mine still looks like it just came out of the box. On the corners of the case it does show some very minor signs of wear. Nothing that anyone can notice. That and the headphone jack being a bit small were the only 2 things that I found to be true from other reviewers. Nothing that's really a deal breaker here. In fact I would recommend this to anyone looking to get a new bumper case for their Nexus 4. If you wan the official look & feel of the original, you found what you are looking for. This is an excellent product that I will continue to enjoy until it finally breaks on me. Hope you guys enjoy.

(Note: OXA was kind enough to send me a review unit for review purposes. This doesn't affect my review in any way.)For a lot of people out there a keyboard accessory is the perfect accessory for tablet. many people don't like typing on such a big screen. I'm one of those that doesn't like typing on the big screen. When it comes to buying a bluetooth keyboard for your phone or tablet, there are a few things to look at. For me personally, I look for a few this in a keyboard.Things I Keep in Mind:- Look- Feel- Functionality- DurabilityThose are the 4 main things that I look for when I look for a keyboard accessory. Currently I have 2 keyboards for my main tablet. This one that was sent to me by OXA for review purposes and a Poetic leather keyboard case hybrid. They both have their ups and their downs. I personally perfer the OXA aluminum for really just personal reasons that I'll explain. They're both good keyboards, but they have VERY different styles.Look:OXA - An aluminum body that looks and feels very sturdy. Gives it a nice stylish look to it that can make any tablet look like a mini laptop. In the 4 weeks of testing that I've had with it, so many people have confused my tablet for a laptop. Even my friends and family that have seen my tablet many times before were confused by it.Poetic - Since this is a keyboard/case hybrid, it does come with some advantages. When it's closed it looks like a bible with the leather exterior. This sure makes it a lot easier when you leave your backpack, purse, or carrying case at home. Nobody will think of this as a tablet. When it's opened though, the story is completely different. When I had it sitting on a table or desk open, most people confused it for a laptop as well. Although I don't know why. I don't know about you, but I've never seen a leather laptop.Both of these keyboards look great and both get a perfect score here.Feel:OXA - First off I have to say the aluminum is a nice touch. This keyboard is in my opinion "The Best Out There". The keys are spaces just right. Not to close that your hands feel cramped, but not so far that you feel like you have to reach for everything. Everything is easy to reach and th keyboard feels like a very premium keyboard. The keys pop out of the aluminum body well. The body is indented where the keys are to level everything out evenly. They have a good amount of push so that you know when you click each key.Poetic - This keyboard is more cramped then the OXA keyboard even though the overall size of the keyboard are exactly the same. I'm not saying it's a bad keyboard to type with, but if you have bigger hands you'll most likely perfer the OXA keyboard. The keys feel great to press as well. The main thing that hold this keyboard back is the leather body. Although it gives it a very premium feel and makes it lighter, I got tired of the leather feel rather quickly.If your main concern is with how the keyboard feels then i think the OXA keyboard is better for you. It just feels better.Functionality:OXA - This one was built with both operating systems in mind. Having dedicated keys that work for both iOS and Android. Beeing able to control music without leaving what you're doing is a huge plus. Although both keyboard do this well, this one just does it better. There is little to no lag from when you press a key to when the tablet reacts.Poetic - Although it has most of the same functions, OXA's keyboard just does them better. I have seen some hickups here and there with this keyboard. Often when you first start typing with this one the first letter or 2 don't seem to register.Durability:OXA - When I look at this keyboard, it looks like it can take some good amount of damage before it will break. When you hold it in your hands it has the feel down packed. But unfortunately, the first one that I recieved came pretty much falling apart. OXA was kind enough to send me a replacement really quickly. Great customer support. The fact that it came falling apart tell me that you don't want to store this is a tight place.Poetic - This is one durable keyboard. They say it's splash proof. I want to call is waterproof. I had an incedent where i spilled water all over it and nothing happened. Lets face it OXA's might be able to survive a fall here and there but I don't think it's waterproof. Plus, this one is flexible.In durability Poetic takes the win.Conclusion:Both of these are exelent keyboard for any tablet that you might have. If you want better performance, go with the the OXA keyboard. If you happen to be a klutz, then you're better off with the Poetic. I have them both and I use them both. I wrote this review using my table with the OXA keyboard and it didn't take me more then a few minutes to write. If you can afford it, get them both. Overall I'd have to give it to the OXA keyboard. It's up to you to decide. The info is there, you decide which one is better for you. Hope you guys found this helpful. Thanks for reading. Enjoy!

(Note: I received this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This doesn't affect my review in any way.)Before these I already had a good collection of stylus that I had bought for my phones and tablets. Some were good, but none fit the bill of what I was really looking for. So I started collecting them. Most of them either the tip fell off or fell out of my pocket and got lost somewhere because the clips became extremely lose quickly.These are excellent quality. The clip has remained sturdy, and the you'd are still very fresh. The tips are made of Micro-Knit fiber hybrid. I'm personally a big fan of these types of tips because they slide across your phone or tablet's screen with no resistance at all. This makes for great ease of use.Many other types of tips don't have this ease of flow. It's great for swiping on your keyboard or even for swipe based games. It makes this games easier to play if they only require one handed play. Not to mention that it doesn't leave any marks on your phone's display.I've personally bean using these to play games on my phone and even to navigate my phone. In fact this review was written using theses. Straight from my personal phone and only took a few minutes to write, or swipe I should say.I personal feel like they should've added just a bit more weight to it, but that's just a personal preference. It's made of aluminum so you would think it would weigh more. I feel like if I toss it up in the air when I get bored that it won't come back down. It's definitely a much better build quality then this $1 - $2 cheap stylus.PRO's:+ Excellent build quality.+ Slides across the screen with ease.+ Great for games.+ Leaves absolutely no marks on the screen.CON's:- Could be just a bit heavier.Conclusion:This is a great buy for anyone looking for a good stylus. The ease if use and great build makes it one of the best choices around. Hope you guys like it and I hope I helped you decide. Thanks for reading. Enjoy!

(Note: This product was given to me in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. This doesn't affect my review in any way.)This is the perfect accessory for an iPhone 5/5s. It's no secret that the iPhone 5 and 5s have three major problems. Well this case deals with 2 of those. Number 1 the iPhone's poor battery life. I'm always hearing my friends complaining about how bad battery life is on their iPhone. Number 2 is the new lightning port. If your cable breaks you can't use that old cable you still have from the older models.This case fixes both of those issues. LifeCharge battery case holds a 2300mAh battery that extends the battery life of your iPhone by just over double the battery. The way it handles the other problem is by simply covering the lighting port. Since it is connected via the lighting port you can charge your phone with a normal Micro USB port on the case itself.When you charge the case, if your phone isn't fully charged it will charge the phone first and then the case will start charging. In my experience the case charges really fast. With this case on you don't have to worry about that lighting cable that you broke. You have yourself an easier way to charge your phone now. Since almost everything now a days uses a micro USB.The case has a built-in light indicator to show you how much battery is left in the tank.4 lights = 100 - 75%3 lights = 74 - 50%2 lights = 49 - 25%1 light = 24 - 1%What's in the box:- iPhone 5/5s case- Micro USB charging cable- InstructionsPRO's:+ Slim Case.+ More then doubles battery life.+ Charges fast.+ No more Lightning cable issues.+ Doesn't add much bulk to the phone.+ Has a light indicator on the back to know how much juice it has left.CON's:- Those of you will extremely small hands might not like the added bulk (even though it barely adds anything).Conclusion:If you have an iPhone 5/5s this is a case that I would recommend 9/10 if not 10/10 times. It's an excellent case for anyone. No real CON's here. If you want to get more out of your phone each day this is the way to go. Hope you guys enjoy & thanks for reading.

(Note: This product was given to me in exchange for it and honest and unbiased review. This is not affect my review in any way.)Theoretically this should be able to fully charge my phone, and still have 500 mAh left. But that's just theoretically. In reality this can really only charge my phone about halfway. This portable charger sports a 2600 mAh battery. My phone sports a 2100 mAh battery. When it comes to a battery heat plays a big role. This portable charger heats up extremely fast. To the point where if you're holding it in your hand it will sweat and it becomes uncomfortable to hold. It's because of this heat that this portable charger to charge my phone past 50%.In reality you could say this portable charger is only about 1100 mAh. My thoughts on the reason why it heats up so quickly is simply the choice of material it's made of. It's made of aluminum and on such a small little product can conduct a ton of heat quickly. I've used this portable charger about 4 times now and its never got my phone past 50%. I usually start charging it when it gets around 5% and this usually runs out of juice at around 49%.Now I wouldn't say this is a bad product, I just wouldn't recommend it to anyone who is looking to double their battery life. This is more of an emergency backup power. If you think of it as just an emergency backup power then this might be worth it, but as for me its not. OXA has multiple other products that are much better than this and give you more bang for your buck.PRO's:+ Great Emergency Backup.+ Very small in comparison to others.CON's:- Heats up rather quickly.- Theoretically is 2600mAh, but in reality is only about 1100mAh.- Never charged my phone more then 50%.Conclusion:if you're looking for a small portable charger, there are better options out there. But if you're looking for just an emergency backup then this might be for you. Like I mentioned earlier if you want more bang for your buck, OXA has multiple other portable chargers. Now I'm not saying this is a bad price for this, but its just something I wouldn't buy personally. I couldn't recommend this to anyone honestly unless you're just looking for an emergency backup. I hope I help you guys out deciding whether or not you want to buy this or any other OXA product out there. I have other reviews for other OXA products on my profile if you just click on my name. More reviews are also on the way really soon. Thanks for reading and enjoy.

Honestly if this wasn't a free app of the day, I don't think I would be spending $2 to buy it. Although I do agree that it's a fun app, it's just an Angry Birds Knock-off. It's like an Angry Birds: Explosive Cat Edition.The objective of the game is extremely simple. Rescue a cat while collecting suns. You have a set timer on the explosive cat so you have to collect all the suns and get to the car in need before that time goes out. As you keep going the levels get more and more challenging. There is a currency in the game to get power ups to help you throughout the levels.PRO's:+ Familiar Gameplay+ Somewhat Challenging+ Nice Graphics+ Smooth Gameplay+ Nice Music.CON's:- Music is nice, but it's one of those things that get annoying quickly.- Angry Birds KnockoffWhy buy this at $2 when you could get any of the Angry Birds for free?Conclusion:I don't see myself playing this game much if at all after this review. If it wasn't the FAOTD I wouldn't have waisted $2 to buy it. If you really like Angry Bird style games but aren't into Angry Birds then this is a good alternative. It's the FAOTD so why not give it a shot. Thanks for reading.

(Note: This product was given to me in exchange for an honest & unbiased review. This does not effect my review in any way.)When OXA offered me to review this product along with a few others that they have, I thought they had some neat products worth reviewing. As it turns out, I was right. This 8000mAh portable charger is pretty great. Now I have quite a few portable chargers from multiple different companies. You might ask yourself "why does he need any more portable chargers?" Well the answer is simple. I don't. Instead of keeping this charger, I decided to give it away to my best friend.The same day it arrived I was headed over to his house so I took it with me. When I got there we wanted to test it out. We found out some things that made us laugh while reading the box. Apparently the person who made the packaging for this product wouldn't be able to spell too save his/her life. What I mean by that is that there are a number of spelling and grammer problems on the box. Now this isn't really important, nor does it take away from this product. I just though it was something to point out.After we finished reading the box and getting a good laugh out of it we took the charger out and tested how well it could charge a couple different things he had in his room. On a single charge it managed to fully charge a PS4 remote, Sony Xperia Play, a Nexus 7, and the last 50% that his Nexus 4 needed to be fully charged. Finally it drained. That's more then what I expected out that little guy. I mean compared to others on the market it's rather small, but it has a good amount of juice. Surprisingly enough, it actually charges pretty fast for an 8000mAh battery.What's in the Box?- 8,000 mAh Portable Charger.- USB-to-Adapter Style Cord.- Multiple different adapter tips. (Micro USB, Mini USB, exc..)PRO's:+ It's strong enough to charge your phone or tablet a few times.+ Very compact size.+ Nice and Sturdy design.This isn't a bulky charger that's going to draw attention.CON's:- The box has some grammer mistakes.Conclusion:Honestly the only con there was just me nit picking. It doesn't take away from this charger in any way. If you need a good portable charger this one a great one to go with. If you have some time, and you don't need one right away I suggest checking out some of OXA's other portable chargers as I will be reviewing a few others that they have. You could compare them based on my review and others that have reviewed them as well. Thanks for reading.~ Bedjam El Patron

Note: I was given this product for free in exchange for an honest review. This does not affect my review.)At first glance this looks great, but after testing it I feel like it's a bit of a biased accessory. My initial rating was only 3 stars, and I'll tell you why in just a second. The main reason that I have it 4 stars is because my mom really enjoyed it.Now let's get on with the review. The reason my initial impressions of this was 3 stars is because I feel it's kinda biased. I feel like this us geared more towards Apple's iPhone. The pocket is really small. I put my phone in the pocket and I could barely close it.Now I don't know about you but I like to listen to music when I go in a jog. I also want to make sure my phone isn't going to fly out of my pocket. When I was offered to review this my first thought was "that's just what I needed." Unfortunately I want able to fit my phone in the pocket and close it with headphones attached. When I tried to close it, it was so tight that the zipper actually press the power button and turned off my phone. Sure I could've just left it open, but what's the good in that? For that I could've just left it in my pocket.Another reason I felt it was a bit biased. The second pocket is to store your keys. But with my phone in the first pocket, it was so tight that my keys wouldn't fit in the second one. When I tried this with an iPhone, it was a while different story. The phone and keys fit perfectly, but I'm not an iPhone user.It's not like a have a huge phone. I have a Nexus 4 as my daily driver. In the description it says that the Galaxy S4 would fit. I don't see that happening when a Nexus 4 is smaller. Now let's get on to some PRO's & CON's.PRO's:+ Holds an "iPhone" and your keys great.+ It's very durable from my testing.+ Fits around almost anyone's waist with an adjustable strap.CON's:- Rather small pockets- Feels biased (Geared towards Apple's iPhones)Conclusion: If you have an iPhone, or a small android (like one of the mini's), then this is finally something youwant if you go out got joss and need a place to store your phone and keys. If you're someone that I'd more into the bigger Android phones (4.7 inch display or higher), then you might want to look somewhere else unless you don't mind leaving the pocket open. Thanks for reading and I hope you enjoy!~Bedjam El Patron
