I store it in a gallon ziplock bag, which can hold the entire chunk. While it looks rather raw and unattractive, I have found I can use it without filtering it. That is to say, I did not find any chunks or debris in it . . . simply warm and mix it in with other natural ingredients for a natural and wonderful skin product.I am pleased with the product and feel it is an excellent value.

I am really impressed with this toothpaste, and am delighted to be able to get a Fluoride free product. I like the minty flavor, and it makes my mouth and teeth feel very clean after using it. This will be the only toothpaste I use from now on.Fluoride is a really terrible chemical, and you should avoid it in your toothpaste and your drinking water.

I tried this privacy filter but was disappointed. It does prevent viewing from the sides, but it does allow someone to look over your shoulder if standing behind you. For example, a person standing up in the seat behind you on the airplane could still read the screen. It would prevent someone in the seat next to you from seeing your screen. The other issue I have with this product is that it dramatically reduces brightness and contrast of your screen, making everything much less colorful and sharp. In the end, I will not be using this on my computer.

it is hard to find PH test strips suitable for the pH ranges of interest in hydroponic gardening. These are perfect for that application. They are quick, accurate and affordable. I have been very pleased with this product.

This is a really great coconut oil. Because of the great health benefits of coconut oil, my wife and I are working to incorporate more of this into our diet. There are times, though, that you do not want the coconut flavor. The nice thing about this oil is that it has a neutral flavor. So, we use both this and the coconut flavored oil. It is nice to have both types.This is a great oil, and we always keep it stocked in the kitchen.

My hot water heater has a pump on it, and I wanted a way to turn the pump off at night so to not pump hot water around the house at night when it is not needed. The pump is fairly high current and beyond the safety rating of most home timers, which are designed for lamps and such. I was happy to get the chance to try this switch, which is able to switch a whopping 15 amps.The unit is fairly easy to program, and the buttons are intuitive. It allows you to set on times and off times for anything connected to it. You can program it individually for each day of the week, or you can program a sequence which is the same for each day. In addition, it has a random setting, which would be useful for controlling a lamp if you are going to be away for a few days.The unit works well. The only thing I did not like is the packaging is very unfriendly, and I had trouble getting the unit out of the package even with a heavy pair of kitchen scissors. Also, the instructions are very small and hard to read. Other than that, I have been very pleased with the unit.

We eat a lot of corn on the cob, so I was happy to get the chance to use these Corn Holders. The old set we had was falling apart, so we were happy to see this set arrive in the mail.I have been impressed with this product. It is well made, and more sturdy than similar products I have had in the past. A neat feature is the holders clip together, making it easier to keep them stored neatly in a drawer, and protecting the blade parts.Overall a well designed and well executed product.

Since our daughter grew up, it is now just my wife and I left at home. We find that as often as not, we just wash dishes by hand since there are not many dishes and that is just about as easy loading and firing up the dishwasher. We had been just stacking the dishes on a towel to dry, so we were excited to get the chance to try this dish rack.We have been pleased with it. It is sturdy and well built. It is designed well. It is just the right size to wash dishes by hand for a family of two. We plan to continue to wash dishes by hand, and continue to use this product.

I had originally given this 2 stars, but after using it a few weeks, I give it 5 stars. The reason is that it gives a close comfortable shave at an affordable price. Initially I experienced some irritation on the neck, but after a few days of use, I never experienced irritation again. After using it almost a month, I can say it is a good razor for the price.The bottom line on electric razors is this. None of them will shave as close as a blade. The high end Braun electric razors with the cartridges that automatically clean the razor after each shave give the closest shave of the electric razors. The downside of these is that they cost close to $200, and the cleaning cartridges are expensive, and you end up spending as much on the cleaning cartridges as you do the razor. If you are not concerned about purchase cost, or cost of consumables, the high end Braun razors are the best.For those wanting a decent shave at an affordable price This Remington is a good option. What I like about the 3 head rotary design is that it is very good about getting all the whiskers in just a few passes on the face. In fact, I find that it is better than the Braun at getting all the whiskers and not leaving missed patches. It actually takes me less time to shave with this Remington than with my high end Braun.So, after using for some time, I can give this razor a thumbs up as giving a good close shave at a reasonable price.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I have been using electric razors for over ten years, and always have my eye out for an affordable option that will give good results. This razor caught my eye because it is a name brand and priced under $30.Unfortunately, I was not able to get acceptable results from this razor. I have used it for several days and it is causing irritation and razor burn on my neck. On the remainder of my face it is not causing irritation, but it is not giving a close shave. In saying the shave is not close, I am comparing to other electric razors. By the afternoon, I have noticeable stubble.I would suggest spending more and getting a Braun electric razor.

This is a pretty good bug killer. I have used it in the greenhouse, and it appears to knock out the advertised bugs pretty well. It is a nice big can with a good capacity. I have been pleased with the product so far.

This is a great pizza stone that fits perfectly into the Breville BOV800XL smart oven, With it, you can make really first rate pizza in the Breville. It is also very good to use for making bread in the Breville. I am very pleased with this product.

For the most part a good interface on the Fire TV. My one complaint is that when you want to see items in a saved list, unless that list is one of the three on the left-hand side menus (meaning it is one of the three most recently viewed lists), if you click on the list it will automatically start playing the first video. Then to see the other items in the list you need to scroll down while that first video is still playing. I would rather not have to watch/hear the first video in a list every time and just want to see the list. Other than that the app works great.

Very easy to use, quick and accurate. Gives you your pulse/heart rate and your pulse oxygen saturation percentage. Requires two AAA batteries not included. One thing to pay attention is when putting in the batteries it looks like both are supposed to go in the same direction. But the positive end is the opposite for each battery. Some reviews have complained the screen looks scratchy or scuffed. That's because there is a thin plastic layer you are supposed to peel off that's covering the screen. I got this so I could see if I was getting my heart rate up enough while running on the treadmill and using the elliptical. Great way to spot check if your particular machine doesn't have a reader. Recommended.

As far as taste, I really like the strong coffee flavor. I have never tasted so much coffee in a granola snack bar before, it's really good. I've had other flavor Kind bars before and they are usually pretty good and pretty nutritious, this one is actually my favorite flavor of the bunch. The only problem I have with this bar is the texture, as someone who easily gets food trapped in their teeth, this bar is difficult for me. Many of the grains in this bar are very small and seed like which is a sure fire way to get food stuck. If you don't ever have food stick issues I wouldn't worry about it, it's just for us with sensitive teeth issues that should proceed with caution and armed with brushing and flossing equipment.

Rites of Passage pulls you in after the first few pages and never lets go. Our hero, Sam, is going to be one of the first five girls to enroll at a military academy. But, big problem, no one wants her there. The local townspeople, the other male students, and the faculty. It's pretty clear she is going to receive hell as she tries to make it through and graduate. But she comes from a military family. Her father is a highly respected Colonel, her oldest brother has achieved status in the academy, and before committing suicide for unknown reasons her other older brother was also at the academy. Sam wants to make her father and her family proud. You're immediately rooting for Sam after the first chapter but you already known it's not going to be easy. For coming of age fans who like military/school theme books this is recommended.

In Material Girls teens rule the fashion industry and decide what's in and what's out. But it's a cut throat world and as one of our heroes, Marla, finds out, even at seventeen you can be over the hill. Marla goes from being on the fashion court that listens to designers (drafters) pitch their concepts and decides whether they are worthy to being a mere drafter herself after she can no longer vote along with the rest of the court. She and others are starting to rebel against the decisions of the powers that be and want more individuality. Our other hero, Ivy, is a pop singer who also needs to stay on top of trends to keep her career on top. The book is easy to read and I liked the basic concept. I wouldn't read a sequel, but it's a unique take on the dystopian genre. I would have given it 3.5 stars if it were possible. If you're really into fashion and trends this is more likely to be up your alley.

Classic Callaway golf balls. These are 90 compression and have a good feel coming off of my Diablo Edge clubs. This is a good value for the price. Pros won't use these, but for a casual golfer these work great.

No spoilers here so the short review is: I liked it. The setup is we find our hero, Dexter, confined in a maximum security prison for murders he actually did not commit. He's in the cell for weeks until finally a public defendant comes to see him. The case being put up against and the procedures are irregular. Something is not quite right. Deborah doesn't even come to visit Dexter until a few weeks have passed and then it's just to have Dexter sign papers giving her custody of his kids. Things do not look good for our hero. This last book flows wonderfully. All of Dexter's wit and darkness are here and the writing is crisp. This last book may not end the way everyone wants it to but I enjoyed taking a ride with the mind of Dexter for one last trip. For those expecting this book to pick up where the tv series left off it does not. The show and book did not match up so there are characters and events that happened differently. There is a very brief recap of previous events in the first few pages but you may want to go back to get a better idea of what's happened. Not essential because of the recap but why not delve a little further into Dexter's world given the chance? Dexter was a delightfully sinister character and for that I'm recommending the book to fans of the Dexter books. Hopefully this review helps a little in making your decision!

I buy this on a regular basis and find it works very well at moisturizing especially during cold and dry weather. This has basically no scent which I like. It goes on somewhat creamy and you will feel a bit of a coating afterwards. But I find there's no way around that if you want something that is hydrating and protecting your skin from cold dry air. I wish it had absolute 'transparency' after it is applied but don't see how that's possible and it probably wouldn't work as well as it did. Overall I recommend this for someone who wants a no scent good moisturizer.

Fantastic! This is one of the best collections of Basquiat paintings available. I was able to see the exhibition this book is based on and the selection of artworks was worthy of a museum showing. This book is beautifully printed in a large 10x12 inch format in full color with a sturdy hardcover binding. Whether you already have a number of Basquiat books or this is your first one this is a must-have and highly recommended. Of the Basquiat books currently in print this is easily the best one available. Five stars!

Good for golf. I use this to measure closest to the hole distances. I used to use a metal measure but after a while the water on the grass from early mornings starts to rust the metal and eventually it doesn't roll in and out so good. This vinyl measure so far works great and time will tell how long it will hold up. For now I like it and recommend it.

When the lashes arrived I was pleased with the entire presentation. I love that they come in their own compact. Whenever I've worn false lashes in the past it's always come in a rinky dink packaging which never gave proper storage to reuse. The Georgie set treat the lashes as the delicate precious little lashes they are. This is one instance where packaging is actually important to the product. I like the little how to on the inside pamphlet, it's instructive an actually very encouraging. I like the line: "Take your time when learning to apply. You'll catch on in no time." And they are right, it's not that easy when you first try as with any faux lash, but once you get the hang of it, it's super fun and my new favorite party accessory. I've only worn them twice but I feel like they are going to last a good while longer. They seem to be well made and the glue is non irritant and vegan so I don't worry like I might with other products about eye infection.I would definitely recommend these lashes for anyone looking for an extra spruce to their party look. The presentation is so lovely I would even say they are worthy of a gift for a stylish girlfriend.

If you haven't read any other reviews then don't! Many reviews mention right up front how the book starts and personally I would have found that to be a bit of a spoiler. It's fun to read and experience yourself how a book starts versus someone stating in a sentence what happens. Because this book is so well written it's hard not to want to tell everyone what's going to happen. For an advance review I can safely say this book looks at the idea of humans traveling and living in space. Is it possible? What problems might come up? How would people change and adapt to their new environment? That's just the beginning of this long book which never gets boring. There's enough detail to make the world and characters come alive and enough action to keep the story moving. Read the first three pages.You're either hooked and if not this book is probably not for you. I couldn't stop reading this and while early in the year this could end up on some sci-fi top ten lists.

This is a good, basic fried rice using soy sauce as the main base of the recipe. It has chicken, eggs, onion, mushroom, peppers, peas and carrots sprinkled throughout. Compared to home made or restaurant fried rice this one is much more mushy since it only comes to life after being soaked in water. The textures in the rice and chicken are not the same as home made but I expect that in freeze dried meals. The more important issue is the taste and this is fine. For dietary concerns this one is higher in cholesterol at 100mg/33% DV and sodium at 600mg/25% DV.

I have tried quite a few Mountain House meals and this is one of the better ones. It's a tomato based sauce with rice, beef, and some peppers. I've found that the best tasting meals are the tomato sauce ones. This has a mild but pleasant flavor. The beef is ok but has mushy texture which is consistent with all the other beef freeze dried meals I've tasted. Some of the Mountain House meals can be a bit of a shock when you look at the nutrition facts but this one is quite reasonable. The only percentage that might be high for some people is the sodium at 590mg per serving (25% DV). Overall I enjoyed this and will keep one in my emergency stock.

The Book of Speculation introduces to the story's hero, Simon Watson, who finds a package on his doorstep. In it is an old book with his grandmother's name written in it. A note explains the book was bought by a book dealer who is sending it to Simon as it may be of interest to him and his family. The second chapter flashes back to the 1780's and the character Amos who is mute, finds his way into a traveling circus because of his ability to seemingly disappear. In chapter three Simon, who happens to be a librarian, talks with the bookseller who sent him the book and finds this is something he has done before. Simon is not really interested in the book as it brings up bad family memories of his deceased parents. Later while at the library he notices the book is a diary and account book for a traveling show, Peabody's Portable Magic and Miracles--the same show from chapter two.There are other interesting details and connections and the story goes on from there. Simon is a bit of a straight and narrow character, perhaps too much so for my taste. But I like books about the history of books and time travel so enjoyed reading this. It's okay, not great, but if you like the setting of this book you might enjoy it.

This review is for the Mountain House Breakfast Skillet freeze dried meal in the new "urban" package design. I generally like most of the Mountain House offerings and this one was no exception. The big caveat for those who have not tried freeze dried meals is that they tend to have different textures than regular cooked food. Meats especially. And in this case eggs. The eggs are a bit mushy in texture and overall it's a big mush. But the flavor on this one is pretty good for freeze dried. A good tip with this dish is to eat it with soft tortillas and make a breakfast burrito. I like this breakfast meal better than their scrambled eggs and bacon. A warning to those with diet concerns. A single pack contains 31g total fat (48% of DV), 9g saturated fat (45% DV), 310mg cholesterol (103% DV), 1170mg sodium (49% DV). Hope this review helps a little in making your decision.

This review is for the Mountain House Scrambled Eggs with Bacon freeze dried meal in the new "urban" package design. I generally like most of the Mountain House offerings and this one was no exception. The big caveat for those who have not tried freeze dried meals is that they tend to have different textures than regular cooked food. Meats especially. And in this case eggs. The eggs are a bit mushy in texture along with the bacon. It's a big mush. But the flavor is decent for freeze dried. If you've been camping for days these probably taste great. I keep freeze dried meals for just-in-case scenarios but end up eating one every few months. Freeze dried eggs are the most challenging of the Mountain House foods but I would eat them. My favorite is their lasagna. Compared to other brands if you want eggs Mountain House does the best. Their Eggs & Bacon will do the trick when needed but if you're at home just make some fresh eggs. A warning to those with diet concerns. A single pack contains 405mg cholesterol (135% of DV), sodium is 690mg (29% DV), and saturated fat is 4g (20% of DV). Hope this review helps a little in making your decision.

Aurora takes us aboard the first multigenerational starship currently 159 years into its voyage to the crew's new home, Aurora, in Tau Ceti. Because of the long journey to its final destination things have started to crack in this utopian Noah's ark. The ship itself is starting to show some wear and tear. But perhaps worse, the society is starting to show signs of discontent. What happens to a society confined to a small island? How can people evolve or devolve? Everyone on the chip is thought to be "chipped" so that every human is accounted for at all times. But not everyone wants to be on the grid and stay in their designated lands. Within the ship there may or may not be unaccounted for people known as Ferals. Are they purposely sabotaging the voyage? Added to this is a coming-of-age story with our heroine, Freya. She's tall, independent, and we follow her as she goes on a journey through all the different lands. This rite of passage is meant to show educate her about the different people but she discovers more than anticipated. This is the setup in the first few chapters but the book goes much further. Without giving any of the surprises away, I would say this is a book filled with details but covers broad strokes. If you've wondered what might happen if we sent people across space to settle a new planet (or moon) then this is an interesting ride.

I like the idea of a disposable cloth with the cleaning agent already inside. Simple and easy enough. They are thin pads loaded with cleaner that activates when exposed to water.The product is marketed as a kitchen cleaner but I think it works just fine in the bathroom as well.On the box there is a long list of surfaces the cleaner should not be used on ( marble, copper, aluminum or dark colored Corian surfaces)Unfortunately my kitchen is made up of quite a few of these surfaces that one should avoid using the product on. In the kitchen I am able to use the scrubs on the kitchen sink. It works quite well on the sink and it doesn't scratch it. I've used it in the bathroom to clean up some grout and tile and it works well there as well. The soapy residue the scrub leaves behind has to rinsed off but no big deal. The disposability of the scrub still makes it very convenient and easy to use. I would love to see them develop another product with a similar ease of use which could be used on more sensitive kitchen materials like marble and aluminum.

I have an old timey industrial style in my kitchen so I really welcomed the look off a non-electric squeeze press juicer. Be prepared to have enough counter space for this large gadget to sit. It's very big sturdy piece of equipment and not easy to take out and put away when you need it because it's got some serious weight to it.I like that it requires no electricity, so even though it takes a good amount of space the space itself is not dependent on how close it is placed to an outlet like so many of my other counter appliances and gadgets.The juicer functions pretty well. I pick up a large bag of oranges from my cousins backyard tree last week and have gotten to work each morning since making fresh juice.I've tried the potatoes once to make sliced fry pieces but they do take a little more strength to slice through.I would recommend this to anyone looking for a conversation piece juicer.

Note that only one glove lights up and makes noise.You have to press the middle of the glove to make it go off.  At first, this seemed inconvenient, but my 8-year-old son has it figured out with his own Iron Man move.The gloves are made of a thick flexible plastic, so I'm not sure they will hold up to harsh play.  And they aren't something a kid will leave on for very long.It's a fun toy, but I don't think it's something that will now get a lot of use.  I would suggest only getting it as part of a costume for Halloween or another party.
He's just a figurine so I'm not sure what to really review.  He's my favorite minion.  Stands on its own.

These were used for a kid's party.  They held up to 3 to 9 year olds plus adults while bowling, so I say they pass some endurance.There were little hair-like things that flaked off from them.  Didn't notice while we were wearing them, but did as I was getting them out of the packages and putting them together while organizing my things for the party.I liked that they were so colorful and weren't designed more for girls or guys since there was a mix for this party.

Was looking for a deer in Legos, but wasn't able to find a set or directions that looked like a deer.  Am happy with this purchase.If you have never used nanoblocks before, keep in mind that these are really small.  My 8-year-old who loves Legos does not like these yet because he doesn't have the dexterity to do them easily.  I love them because I don't mind the small size and my son then doesn't take them over.The antlers don't have much support, so they easily break off.  I actually wanted a doe, so I just left them off.
Wanted the red hibiscus print for a Hawaiian party, so this worked.  Kinda a stiff fabric.  Fit to my normal size.

First of all, I'm not really sure how it is a parking tower.  It is a series of roads.  I guess you just park your car on the road and since it is only one lane wide, all other cars behind you are parked by default.Secondly, the first and second layers don't line up.  Anyone who is an engineer or knows geometry, knows that the same length line on an angle doesn't take up the same footprint as that line lying flat.  You have two sections that are on an angle to get from the 1st to the 2nd floor.  What we did to remedy this the best we could was to attach the red support sections to the top pieces only.  Instead of attaching to the first layer pieces, they just sit on them.  It is still sturdy enough, just not super sturdy.I (the adult) put on the stickers because once they are on, they aren't easily adjusted.  They went on easily and it wasn't hard to line them up correctly.So besides my adult perspective that it is poorly designed...from the child perspective, my 8-year-old loves it.  That's why I didn't completely give it 1 star.  He's not a kid that plays hard with his toys, so it is fine for him.  It fits his Hot Wheels cars.

We love Legos in our house, but didn't have any of the games.  My 8-year-old son is always making up games about avoiding lava, so that's why I picked this one.First, you build the game board.  Then, you need to play it a couple of times to get the rules down.  To begin, you have only a partially built die to roll.  As you roll, you build on the die and play on the board at the same time.  If you roll a certain color on the die, you can block another player with lava.  Ultimately, you are trying to get to the top of the hill.We started playing with only 2 players.  Then we added a third person.  Much more strategy and fun with more players.Games weren't too short or too long.I really hesitated to buy this because many of the reviews said other Lego games were much better.  I'm glad I bought it because it is fun.  Can't wait to now try other Lego games.

Seemed like the best collection of Beatles songs, but can't give it anything but 1 star because of the packaging.  There are 2 discs in cardboard/paper sleeves.  I assume to keep them in, there is some kind of sticky stuff ON THE CD!!  One, I was able to get it off because it was only on the edge.  But the other, the sticky stuff runs across the CD.  It is not usable.

This was bought for a 7-year-old boy.He'll tell you it is awesome, but was disappointed that there weren't many parts. Explanation...there are only 2 mini figures and 2 mini ships to play with.  It says this on the box, but is still disappointing when there isn't much to play with and much more is shown in the picture.The big ship opens, but clumsily.  The middle section is supposed to connect in the back.  Then, you are supposed to pull up on it to open up the entire ship.  It isn't engineered right to stay connected.  And when everything opens and closes, you need to help it.There is a shooter inside and a staircase.  Otherwise, not much.  Shooter works well.  There is also a place to attach a small X-wing fighter with a clear plastic piece to make it look like it is flying.

Works.  Haven't burned a waffle yet.  It has an indicator light to tell you when it is hot enough to put waffle mix in, but doesn't have a light to indicate when to flip it or when it is done, which would be nice.

This may be my favorite Tinker Bell movie yet.  Tinker Bell isn't the main character of this one.  The Neverbeast is so cute which may scare really young kids when he is in danger.  Highly recommend if you are into this series of movies.

Unlike other reviews, did not have any problems with these batteries being at a low level.  They served their purpose well and were inexpensive.  I'm not wanting to pay as much for replacing batteries as the cheap toys they are going into.

Our family loves playing this game.  When I took it to a family game night, everyone wanted to play it because "we have that in our house, but we never knew how to play it."  I also felt like it was a good math and visual tool for my 7-year-old son.Now the reason it only got 3 stars is because the tiles are imperfect.  You put the tiles in a pile and mix them around, face down.  This causes the writing to not stay on well.  Seems like the company, knowing that this is part of the rules, should have designed it more robust.  Secondly, some of the tiles are not flat on the back.  There are imperfections that once you have played the game a couple of times, you can cheat by knowing what numbers are on those marked tiles.I would definitely recommend the game, but find a higher quality set.

My son fell in love with Stitch at Disney World.  I'm not sure what prompted it because we didn't own the movies, but then of course, we had to get them all.  As an adult, they are good, but my 7-year-old son loves them all.  And the takeaway is that he says family comes first and puts that into practice.  For that alone, he can watch them as much as he wants.

I used to be a big Duck Commander fan.  Now, I'm ok with it, but not a weekly watcher.  So, I didn't seek out this book.  I happened across it in a bookstore and was really impressed.  It introduces a Bible concept by telling a real story from their lives.  It gives a way to practice that in your life.  Then, it has a small prayer.  It is at my child's level (7-year-old boy).  He watched Duck Commander with us, so because he recognized the Duck Commander name, he was excited to read this book.No matter what your feelings on Duck Commander, this is a good devotion for kids.  I haven't finished the book, but haven't run across anything that would be considered radical like some of the beliefs that this family has portrayed in the media.

My son fell in love with Stitch at Disney World.  I'm not sure what prompted it because we didn't own the movies, but then of course, we had to get them all.  As an adult, they are good, but my 7-year-old son loves them all.  And the takeaway is that he says family comes first and puts that into practice.  For that alone, he can watch them as much as he wants.All the reviews I read said this was not a good movie and it is hard to get.  It's almost as if Disney thinks it was a bad movie too.  I don't understand why because I think it is on par with the rest of the Stitch movies.

My son fell in love with Stitch at Disney World.  I'm not sure what prompted it because we didn't own the movies, but then of course, we had to get them all.  As an adult, they are good, but my 7-year-old son loves them all.  And the takeaway is that he says family comes first and puts that into practice.  For that alone, he can watch them as much as he wants.I like that all of Stitch's cousins are in this one.  I wish they had done more with them.  And despite reviews I read, this doesn't have a bad ending.

I bought this because my son is skinny and gets cold in our pool.  It definitely helps so that he is willing to go into the pool at cooler temperatures than just in his swimsuit.My son is 7 years old, skinny and average to tall for his age.  I bought a size 6 and it fits almost perfectly.  A little long.I would be a little careful letting a child zip up the back by themselves.  My son zipped his skin into the zipper one time.

I bought this so that I could go into the pool when it was cooler than I would otherwise go in with just a swimsuit.  It works for that purpose, although my legs still get cold which is the first thing that gets into the pool.Fairly easy, for a wetsuit, to get on and off.Fits true to the size listed.

I bought this as a prank to put in our pool.  Neither of the people that I tried to prank, were scared.  They just laughed.  Darn it!  But we do all agree that it looks real, only it is smaller than a real alligator.  Now, we leave it in the pool while we are in there just because it is fun.It hasn't been played with more than floating around the pool and moved out of the way, so we have not had any problems with the sections coming disconnected.I have not put batteries in it for the eyes to light up because we don't use it at night.  So, I cannot speak for that aspect.

This whole series of books on dinosaurs and sports is awesome!  A group of kids at my son's school keep checking them out from the library as soon as another one turns it in.  I finally started buying them to give to my son for each sports season.My son is 7 years old and can read them.  There are some big words just because dinosaur names are long.I have a little difficulty reading them because it seems like you read them fast just because of how it goes.  That causes me to have to go back and read it slower just to really get it.  And the dinosaur names are sometimes shortened.

Our family loves Scooby-Doo, so I'm not sure who will end up with this, but it was bought for a 7-year-old.  Seems to be holding up well to going out on the golf course and being used as a puppet the rest of the time.

The first book I received was missing pages.  Amazon corrected this.As so many Lego building books, there are very few easy ideas and very few instructions.  It is mostly a book of impressive Lego creations.  I bought since Lego doesn't have castle sets out right now and that is one thing my child is interested in.  But, I will only get a few ideas from this.  Would not buy again - would just look at ideas on the Internet instead.
I'm so glad that I can get gift cards so easily.  I also appreciate that there are not any additional charges.  Ordered and received in the mail.

The neighbor rented this movie from the library to show my son and I saw part of it.  Looked really good and my son loved it.  It was really cheap.  And it was good enough that I wanted a copy for us.  Have since watched it numerous times.It's about a boy who loves baseball, but isn't very good at it.  He is on a mission to return Babe Ruth's bat to him.  In the process, he learns a number of things.  Excellent story!

I bought this to play a game outside.I assumed that the abuse it would take outside between hitting things in the yard (sticks, etc.) and kids kicking and throwing it, that it would not stay inflated.  No punctures and still fully inflated yet!!!  For that alone, it gets 5 stars.The only thing that I don't like is that because it is an inflatable, it isn't perfectly square.  It makes it a little harder to read the dots from a distance.

I'm wanting to make an aquarium out of Legos, so bought this for that purpose.  If I had paid more attention, crabs are included in several Lego sets.  I likely would have just gotten one of those sets instead of getting it separate.  This wasn't expensive for a Lego, but I just feel better getting a set and getting more.

We do a lot of Legos in our house, so knockoffs are always a little disappointing that they don't fit and stay together as well.  But I have bought enough Oyo products to know that this is the case.  I buy them because they offer something Lego doesn't.  Having said that, with the hockey players, it is really hard to get the stick positioned and the hands like to come out.  I eventually got it, but am worried about when my child goes to play with it.  This isn't just for looking at.You can buy these items from Oyo directly, but usually Amazon has better prices.  If you don't see the player you want, Oyo has all of them available on their website.

My 7-year-old son is addicted to watching sports and therefore, knowing the various teams.  I've gotten these for him for baseball, basketball, hockey and football so that he knows the various teams and which teams our local team will be playing.  He's always running to his room to look at the poster.

My 7-year-old son is addicted to watching sports and therefore, knowing the various teams.  I've gotten these for him for baseball, basketball, hockey and football so that he knows the various teams and which teams our local team will be playing.  He's always running to his room to look at the poster.

There are a whole set of books that work together to teach/learn piano.  This supports the Lesson Book.  In the front of the Lesson Book, it indicates which pages of which books work together to introduce a concept.  I would also highly recommend going to the website for Piano Adventures.  It outlines well how this series works and what to purchase.After using the series for a few months to teach my son how to play piano, I think it is a good guide.  I don't follow every thing.  I use the concept they are introducing and pick out the parts I think will work for my purpose.  I do feel like I'm juggling by going between all the books.  I use the Lesson, Technique/Artistry, Theory and Performance books.

There are a whole set of books that work together to teach/learn piano.  This supports the Lesson Book.  In the front of the Lesson Book, it indicates which pages of which books work together to introduce a concept.  I would also highly recommend going to the website for Piano Adventures.  It outlines well how this series works and what to purchase.After using the series for a few months to teach my son how to play piano, I think it is a good guide.  I don't follow every thing.  I use the concept they are introducing and pick out the parts I think will work for my purpose.  I do feel like I'm juggling by going between all the books.  I use the Lesson, Technique/Artistry, Theory and Performance books.

In the front, it indicates which pages of which books work together to introduce a concept.  I would also highly recommend going to the website for Piano Adventures.  It outlines well how this series works and what to purchase.After using the series for a few months to teach my son how to play piano, I think it is a good guide.  I don't follow every thing.  I use the concept they are introducing and pick out the parts I think will work for my purpose.  I do feel like I'm juggling by going between all the books.  I use the Lesson, Technique/Artistry, Theory and Performance books.

I purchased these stickers for my son's teacher to use in her class.  They are small, but the perfect size for what she had been using in the class.  They are cute too.  There were 528 stickers in the pack (other Teacher Created Resources stickers that I purchased did not indicate the correct number).

We're not from Florida, but I purchased this mascot because it was cute and looked like our cat.  Parts did stay together unlike some other OYO products I have purchased.  But, the paint on the face wasn't solid.  Looked a little scratched off even though it was a new product.  That was disappointing.

My son loves "Paw Patrol" and this pack included his favorite character = Zuma.  There are 5 in this pack with 1 Rocky, 1 Chase, 1 Zuma and 2 Marshal ones.  Where's Rubble?  I get these are for boys, so no Skye, but what about Rubble?  Weird.  They fit as expected.

My 7-year-old son loves this whole series of books. There is soccer, baseball, basketball, hockey, wrestling, and boarding. He's been getting them from the library and I'm slowing buying them as the right season comes up. He and his friends are addicted to these books.The story is told in rhyme. It runs through a soccer game, explaining different parts of the game/rules. It goes from beginning to end and is fast paced.From my adult perspective, I need to read through it several times to catch it all. Most of the time, the dinosaur names are shortened which makes me have to double-think also. The kids seem better at both of these than me.

My 7-year-old son loves mini golf, but we live in a northern state, so that only can happen part of the year.  We bought artificial grass carpet and cut holes for these cups.  They work great.  They aren't that thick, so the golf ball doesn't take extra force to get them over a hump to get into the cup.  The grippy things really do grip to keep the ball in the cup once it gets there.The picture that shows up as I write the review is different than what I actually received.  The flags didn't have numbers.  And the cups have a grid, they aren't solid.  This picture doesn't even show that they go in a cut out of the green.

This is the second set of these pens that I have purchased.  The first set was two years ago to go to Disneyland.  I wanted pens that the characters didn't need to prime before signing my son's autograph book.  That worked great!  The last set came with 2 more pens than this set.  Since that trip, my son uses them on and off.  None of them have run out yet.  Not knowing how long they would last, when we went back to Disney, I ordered another set.  Again, worked great so the characters could immediately sign the book without scratching it off to the side.

I held off on buying this game for my 7-year-old son because of the price.  Seemed a little expensive.  Now that I have it, I understand why - it is made very well.My son plays this a lot.  It wasn't a one time deal and on to the next game.I like it because it helps my son learn the rules/scoring of baseball.  He plays on a team, so this is helping.It just takes a little to get the timing down to hit the ball.  And some times, the bat doesn't reset to the same place.  Then, you have to take it out and put it back in (which is no big deal).

THE SHORT STORY: VERY quickly became my favorite mouse. Easy to program, smooth adjustable use. And very cool LED lighting effects.THE REST OF THE STORY: I am not a big time gamer, and use my mouse for both home and office work, including spreadsheets, writing, Visio and other drawing, 3D graphics, browsing the web and tons of email. I have two Logitech mice that I really like and wasn't looking for a mouse when I got the chance to review this one in exchange for a fair review. I loved the look of this mouth and the fun LED lighting effects and thought "why not". But after using it for a week, I bring this mouse with me everywhere, using it at work and at home and leaving my perfectly fine Logitech mice sitting idle.PROS:> FIT - the wide low design fits my hand very well and the position of the buttons is easy to reach.> INSTALLATION - the self installation process was very easy and didn't create any issues on my old Windows 7 Dell.> PROGRAMABILITY - the software for programming the features of the mouse works very well and is super easy to use. I was able to find more than enough buttons for all the things I normally want to do (left and right click, forward and back, lock PC, changing the DPI of the mouse on the fly, switch window and more. I'm still playing with more options with the buttons, but with 11 to program, I've got more than enough.> FEEL - with removable weights that come with their own cool little plastic foam lined, lidded cylinder this is the smoothest feeling mouse I've ever used. It glides over table cloth at home, on smooth desks and conference tables at work, and with the on-the-fly DPI settings can be easily adjusted to work ideally on any surface.> LIGHTS - OK, it's not important, but it's darned cool ... you can set the lighting around the mouse wheel and on the back of the mouse to just about any color you can imagine.> PROFILES - With four savable profiles, its easy to save multiple set ups and switch between one and another quickly and easily and color code the lighting of the mouse to clue you in to which set up you're using.> SET UP CD - a mini CD that worked just fine on my PC's CD/DVD drive.CONS: Not that I needed any, but the only printed instructions include with the mouse were in Chinese. The software is available in English, though, and was perfectly easy to follow. Not an issue, but just thought I'd let you know.NOTE: This product was supplied free in exchange for an honest review.

THE SHORT STORY:  VERY quickly became my favorite mouse. Easy to program, smooth adjustable use. And very cool LED lighting effects.ADDED SEPT 10 2015: After using this mouse for a while, I love it so much, I'm buying another one!  I've been using computers since 1977 and using computer mice since the mid 80's and this is, by far, without a doubt, my favorite mouse of all time. I use it for my work, which is a combination of writing/editing text, creating 3D images with graphic software, online communication and accessing stuff on the web ... and this mouse saves me so much time and effort and makes my work so much easier and more comfortable that I am buying another one so I can have one in both my offices. I currently have the extra buttons programmed to do BROWSER FWD, BROWSER BACK, ARROW LEFT, ARROW RIGHT, ALT-S (SAVE), CTRL-W (CLOSE BROWSER TAB) and WIN+L (LOCK PC) and my hand spends so much more time on the mouse now without the need to flit back and forth between mouse and keyboard, it's amazing. As a productivity mouse, this is my hands down favorite of any mouse I've ever used. For the price, it a steal!THE REST OF THE STORY: I am not a big time gamer, and use my mouse for both home and office work, including spreadsheets, writing, Visio and other drawing, 3D graphics, browsing the web and tons of email. The software is available in English, though, and was perfectly easy to follow. Not an issue, but just thought I'd let you know.NOTE:  This (first) product was supplied free in exchange for an honest review. The second one I'm buying with my own money because I love it that much.

We bought this fan to go in our small bedroom window to blow outdoor air into the bedroom and to provide a little white noise for easier sleeping. We've been running it for about a month now and we're very happy with it. It runs quietly but with a soft hum that is soothing to help induce sleep. It runs all day and night in the window and is free of vibrations or movement, sitting nicely on its feet and not moving from where we placed it. And yet, when I want to take it down from the window to switch it on or off, it's very light weight to pick up and move. The cord reaches easily from the window to the nearest available outlet without stretching. And the two speeds are adequate for our needs.PROS: Quiet, no vibration, moves air well, light weight, easy to change speeds, reasonable length cord.CONS: None so far. We really like it.

THE BOTTOM LINE:  A VERY pleasant surprise ... a high quality product that fits well, stays in place and quickly became a new favorite. And it's leather. :)THE REST OF THE STORY:  I've been thinking about buying a new belt pouch / fanny pack for a while now, and when I saw this item on Amazon I was really surprised as I'd not seen one quite like it before. Most of the packs I've had in the past or seen online were ballistic nylon and not very stylish. This item is was made of leather and suited my personal tastes very well. I was really excited to try it out but feared that it would be too small to fit my 44" waist (as many belt pouches I've tried in the past were too small).When this Pack Belt arrived, I delayed trying it on to avoid the seemingly inevitable disappointment of learning that it was too small. But when my wife told me she wanted to go on a 4 mile hike, I thought it sounded like a great opportunity to give the Pack Belt a good work out. Imagine my delight when I tried it on and found that it not only fit, but with several belt holes to spare. My wife and I made our 4 mile walk in a nature preserve the following day and I put my wallet, keys and a few other items in the Pack Belt, strapped it on and headed out. Three and a half hours later, I was completely pleased with how the Pack Belt had fit and how it wore while I was walking. No discomfort, no slipping and the easy in-and-out magnetic closure pouch flaps let me get in and out of the three main compartments with ease. Behind the flapped pouches is a zipper pouch that runs the length of the pouch with plenty of room for a small Moleskine notebook and Flair pen I brought a long (and I easily could have fit more stuff inside).My wife also found the Pack Belt much more stylish than various belt pouches I've owned in the past and was really glad I'd decided to give this one a try.My take on this Pack Belt?Style - 5 starsConstruction - leather, well put together, easy to use zipper and magnetic closures, sturdy - 5 starsFit - snug, comfortable, no moving about or discomfort - 5 starsSizing - fit me at 44" very well, and room to spare if I'm wearing more layers.Hardware - brass colored metal (not sure what the composition of the metal is)CONS:  None that I've encountered so far. If I do run into any issues, I'll update the review with date stamped "EDITS" at the top.NOTE - this product was provided free of charge in exchange for an honest review.

I generally LOVE Moleskine notebooks (5), and have many in different sizes and colors. I use them a lot and love their practicality, durability and excellent writing surface. The pocket in the back, book mark ribbon and elastic close strap are all features I really appreciate, use and find hold up over long term use.  And with regard to these features I love, this violet notebook is as good as my other Moleskine's. So I would have agreed before today with the notion that "you can't go wrong with Moleskine" ... but I learned this morning that indeed you can, especially with this VIOLET pocket journal. I purchased mine in a brick and mortar store, still in the original packaging, and yet when I opened it I saw that it was badly faded (store fluorescent lights?). Everywhere the cover wasn't protected by the label or the elastic strap, the color had a distinct, unattractive reddish hue, and where it was protected, the original color remained. I've purchased other colors from stores (red, black, green, even violet in smaller formats) and didn't see this fading effect. The quality of the book as a writing surface and pocket pad seems fine, but Moleskine's quality track record with me is no longer 100%. I know this fading issue can be corrected on Moleskine's end by adding UV protection to the dyes they use for the cover ink, I just hope they do the right thing and make the required adjustment to their formulations. I plan to add stickers to the front of this one to distract from the fade pattern. A NOTE TO AMAZON BUYERS: If you're ordering your Violet pocket journal from Amazon and not buying it in a store, I suspect there's a good chance it will not have been exposed to a lot of UV, so it might arrive without this fading issue. But, if like me, you work all day under fluorescent's or the sun, the cover color might fade over time during use. If that doesn't matter to you, the rest of the features of this notebook should be true to form for Moleskine classic pocket journals.

Replacement Li batteries can be tricky, with some after market batteries not even fitting properly in the devices for which they are "recommended". This battery by Canon was a perfect fit for my camera after the old battery began swelling from age and exposure and worked properly after the first charging. The clearances on the battery compartment on my Canon pocket camera are VERY tight, and when the old batter swelled a bit, it was difficult to even get it out of the camera. Fortunately, it hadn't leaked, and we were able to salvage the camera, if not the battery. Having had bad luck in the pass with aftermarket batteries, I decided to stick with the manufacturer's brand and I'm very glad I did. We've had this battery in use for a few months now and it's working perfectly.I'll update this review in the future should anything change.

Not so many years ago, we were rookie "painted planet parents ... our daughter had only started elementary school and we foolishly thought that any Styrofoam ball would do as a base for painting a mocked up planet, or perhaps a cut-away cell. Well, like many before us, we learned the hard way, Styrofoam balls are NOT created equal. While THIS product has a very smooth, easy to paint surface, many are more rough, rugged, even scratchy and very porous, absorbing paint very unevenly. This particular model took to the satin finished spray paint specified for Uranus like a pro and was orbiting between Saturn and Neptune in no time, after a quick detour over our picnic table. :)How do you hold the sphere while painting and drying? We used a small metal cooking skewer through the North Pole (sorry Santa) and we were in business very quickly, able to hold the skewer while painting and then suspend the planet from the skewer for extended drying/curing from the ceiling of our back porch. The skewer stayed secure in the ball with no problems at all.We also enjoyed particularly ordering this product from Amazon and not having to run all over town to half a dozen craft or art supply/discount stores trying to find the right size, texture and surface of Styrofoam ball (as we had in the past). We just searched Amazon, found the right size, read the reviews, ordered the one that sounded best from a Prime supplier, and it was delivered to our door in just a couple of days. SUPER convenient.Project Uranus was a big success and we owe must of that success to this simple but very appropriate product. Thanks!

We tried making an ice ball / Death Star with this "sphere maker" and had mixed feelings about the results. Did it make an ice ball? Yes?  Did it look like the Death Star? Kind of, maybe after a bad day in space. Was it easy to use?  No, not really.But, I think whether or not you'll like this product really depends on what your looking for:Quick/Easy/Reliable way to create crisp looking ice ball Death Stars - 2 to 3 stars> Why? It's not at all easy to get the correct filling / cooling / finishing process down just right to quickly and easily and predictably produce a really nice ice death star. It takes lots of trial and error and mixed results to eventually get one that turns out pretty good. So if you're looking for a mold that will be a predictable maker of impressive ice spheres, plan on putting in a lot of R&D work to get the process just right. Quick and easy ... not so much.Chocolate Death Star Maker ... maybe much higher stars.> Why?  From what I've read ... this mold reportedly works VERY well with chocolate. So read other reviews by folks who made chocolate spheres with it and see if that's what you're looking for. It sounds like quite a few folks here who've used this mold to make chocolates were very pleased with the results. I was surprised with how consistently they reported results that were fairly trouble free, consistent and pleasing. Not at all like our results with water/ice.So ... think about what you want to use this product for first ... read a few reviews by chocolateers ... and then decide.

OK, this is a USB charging cable for a Samsung Galaxy S5. I don't look for a lot, but I do look for this:1) Works properly right out of the package? YES2) Plugs easily into charging port, PC USB port and phone charging port? YES3) Stays securely in place, whether plugged into PC, wall charger or car charger? YES4) Delivers quick, safe charging of my phone from all three sources of power? YESNOTE - charging time on an S5 much faster when using this cable than when using one that only plugs into the right half of the charging port.5) Works well after months of daily use? YES6) Resists my cat's attempts to eat it? YES (though she loves licking it ... don't know why).7) Easy to find in the dark or in my various black interior packs and bags? YES8) Utterly trouble free? YESI love it. Simple enough. No complaints.

SHORT VERSION (SEE SEPT 2ND 2015 UPDATE BELOW)So far, I have no complaints with this product. Like others, I assumed this was safe for all lenses, as advertised, and was surprised to find that it might not be (based thus far on the claims of others and the smell of ammonia).  But, thus far, my lenses are fine. For more details, read on.THE LONG VERSIONUPDATE - SEPTEMBER 2ND - 2015Still no complaints. I turned skeptical after reading so many negative reviews, but I really have had nothing but good results with this product. I'm upping my rating from 4 stars to 5 starts after a few months of enjoyable, trouble free use. No smearing, no film, quick cleaning, GREAT spray control, and no impact on my lens coatings at all.ORIGINAL REVIEWI ordered this product trusting in the Zeiss name, and never even thought that this product might not be what it claims. When I read some of the reviews that suggested it wasn't what it seemed to be, I felt like a fool for not reading the reviews before I ordered ... I WRITE reviews, why didn't I read them? Too much faith in a brand I've known or years ... or what claimed to be.BUT ... the glasses I'm wearing now are getting old and will need to be replaced soon. What a great opportunity to experiment!  If this stuff is not what it claims and my lenses lose their coatings, no big deal. I'm due for new ones soon. And if not, then I'll have demonstrated that, at least for my glasses (tri-focal no-lines with coatings) it worked well. What have I found?1) I've been using this product on my glasses several times a week for about a month, and so far I can only say good things.2) The spray nozzle on the top of each bottle distributes the spray better than any other lens cleaning bottle I've ever used (and I've been wearing glasses since about 1970).  It seems a minor thing, but it really helps speed the process of cleaning my glasses to know the pump mister works so well, every time. I distributes spray only where I want it, and I've never been able to say that before.3) The spray mist adheres well to the lenses and the action with a proper tissue/cloth on the lens is very smooth and effective. No smearing, sticking or jumping like with some cheaper cleaners. I have no issues during the cleaning process itself at all.4) The removal of skin oils and other greasier forms of dirt from the lenses is quick and easy. I've experienced no film or smearing at all.I'm a little surprised ... still a little skeptical ... but so far, so good.NOTE:I will report my results again after another month or so of daily use and let you know if the coatings on my lenses are still holding up to daily cleaning with this product or not. So far, I see no signs of the coatings breaking down (and I have experienced that on previous glasses when improperly cleaned, so I know what to look for).

When I first saw this product image I was a little dubious ... would it look as nice as it does in the photo? Would it be easy to use? Would it work? But, since the product was to be provided for free in exchange for an honest review, I thought I'd take a chance and give it a try. I had extra motivation too. My stepdaughter suffers from nosebleeds when the air is dry, and she LOVES anything that provides mood lighting. She's also fond of Lavender oil fragrance. This one item might provide her with a delightful gift ... if she liked it.Well, the item arrived the other day to huge sighs of delight. We opened it up (easy to open packaging, product was safe and sound, no damage), read the instructions (the English is a little rough in places, but totally thorough and understandable), added water with Lavender oil, selected the light setting with the easy to use nicely hidden buttons, and in no time my daughter was in 7th heaven. The item itself is very attractive and seems solidly and very well made. The wooden part is very attractive and the glass top adds a very elegant touch. The product is very quiet and provides different options for choosing a single light color or a rotating light pattern.  She's been using it every night as a combination humidifier / fragrance oil mister / night light and is very pleased.We'll report back in a few weeks with more information on how it's holding up over time, any issues that arise, and our overall satisfaction over time. But at this point, I'm very pleased with all aspects of the product.NOTE - this item runs on an AC wall adapter, no batteries required nor is that option available.

In my area (greater Seattle/Tacoma) I've found it difficult to get the small roles of duct tape in stores like Walmart, Target, etc. I checked Amazon and found the prices were better than I'd seen in stores and the selection was better as well.As for the product itself, I've used it in a few applications (repairing composition book covers, tagging PC gear with distinctive markings, etc.) and thus far I'm totally satisfied. Sticky but not messy, fun color/pattern choices, and I can share with my daughter since there are 6 rolls to choose from.I will report back later on how the tape holds up over time and with extended use, as that also matters to me.

My daughter's Galaxy S3 developed "complications" with the usb charge port (it wouldn't), and so we started looking into alternative means of charging her phone. This charger got consistently good reviews and I liked the simple design based on a USB charging cable (no separate AC adapter to schlep around), so we ordered it and she's been using it for about a week now. While we haven't measured the total charge time from drained, she leaves it on the charger overnight and its ready to go in the morning when she gets up. She brings it with her when she's staying over with relatives and its seems to work fine everywhere she's been. It's a little tricky to use this kind of charger in the car if you're on twisting road as the phone will tend to slide off the charger, but if you can hold it in your lap, it seems to charge just fine.The charging unit (the black square in the lower right of the picture) is small and easy to take with you on outings and my 12 year old had no problems installing the battery charge receiver (the part that goes inside the back of the phone) by herself.Simple, affordable, well designed, effective ... MY kind of product.  We're very happy with the results and will update this review if anything changes.NOTABLES> Charges with a USB cable, allowing for charging from PC, car charger or wall charger, depending on what you have.> Battery charge receiver unit (goes inside phone) is easy to install and does not make the phone any thicker.> Works best when lying flat, does not work very well if charging platform is placed at an angle.

While I initially enjoyed this polygonal dice app as a fun addition to my gaming tool kit, the most recent AT&T upgrade of my Galaxy S5 (spring 2015) seems to have rendered it partially neutered. Gone are changeable dice colors or any other settings aside from table surface selection and dice count. I can't find any help text either. The action of the dice also changed after the AT&T update, with the "bounciness" of the dice now considerably increased. While the app is still usable, it's not as configurable as it was before. I've heard reports the developer doesn't respond to emails, but I will give it a try none the less. Update to follow.

As inexpensive privacy screens go, I have no complaints about this product. Is it so wonderful I just LOVE it?  No, but that's not due to defects of any kind. For what it is, it is done very nicely.  Here are the pro's and con's as I see them.PRO'S- Arrived in perfect condition, no damage- Easy to open packaging, product removes easily from box.- No assembly required, just slide it into place and you're in business.- Light weight, easy to move around and open/close.- Opens and closes reliably on what seem to be good hinges.- White fabric backing reflects light into my cube, which is nice.- Very nice finish on the wood frame.CON'S- VERY light weight ... so don't consider it for applications where it might easily get knocked over by high volume or random traffic (little kids, cats, etc)- Fabric "glued" to back of lattice work, so not able to slide things between lattice and fabric to add decorative elements without breaking bond between fabric and lattice.- Fabric very delicate and looks like it would be easy to damage if you weren't being careful.So, for uses where you can be careful to use this screen lightly, like my low traffic office, I think it's perfect. For applications requiring a tougher, more durable design, this might be too fragile.

For starters, these are not fancy book cases, nor did I expect them to be. I was looking for simple, effective, attractive, well made book cases to augment the storage at my desk at work.  These had good reviews, the price seemed fair, and so I ordered 2 and had them shipped to my office. The short form of my review ... I love them. :)  Now for the rest of the story, if you care to get the details.PACKAGINGThe packaging was VERY robust, with good solid cardboard cases used, but with extra corner reinforcing pads added to the outside of each edge of the shipping case. I've not seen these before. It's a self-adhesive corner pad that runs along the edge of the case and provides extra protection against edge crushing. They seem to work really well and are easy to remove by simply pulling them off. Great idea!PRODUCT QUALITY AND CONDITIONThe parts for the book cases inside were packed identically, which made opening and retrieving the parts easy and predictable. All the parts inside were in good to excellent condition, with only one corner damaged across 2 book cases, and that was not during shipping as the packaging in that area was flawless, so it must have happened during manufacturing or loading into the box. The damage was very minor, and I don't consider it an issue. The color of the material is very pleasing to the eye and the texture feels very nice to touch.  The only oddness in the contents of the boxes was that the first case I opened had exactly the number of fasteners I needed to assemble the book case, while the second had quite a few extras.ASSEMBLYI've built quite a few book cases in my lifetime, and these were as easy to assemble as any I've built.  The instructions were correct and complete if you need them, but I personally found they weren't necessary as the assembly is rather simple.  The only tool I used was my Swiss Army Knife to screw in the Phillips head screws.  If you plan to nail on the faux-wood-finish cardboard back panel, you'll need a hammer, but I preferred these open backed, so no hammering was required. All the parts went together easily without forcing, fit properly and felt solid and square when I was done. I did each one, alone, in my tiny cubicle with no problems.SHELVESSmall metal pegs fit into holes in the side panels, onto which clear rubber tips slide over the end to protect the shelves from damage rubbing against the metal pegs. Nice touch. The shelves fit perfectly first time, no issues.CONSAside from one tiny bit of superficial manufacturing damage to one corner of one book case, I'm 100% satisfied with these book cases. They made quite a nice addition to my cube.  One of the bosses swung by at one point and commented that my cube was beginning to look more like an office.

I often find myself looking for creative solutions to "how to turn this on and off more easily" and I must say this Lighted Foot Switch with 9ft 3 Outlet Cord is one of the best I've come across. I have two devices at my desk at work that I only use "sometimes", and both are located UNDER my desk, not easy for me to get to, in terms of reaching the individual power on/off switches of each device when I want to activate or de-activate.  Both devices are black with black cords, are neither is easy to reach from my desk chair. What I wanted was a cord with a foot switch on it that I could simply move my foot to turn on and off with no hassle. This product solved my problem perfectly.PRO'S1) Plenty long enough (nine feet) to maneuver around under my desk without difficulty or tripping/kicking hazard. Shorter cords cut across the area where my feet move and snag, this one does not.2) TWO lights ... one stays on to let you know the cord is plugged into a live circuit, the 2nd light comes on only when you have the switch engaged to ON. Great design!3) Three outlets - more than enough for my needs at the moment so I don't need to worry about getting multiple cords.4) Foot switch works easily and predictably, without having to "retry" to turn things on and off.5) White color ... so I can find it easily under my dark desk when I need to rearrange things. Black cords in a dark area ... not handy.CONSNone that I've encountered so far.

This honest review provided in exchange for a free sample of the product.Wow ... :)  What a delightful surprise.THE SHORT FORM (UPDATED IN JUNE 2015)This courier bag quickly became my favorite of several I own, and I get a surprising number of compliments on it while enjoying using it. Several people have asked where I got it and expressed interest in getting one like it. And I don't blame them. It's really a wonderful bag.THE REST OF THE STORYI have been a long time user of various sorts of personal bags, from satchels and brief cases to back packs and courier bags, starting in ... yes, revealing my true geek/nerd nature ... 3rd grade. My first was was red plaid vinyl.  Yeah ... it was 1970. I've owned all kinds of bags from cheapo's to Tumi's and put them through their paces, and enjoyed exploring the range of what a personal bag can be.  Personal bags are one of those items I don't just use, I enjoy using them. A good bag becomes a good friend.Most recently I've been using a nylon courier bag for my laptop, and while it works well for that purpose (light weight, sturdy, good fit), it's not much to look at and has little room for my papers and non-electronic items. I had begun thinking about (though not actively looking for yet) getting something nicer to keep my papers in, when I got the chance to review this DesertWolf Cotton Canvas Crazy-horse Leather bag.I'm rather demanding about bags, and so I accepted the offer with a considerable sense of "I'll probably be disappointed".  For me to LOVE a bag, (I'd give my laptop courier about 3 stars) the features and fittings need to be both very well thought out with regard to how people will actually use them and very well executed so that the bag actually delivers on the day to day execution of the design concepts.  When I opened the box for this bag, my eyes opened wide.  This looks NICE.Then I touched the bag.  The canvas and leather both feel amazing ... thick and sturdy yet surprisingly soft and supple.  NOT a common combination in my experience. And the lining inside the bag ... yes, I said lining ... soft, durable, classy.I couldn't believe it. I got this bag as a free sample?  What a lucky duck!  I kept looking over the bag in more detail, waiting for it to reveal its weaknesses.  Poor hardware?  Nope. Solid and cool.  Flimsy shoulder strap?  Nope ... again, sturdy but soft and pleasant to touch.  Painful handle when gripped with weight?  Nope, soft, satisfying, comfortable.The ONLY thing I'd caution potential buyers on is the size.  This is not a big bag. Check the dimensions to make sure it's a size that works for you. For me, looking to carry my 8.5x11 papers and files and such, it's perfect. The interior pockets (most open top for writing instruments, cell, etc. and  one zip close for cell phone or change perhaps) are great. The magnetic closures on the front are quick and easy to use (thanks for adding all the great pictures) and stay firmly closed (I've not had them pop open once by accident).If you're looking to carry a smaller laptop inside, there is an elastic strap to keep it secure in a dedicated pocket for laptops and the Velcro closure on the elastic strap has a good grip and sports a nice leather tab.  I just a couple of notebooks (paper) in the laptop pocket as my computer is a monster that has its own zip code and requires a bigger bag.As noted by others, the look of this bag is intentionally just a bit worn when it comes to the leather, but the effect is a pleasing patina, not at all beat up looking.  The canvas is in great shape and has a charcoal gray color I really like.This really is a very classy, stylish looking bag with exceptionally good design and high quality materials that look and feel great yet seem extremely durable ... this bag has become an instant favorite of mine.  I told my wife tonight "This is my writers bag" ... not a distinction I award easily. :)Is there ANYTHING about this bag I didn't like?  Not so far. If that changes, I'll be sure to report back with a follow up. But after a couple of weeks of pretty much daily use, I'm hooked.

This honest review is provided in exchange for a sample of the product provided at no cost ... but there's more to the story :)I received the PS4 Vertical Stand Cooler with Fan and was a bit disappointed to learn that the unit was for a piece of electronics I don't own ... a PS4.  I'd skimmed the initial email a bit too quickly and didn't realize the unit was dedicated to one particular unit, the PS4.What to do?!I wheeled myself into the aisle at work and asked "Anyone here have a PS 4?" Three heads popped out from behind cubical walls. I work with a group of system engineers who LOVE their games.  After some debate as to which of the three would get to give the product a try (and keep it, if they liked it) in exchange for feedback on the item, it was greed that "Agent X" as we'll call him, had popped his head out into the aisle fastest, and would therefore get the opportunity to bring the product home, check it out and report back his findings. I should reiterate that Agent X is a systems engineer and a very serious gamer, and thus rather picky about his gaming hardware. I was a bit nervous that he'd come back saying it just didn't measure up to his standards.Well, the reports are back from the gaming front lines and here's what Agent X had to say about the IBSound PS4 Vertical Stand Cooler with Fan (These are direct quotes, delivered a few days apart, the first after just a couple days use, the second a few days later):"Ive been using (the IBSoudn PS4 Vertical Stand Cooler with Fan) and the fans are really quiet and it holds the controllers nicely as well."A few days later ..."Here are a few more thoughts:- The ps4 feels sturdy in the stand. I'm not worried about it falling over again (it had fallen over before Agent X began using the stand).- The cooling is nice, will be way nicer in summer!- The extra USB ports are great for charging multiple peripherals at the same time.Overall, it seems to do everything it advertises quite well!"So, there you have it, from a serious gamer and systems engineer who loves putting systems through their paces.  I will be sure to report back if Agent X has any additional comments, pro or con, in the weeks ahead.And as a final bit of testimonial ... yes, he decided to keep it. :)

UPDATE - SEPT 2015 - AFTER 5 MONTHS USEI use this charging unit several times a week and have done so since I received it in mid April of 2015. In that time, I've had absolutely no problems with this unit. It has functioned as expected, charging my Galaxy S5 quickly and without issues, staying nicely lodged in the adapter in my car and presenting no difficulties whatsoever. I'm puzzled by the "lots of 5 stars, lots of 1 stars" pattern to the reviews for this item, but all I can do is report that, thus far, I've got five months use from mine with no issues.ORIGINAL REVIEW - INITIAL INDICATIONSI got this unit for two reasons ... to support multi-phone charging and to deliver enough amps to actually charge a phone/phones while the phones are in use, not just hold the charge level steady while the phones are in use. The old chargers I've had for my Galaxy S5 were able to supply only enough current that, when I was using the phone for map following while driving, the charge level would hold just about even, never gaining more than 1% or 2% charge in as long as an hour or two of driving. If the phone was off, the battery would charge a bit.This Omaker charger supplies much greater power and even while the phone is in use, the battery charge builds steadily. We haven't used it in "multi-phone" mode yet, but once we have, I'll supply information on performance.Other Notes - The unit plugs easily into our cigarette lighter socket (not all the units we've had in the past did), the blue status light makes it easy to find in low light and the USB connection ports work well.So far, 100% satisfied with this unit and it is clearly the best I've had so far, much better than any of the others I've tried.

I was recently given the opportunity to try out the IBSound Casual Style Polka Dots Canvas Laptop Backpack (CSPDCLB - black) in exchange for an honest review of the product. As our family is rather bonkers over backpacks as a way to carry our stuff from here to there (school, work, day trips, mini-breaks, weekenders, sleepovers, etc.), I jumped at the chance, and offered to my 12 year old step-daughter the opportunity of being the test subject for this product, which she agreed to immediately. After using it for a week or so, she came into my room and said "Five Stars ... I love it."  And her use of the pack proves that. :)AFTER ONE WEEK'S USEWe discussed her experience of the pack thus far and here's what she had to say (paraphrased, of course):SIZE AND LAPTOP CARRYINGMy step-daughter has a 15" Dell laptop PC.  While her PC won't fit in this pack's designated laptop compartment (which is designed only for 14" laptops) the pack's main compartment is comfortably big enough to hold her 15" Dell laptop and my step-daughter uses it this way and says it works very well. She can use the intended laptop compartment for papers, large format books, notebooks, etc.  She likes the overall capacity of the pack and feels comfortable stuffing it full of things, including her coat when she doesn't need to wear it.POCKETS & COMPARTMENTSWhen asked if she felt the pack had a good number and mix of pocket types (see other reviews for photos of same) my step-daughter said she was very happy with the offering of "places to put things" in the CSPDCLB. She found the zippers to be easy to spot (white tabs on black canvas ... a darned good idea, and I wish more pack makers took more thought to make zipper tabs stand out against the fabric for easy location) and smooth to use.CONSTRUCTIONDespite the fact that the backpack is very light-weight, it's made from a tough canvas that feels very substantial. The build of the pack in general feels sturdy.  The shoulder straps are nicely padded and my step-daughter said it was comfortable to carry, even when fully loaded.AFTER LONGER TERM USEI'll report back in a few months (when the pack has had some daily wear) to report on how it's held up to daily use to-and-from my step-daughter's school ... strap endurance, zipper function, etc.
