And when you see the mysterious words "Network Lamp," that particular function turns the blinking green network light on the back of the camera on and off.Pretty soon I was getting more email messages than I could stand, so I set up a FTP service to a website I own where I can store the pictures.If you use Internet Explorer you are home free, you can view an array of cameras with one login, and monitor sound, too.  I don't like Internet Explorer, I use Firefox, so right now I have to login to each camera for live viewing.  There are plenty of free or cheap monitoring solutions out there.  Last night I tested out iSpy which seems to do the job of monitoring multiple cameras for not so much dinero.  Once I get it all figured out, I will settle down on a permanent monitoring solution.  But at first, you will just monitor through your Internet Browser.Setting up port-forwarding for worldwide-internet-viewing was pretty darn easy considering how much jabber there is in these reviews about it (You need to use a proxy, or go to the coffee shop, to test port-forwarding...I couldn't get it to work until I logged in with a proxy...found that tip on Amazon, too!).Everything is crystal-clear, with no noise.  The night-vision will light up a large room.Seriously, if you have no concept of what an IP address is, or you don't know how to access your router (and you don't want to learn), you should avoid messing with these cameras.  If you just want to run these on your own local network, and you know a little, the complaints about difficult setup are way overstated.These cameras are an outstanding value, but research carefully to understand the limitations before you buy one.

I own both a Lasko 2521 and 2527.  Despite the similar appearance, the fans work differently.  The 2527 is considerably louder, and blows substantially more air.  The 2521 is quieter, and does not blow as much air.I like having some background noise in my office, and I heat up easily.  The 2521 is (barely) quiet enough to be positioned 8 feet from me, while set on "low".  However, the 2527 provides too much noise (and air) for this use, even on "low".The 2527 is used in another location where I need more airflow (blowing air between rooms), and I am not as concerned about the noise.  Therefore, it works better in this situation than the 2521 would.Neither fan could be considered anywhere near "whisper quiet" when used in a quiet room, and the fan is within 10 feet of you.  However, if you want the quieter of the two, go with the the 2521. If you want maximum airflow, or you're working in a noisy shop, no doubt the 2527 will serve you better.By the way, my 2521 and 2527 replaced two other Laskos that each ran 9 months a year, 12-16 hours per day, for 15 years.

This microphone stand is cheap, and it does a good job holding a large microphone steady.  However, I purchased this stand so the microphone could be extended forward towards me, perhaps hanging a little over the desktop.  Unfortunately, the gooseneck as pictured on Amazon is much longer than the one I received.  My gooseneck is approximately 7" long; the one pictured in the ad is at least 12" long (See the user pictures I posted at the top of the listing).I did try a 12" gooseneck with this stand, and it was unstable with my 1-pound microphone.  So, Pyle probably decided it was too unstable and substituted a shorter gooseneck.  Amazon should update the picture to show what you will actually get.  Just be aware the stand might not be as adjustable as you might think.Someone else pointed out that the base casting looks like a science experiment.  I couldn't agree more!  Even the Romans made prettier castings than this!

This box works the way it's advertised (2 Inputs, 1 Output), or the leads can be reversed (1 Input, 2 Outputs).I have mine set up "reversed," and I use it to select between two sets of speakers in my home recording setup.It appears to be designed for A/B operation.  You press one switch down and the other goes up.  However, by carefully manipulating the switches, it is possible to latch them in other positions. I have achieved the following four modes of operation:Switch A down:  Output to ASwitch B down:  Output to BBoth switches down:  Output to A and BBoth Switches up:  No outputPS:  The unit I received was NOT an RCA brand, however it looks identical to the one in the picture...minus the RCA logo.

I am going to concentrate on the heating characteristics of this appliance, as others have covered most of the features pretty well.All "modern" slow cookers cook food to hotter temperatures in faster times than the old slow-cookers of yore.  The trouble these days is finding a slow-cooker that does not get too hot...too fast; this defeats the entire purpose of buying a "slow-cooker" in the first place.I recently tried another brand of cooker that, when set on "low,"  brought a full load of water to a rolling boil in less than 2 hours!  This is unacceptable for a slow cooker.  If you expect to leave such a "fast-cooker" for a full work day, your meal will be petrified when you return.I tested this slow cooker by checking the temperature of a full pot of water as it heated on "Low" over a 6 1/2 hour period.  The GRAPH OF THE RESULTS is available in the product pictures at the top of the listing.  In summary, this slow cooker heated a full load of room-temperature water to a temperature of approximately 205 degrees Fahrenheit over the test period.  This seems to indicate that this particular appliance will be less prone to overcooking in a given time period than some other slow-cooker models, though it will still cook faster than a "vintage" slow-cooker!In comparison, my 35-year-old vintage slow-cooker reaches a maximum temperature of 195 degrees Fahrenheit over a 12-HOUR period when set on "Low."  My old "vintage" cooker will not ruin a meal during a workday.  However, slow-cookers that actually cook "slow" seem to be unavailable these days, due to the manufacturers yammering with the heat controls.By starting off with refrigerator-cold ingredients (instead of water at 74 degrees, as I did), you can probably manage to cook a decent meal in a normal 9-10 hour workday with this thing.

Extremely lightweight.  I've had them on for 5 hours with no discomfort!  Nice sound reproduction...bass is good but not overdone.  Cord is too short.  The retro look is swell!  Got black but now I wish I'd gone for red!

Having read and thoroughly enjoyed Raban's 'Bad Land,' I really looked forward to reading this book.  Bad Land is all about pure unadulterated misery, but somehow the inhabitants of that god-forsaken place are shown to be decent souls with human dignity.Raban's just now clearing Lock 6 at Trempealeaw, and I'm abandoning ship before we've even left Minnesota.  I can journey no further south with this contemptible ass.  His misanthropic disdain for people who show nothing but kindness to him is quite appalling.  I'm no flag-waving provincialist; I'm something of a cynic myself.  But, I've journeyed all over the world, and have never felt compelled to straight-arm a local's accent, clothing, mannerisms, dietary habits, housing, or the width of his neck.There are many other books available that document voyages down the Mississippi, usually in a craft much less river-worthy than a 16-foot speedboat.  Try "Paddle to the Amazon" for a starter.

After reading all the negative reviews on here, and studying the reviews of comparable products for about a week, I took the plunge on this one.  I have Windows 7 and 4MB on my computer.  I have now had this software (version 10, build 179) for about 6 months.  I have had NO trouble making dozens of videos up to about 10 minutes in length, importing video from my Canon point-and-shoot and also my dedicated camcorder, or using the software.  The software is very intuitive after 30 minutes of use.  I have referred to the manual about 3 times. I have never had a program crash, or lost any work!  As far as I can see, this software should suit the home user/hobbyist/YouTube creator perfectly.  There are more options than I can ever shake a stick at.  You can't do it much cheaper or easier than this!**UPDATE AFTER ONE YEAR OF USE:  Software has never crashed, lost my work, or failed to render any project correctly.  I think this software was a wonderful deal.  Very impressed.

Had this two weeks.  Bought to upgrade my old router, which was WPA only.  Setup was a pain, as the IP address of the router conflicts with my DSL modem, and trying to use the included software to get it straight (and closely following the directions) caused more problems than it solved.  Once set up manually, however, it has performed flawlessly.  The router is downstairs in the middle of a 2500 square-foot 2-story house, and I usually have 4 bars (but never less than three) no matter where I take a laptop, even upstairs.  Good buy, overall.

There is an amazing amount of info packed in this little book.  Should please anyone except for the person looking for highly-technical design minutia. This is not a design book about how to build or reproduce a certain vintage Telecaster, but is a great history balanced with enough technical details to please 90% of those interested in the topic. This is proud Americana at its finest; an inspiring story of the American Dream, of the lone genius making himself rich and creating something still extensively used and recognized in every country and hamlet on earth, that screams "AMERICA" whenever it makes a sound.

A replacement adaptor for my Toshiba costs $100.  I got this as an "open box" item from a trusted seller here on Amazon for a tenth of that.  Works like a charm, no switches to throw because the voltage regulation is customized into each individual tip.  The whole thing appears very-well made.  Came with 10 tips which should cover nearly anythng.  I installed the proper tip and checked it with my ohm-meter and the voltage was dead-on. Highly recommended if you can get it as an "open-box" or "customer-return" item from a trusted seller.

I bought this for my daughter as a graduation present when she got her M.S. and before she started on her first "real" job.  My wife told me not to buy it, 'because 23-year-old women are so fickle', and a man could never pick out what she wanted!  She gushed over it, and every time I see her she's wearing it.  She was quite impressed that it was a "real" watch, and said it was the first "real" watch she has ever owned. Makes me feel good because I know she likes it.

UPDATE AFTER TEN DAYS OF USE:  Absolutely amazing.  The barking fron next door has dwindled to nothing.  You would not even know there were any dogs there.  I can't believe we suffered so long.ORIGINAL REVIEW:  Based on the reviews, it looks like the Lentek Bark Free works about half the time.  So I took a chance.  So far, it's working!  The two dogs next door quit barking the moment it was put out there, 4 days ago.  Tonight I detected a minor amount of barking, nothing like previous to the Lentek.  The dog was now standing on the other side of his yard (away from my fence and the Lentek) barking occasionally at about 1/4 of his former volume, so I can no longer hear them....unless I'm trying to hear them.  My back yard is the standard small suburban back yard, about 50' deep by 90' wide.  I can see how this thing would not work on an acreage; the dog needs to be within a few feet of it to trigger it.  It is completely silent to (my) human ears.  The 50' cord and power supply is great, who wants to worry about batteries in these things?  The build quality is not impressive, it looks and feels really flimsy. But it's WORKING, so it gets 5 stars!  Good luck with yours!

Great for playing alone and jamming with youself.  I normally don't read manuals; but you need to read over the important parts in the (short) manual about 2 times before firing this thing up.  Try starting with AUTO mode; it will take about 1-2 hours of trial and error to get rockin'!  Once you figure it out, it works like a charm.  The auto-quantize function is great.GET OUT THE MANUAL AND FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS CAREFULLY WHEN YOU SAVE YOUR FIRST LOOP!  You have to do it in a certain way or you might lose it.  This thing won't play the guitar for you; you need some basic skills first.  But using the RC-2 is MUCH easier than learning those basic guitar skills, so don't be scared off!There is an accessory called the Boss FS-5U, which is a non-latching standard Roland Pedal.  This pedal makes the RC-2 much easier to use, because you can set the drum tempo with your foot.  Not necessary for the flexible people out there, better for the old guy.I don't think this box would suit any live player.  Keep it in your bedroom.  The technology is amazing.

Beats the heck out of a plastic bag.  Be sure to carefully measure your arm and order the right size.  Somewhat difficult to put on the first time; over a few uses it "stretches" and becomes much easier.  Probably tougher than it looks.  After a few weeks I dispensed with the rubber bulb and just started sucking the air our by mouth.  Easier and faster!  A fabulous product for someone who's stuck with a Picc line for months.

I didn't have much hope for this book when I picked it up from a giveaway pile.  Once I started reading it, I was dumbfounded.  Halfway through their round-the-world trip in their 43' schooner, this Swiss-Family-Robinson group was attacked by killer whales off the coast of South America; their boat sank in less than 2 minutes.  With virtually no provisions, the master led them through a 37-day ordeal in a hair-raising voyage that easily rivals Shackleton's 1916 16-day voyage in the James Caird.  Several reviewers commented that not much emotion is shown in the telling of this book; I submit that I would rather have Dougal Robertson or Shackleton saving my life than someone who is more emotionally "connected!"  Another inspiring book that shows the amazing power and adaptability of the human mind when pushed to unimaginable circumstances.

I'm going to compare this watch to my old Data Link 150, which this watch replaced.Benefits: Cheap, display very easy to read-much more so than the 150, easy to adjust bracelet...took 5 minutes, don't pay $15 to a jeweler for this unless you are a klutz, locking bracelet, USB transfer works great, crown scroll wheel much better than the button-pressing 150 mode, free software is very adequate, password system is very useful and a real necessity to use this thing in the way it was intended.Reservations: It's ugly.  I don't trust the part-plastic bracelet.  I would much prefer (and would GLADLY pay more for, Timex, hint) an upgraded, dressier, all-stainless, silver-and-gold toned case and full stainless bracelet like my 150 came with.  It would be 5 stars with these things fixed.UPDATE 5-11-2012  Still ugly as sin, but holding up great!

I bought the D-520Z as my third digital camera. I have many years of photography experience, and have owned more than two dozen 35mm film cameras.This is a great camera for the person who is somewhat fussy, but still wants an easy-to-use optical zoom platform. For the benefit of people who don't read instructions, one may view a just-snapped picture by pressing the display button twice or (better yet) setting the camera up to display the picture for about 2 seconds after snapping it. Also, all settings can be memorized so the camera is ready to go as soon as you fire it up. For instance, I use fill flash on nearly every outdoor shot that involves people, and I have a preference for spot-metering. Both of these items are selectable and memorizable.Although the flash recycle time is a little slow, I consider it a very fair trade-off for being able to use AA batteries and only two of them at that.  Performance with NiMH batteries is outstanding; on a recent vacation I took over 100 pictures, most with flash, with extensive use of the LCD, and never changed batteries.Low-light performance is acceptable to me, and I take a lot of pics indoors.The camera is quite compact (fits easily in a shirt pocket with room to spare), and most important, the body is relatively thin.  Before you buy ANY camera, consider whether you really want to lug that clunky (and expensive) digital camera around for the sake of a possible tiny increase in picture quality.The true measure of any camera is picture quality, and I find this one to be very good.  I'm finicky, and I'm pleased.This camera is not as sexy-looking as some of the competition (read ELPF), but the price is right and I feel beginners and amateurs will be able to take a very high percentage of good pics with this one. Highly recommended...hats off to Olympus.

This production is inferior to the 1973 movie in almost every way.  Glenn Carter's portrayal of Jesus is listless...the one exception being the 39 Lashes scene....where no singing is required. Jerome Pradon, while fairly capable, lacks the extra oomph required to do justice to his character.  Pilate (Fred Johanson) deserves jail time for his criminal overacting.  Mary does a good job with her part, as does Simon Zealotes as Peter.  Finally, let me say that I found myself drifting off to sleep a couple of times....that never happens during the 1973 version!

Amazing, awe-inspiring, gripping. Expertly explores the immensity of the human spirit.  Condenses a huge subject matter into a heart-stopping escape. Ideal as a vehicle for getting anyone interested in the history of polar exploration.  The Best of the Best.It's been years since I last read this account, but it still causes me to shiver when I recall the adventure of the men of the Endurance.It is mind-boggling that men such as these existed less than 100 years ago.  Daring, heroic, determined, and intelligent...and caught up in a time before the widespread use of some of our most common and powerful technologies...like internal combustion engines and instant communications...their story is practically without equal in the annals of adventure writing.Whenever I feel I am having a difficult time, I think back to this story and these events, and it certainly helps me to put things in perspective.People who have never known a time without radio, motorized travel, telephones, 911, or rescue helicopters will hardly be able to believe the true events chronicled in this book.A more exciting, tension-filled, true-life chronicle will be very difficult to find.

What a nice, well thought out rfid blocking money belt.  There is the mesh that will be against my body.  This is much more comfortable than the whole material.  It's even possible to put a cloth inside for even more comfort.There are two zippered compartments on the outside and a mesh area inside for smaller items. The strap is very soft and adjustable.  If I dont fill this too much it would be totally hidden under a sweatshirt sweater.The rfid blocking is a worthy plus.  No reason to keep cards hidden if they still aren't protected.  The little TSA lock is a nice thing to have, too.  Keep unauthorized hands out but TSA can still access the inside of the suitcase.This is a wonderful travel set  that everyone should have.  Discount or sample provided for honest review.

These brushes are thick, soft and plush.  These brushes look like they were made with quality in mind.The handles are smooth and feel solid and strong.  The brush heads are thick and soft.All of them are full.The brush tops are angled for different uses and the tips are white with the rest of it black.These brushes will be a gift for a friend.  The quality is definitely here so I know this is going to be a welcome gift.  Discount or sample provided for honest review.

This handle is extremely comfortable. The head will bend down a bit of needed. This de-shedding brush feels good to our cat.  I know this because she stays put and let's us brush her.  She had problems with hair balls a while back.  We have another brush but it didn't do a very good job, obviously.This de-shedding brush is great.  It gets of loose hair and trims her up somewhat.  We are getting enough to keep her from swallowing it, and that is our goal.We love our cat and want her to be healthy and this brush will help us make that happen.Discount or sample provided for honest review.

The magnet feature is cool. The ear buds hook together. '.I had a difficult time getting these headphones to pair with my phone.  I couldn't find the light that blinks, so, I figured they were dead and charged them up.  I still couldn't get them to pair but then I finally noticed the light. It is tiny.  I will try to get a photo of it.  Anyway,  it did pair with my phone.Phone calls sound very clear.  Music sounds very good too but there is not a strong bass.  The waterproof feature is great.  You never know how much you may sweat or when you may get caught in the rain.These are very good headphones if a not strong bass is no problem.Discount or sample provided for honest review.

What perfect timing!  I received these gloves just yesterday.  Today, we got our first snowfall of the season with temperatures in the high 20s.  We had to finish up on a job outside, that involved metal (brrr) and I grabbed my fur lined leather gloves, out of habit.  Before long, I was inside to grab these new gloves.  We were outside for a couple hours, working and shivering but my hands stayed warm.Most importantly, my fingers stayed warm.  That is totally rare. I live in Minnesota and sometimes it gets cold.  It's hard to be outside and keep my fingers warm without wearing two or three pairs of gloves and mittens.  Now, clearly, I have a nice, warm pair of gloves here.These gloves will be the ones I use when I shovel the driveway, or even go check the mail.  These gloves are bit bigger than my hands but I'm wondering if I may need that for a warm liner for when it gets cold.  The inside is so cosy and warm, though.I'm so happy to have warm fingers today.  These are really good gloves.  They look cool too.  The wrist strap is adjustable to make it tighter or looser on wrist. And there is the sleeve part that goes inside coat sleeves so there is no space for air to get inside coat.Discount or sample provided for honest review.

I like this toiletry bag.  It is water resistant and big enough to hold what I like to take.  Usually, my brush has to just get tossed in the bag or my over crowded purse.  This bag can handle my brush, toothbrush, and even the little plastic bag with tiny shampoo and stuff (for the plane ride).I like the inside compartment for small items, like jewelry or floss, and the outside zipper has a piece of braided paracord. I really like the ready for anything mentality here.  The straps on the outside make it easy to grab this bag from any direction plus it looks good. This is a very good travel bag that will get a lot of use.Discount or sample provided for honest review.

This is a really unique item!  The 3m glue on the back is a very strong bond.  It even works on oily substances and I'm thinking hands and fingers.So, the wallet will stay stuck to where it is put.  I do like the idea of this wallet.  So many times, especially in the winter, I don't like to carry a purse.  I do need my phone, id, and a credit card or cash.  My phone will easily fit in my coat pocket and with this rfid blocking wallet attached, my id and credit card are safe from electronic thieves.  I don't have enough to steal anyway!The protection factor is great.  And so is the convenience.  What a great idea and it works great for me!Discount or sample provided for honest review.

The music from this compact mp4 player is very good.  I had a easy time with the music for this player.  It's easy to load songs on it and music is the first option when it's turned on.  The music sounds very good too.  I hear a full range of highs and lows.  The ear phones are not very good.  Well, it's the style I don't like.  I have a hard time keeping this type of earphone comfortably in my ears.The video is clear.  There are two cartoons on the player and they look very good.For a small, not name brand player, it works very well.  It is well worth giving it a try.  I'm happy to have this one.  Discount or sample provided for honest review.

Nice smoke detector.  It is low key in looks yet has a loud alarm.  9v battery is all that's needed.  No electricity, which I really like. We never known if a storm or strong winds will knock out the power and to still have our smoke detecters work is important.This one comes with screws to hang in the wall a diagrams of where to place smoke detectors for safety. This smoke detector would make a wonderful gift.  A gift to keep people safe.Discount or sample provided for honest review.

Apparently, winter is on its way.  The temperature is dropping and no one wants to stay outside to watch the grill.  The probe and transmitter connect very well to the receiver.  It's easy to set up and then it's just a matter of waiting for the meat.My brother usually grills a turkey for Thanksgiving but we do it sometimes, too.  This thermometer set will really come on handy for us.  It's important to keep the lid down, but running outside to check the temperature is no fun.So, we used the thermometer set yesterday, as a dry run, on a chicken.  It worked great for us with no problems.  Of course, chickens are faster than turkey's but it all works the same.Good digital thermometer I recommend to anyone that lives in an unfriendly climate during grilling season. Discount or sample provided for honest review.

This set of makeup brushes is incredible.  32 pieces in a leather roll.  The brushes are almost to beautiful to use.  There are five red ones,  22 yellow and black, two sponges, one brush that is copper colored, one wire brush and one comb and brush combo.These brushes are all different sizes and shapes.  The brushes are obviously all cut, shaped and sized for a particular use. Well, yes its clear I don't wear a lot of makeup.  I do have friends and relatives that do and I can appreciate the quality of these brushes.I have never seen goat hair brushes before.  These are very soft yet they don't collapse. While there are knock offs that may look the part nothing can compare to the OtterBox.The clear case is great looking on the Iphone 6 and the access to the function is 100% there without the bulk.There's no reason to take any risk by going cheap and getting a knock off, always go OtterBox.

This is the coolest kids watch ever!Way ahead of it's time, *snicker*, your kids will love this watch! It's more or less the watch I wanted as a kid and best described as THE Dick Tracy watch, but now fully realized in real life.Packed with amazing features your kids are going to be entertained and the envy of their friends. They can tell time, take pictures, video and play games. The battery is rechargeable and it last a decent amount of time considering how much the watch will get used, which is going to be frequently because your kids won't want to put it down.It's well made, but water is going to be have to avoided so keep this away from the bath and the pool in the Summer.Over all I can't really find one negative aspect of the watch and if you are looking for a truly unique gift that will be the talk of the town between your child and their friends, then this is a great choice as a first watch or just all around cool gift.

Let me make clear, this is HUGE and that's fine with me.It took little time to assemble, and we decided to use this in the house, not on the deck and it's really been extremely helpful in clearing up a major space issue for us.I realize that this is designed for the outside, but that does not mean you have to use it outside.If you are looking for an option to create more space and need a large storage container that is visually pleasing, the synthetic wicker will do the job.Yes, this looks like wicker, but it's resin.

You can never go wrong with Otterbox cases. Every single phone I have owned in the past few years has always been protected with confidence and style using their cases. The newest entry for the Moto G 3rd Gen is no different.The case fits perfectly over the Moto G, and personally I really dig the design!Worth every penny.

It's very simple, there is no better protection for your smartphone then the quality of an Otterbox. There are plenty of cheap imitations that may look the part, but there is only one that is the real deal, and when you're talking about protecting an investment with a value over $700 why would you even consider going with the cheap knock off?Once again OtterBox knocks it out of the park with a fantastic case for the Note 5, I've owned each previous version of this phone and I learned my lesson the hard way on the Note 1 by not using an OtterBox, never again would I make that mistake. The new Defender case from OtterBox for the Note 5 provides excellent protection with style and no limits to access of the functioning parts of the Note 5. I have had zero issue.Extremely well made and highly recommended.

You can never go wrong with Otterbox cases. Every single phone I have owned in the past few years has always been protected with confidence and style using their cases. The newest entry for the LG Leon LTE is no different.The case fits perfectly over the LG and looks great!Never go with the off brands, they aren't the same.OutterBox is worth it 100%

Very nice and well made hair dryer that is on par with some of the more expensive salon dryers but priced extremely reasonable given the features and benefits that this dryer provides.It's lightweight, but durable.Powerful, but adjustable and doesn't feel like you're burning your hair.It also has a really great filter that that will extend the life of the motor by trapping the lint which is very important and the #1 killer of any dryer.It also comes with a diffuser which most dryers at this price point do not include.I can recommend this dryer as a great alternative to one of the more pricy professionals that will set you back a hundred or more where as this one falls in under the $40 mark making it a fantastic value!

There's so many reasons why this gets 2 stars, and only two reasons why it does not get one star.Those reasons are the low carbs, and high protein, but the negatives out weigh the benefits here and there are many.*This is not an organic product, extremely disappointing considering that it's Vegan*There is no way to get past the taste, it's brutal and trying to mask it only makes it taste worse and we tried a few combinations with various fruits and there is no getting around it, it tastes terrible like you're drinking a salt shake*Which brings me to this point, it's a sodium overload which is terrible and extremely unhealthy*The bag itself is of poor design and you will need to find an alternative container to put this inThere's better organic alternatives out there that may cost you a little more but are going to be way better on the health meter, and absolutely better on the taste buds.I cannot recommend this.

Lets go over first that this works as expected and is extremely well made. Belkin absolutely offers up a quality product here that gives you the flexibility of being able to charge up to 4 devices at once with varying degrees of power which is adaptable and detectable from the charging station once you plug in your devices, and that is awesome. For that reason alone I can say that this is a 5 star product that does what it says it's supposed to do.So why 3 stars? Quite simply the price. You are paying for the brand name here and for me I just cannot justify the absurd price point when you have alternatives out there from Anker which offers an alternative product that does the exact same thing for half the price, and same quality IMO.If anything you can be rest assured the Belkin will last so your investment should you go this route is a lock and you are getting what you pay for by doing so.

This is the rockstar of cradles!Absolutely one of the best I have seen, and has so many unique features.The main feature of course is swinging, and as anyone knows this is a lifesaver for both you and the baby, making baby very happy!In addition it has a built in music feature of baby tunes that soothes and calms, and the ability to play your own MP3s of music of your choice via the MP3 connector that is built in. Excellent feature!Another fantastic feature is how you can simply remove the cradle for portability on the go so it serves as dual purpose for carrying the baby. This also leads into the ease of storage and hold it folds up so it's not taking up space when it's not in use.The cradle itself is also well made and ensures confidence that your little bundle of joy is well protected with fear or worry that the cradle will break down while in use or over time.Bravo!

The best thing about Turtle Beach headsets and my experience with them over the years is consistency! Every single one I have owned except for one, has always impressed and this new entry is no different especially if you are budget conscience, but still want a rich gaming audio experience.The new Recon delivers excellent sound, and a great feature of being able to have mic control on the PS4/PS3 so you can hear yourself in the headset. Sounds were full and have plenty of bass.I also used these on the Xbox One and they work without any additional add-ons sans the Xbox One headset adapter which is sold separately and is specific to the Xbox One as being a needed item to use 3rd party headsets. The only feature not available by using it with the Xbox One as a plug and play is the mic ability with being able to hear yourself, that feature is specific to the Sony systems because you will need the adapter that IS included here only for the Sony systems.My only word of caution is that this headset is a snug fit, and for me having a small head that is perfect but some with a larger head could run into discomfort issues, so a little word of caution here. However after gaming with these for some pretty long sessions I found no personal discomfort.Excellent job Turtle Beach!

After a few uses I can say the mop does work as expected and I really do like the way it purges the dirty water to drain and clean the mop dry after first coat on the kitchen floor. The spinning function of plunging the mop works better then expected, and the mop itself holds a decent amount of water for first coat.I did not experience any leaking from the bucket as some have so that's good.The mop itself detaches easily for throwing into the laundry and held up in that test too.My only real complaint is that the way the two buckets attach and keeping them together does not always work out and I had more then one occasion where the two adjoining parts separated which was annoying. I wish there was a locking feature on the buckets the way there is on the mop itself to prevent it from pushing down to prevent that from happening so I have to be more mindful when picking the bucket up after full.Other then that one minor flaw, I do like the mop.

Used this on a recent camping trip and I can honestly say this is a very comfortable and well made sleeping bag. The bag has not yet been tested however in 0 degree since this is still Summer and I am on the East Coast, however I will be doing an updated review for a planned trip in December that will be cross country where I am sure to encounter 0 degree.

Our dogs love Nutro and we've been feeding it to them for years. It's one of the most reliable dog foods on the market. We've never had a worry about the contents or fear of the food coming from anywhere else but the USA. Filled with some of the best stuff dogs can get for daily nutrition I can easily highly recommend Nutro as a safe bet for your pooch!

I am gonna be honest, before the camera arrived I had low expectations, and it was not because of the reviews but just prior experience using a camera that promised what the Myfox does and not delivering. Let me tell you up front, YES this works exactly as described and was above and beyond my expectations.First off lets talk about the size. The camera is much smaller (happy about this) then what I was expecting when the box arrived. The camera itself can fit in the palm of your hand and it's very well made.Set up is extremely easy.*plug it in*download the MyFox security app*set up the account*activate*start monitoringThat's it.Side note. MyFox also comes with power adapters for various country requirements, meaning you could take this with you on a trip to Europe and use it in a hotel abroad if they have WiFi to monitor your hotel room. I kid you not, it has 4 attachments enclosed and this was a pleasant surprise and IMO this makes it great having for the traveling business person or family vacation. That being said it was easy to find the proper attachment for US outlets and assemble by snapping into place.How's the video quality? AMAZING! Clear as can be on my Samsung Note, and I can even hear the audio in the room! There are also options on the app to go backwards and view footage from moments before, save, or screen capture! You can also zoom in by simply using your fingers on your smartphone to widen the shot. The aspect ratio FYI is widescreen with a fish eye on the outer edges.I also tested the night vision, and again - knocked it out of the park!There's really not one negative thing to say here except, I wish I had more then one.
Very classy and elegant! The lady loved them. The earrings are made very well, and just simply beautiful.

For the price point this is a very good helmet and the fact that it's solar powered for me is a huge plus. I had no issues so far with any flashing and the helmet fits perfectly on my head. I should say however, I do have a small head and I could see the potential that if you have a larger sized head this could be a bit of a tighter fit for some.The lens area is a bit bigger then your standard job helmet.There is no grind mode, but that's not really a big deal to me so you will be switching on your own.My only concern which is not enough to knock it down a star is that I can see the potential after a lot of use that the shiny black coat will wear out, but that's a cosmetic issue and does not impact the main purpose of the helmet. It's not a fashion statement, it's protection and so far it does that very very well.I will update my review later on after some solid time with it but so far I cannot find any real negative as to why you should not buy this helmet considering the cost is very reasonable and it gets the job done.

As with any supplement, results may vary and while one may work for someone else it does not mean it will work for you. There should also be caution when taking anything that is going to help increase your endurance, so before you jump head first into supplements for your work out if this is your first time shopping for one, make sure your body is ready.Cellucor Nitric Oxide Pump Amp is a great addition to any workout for anyone who is going to be lifting on a regular basis, and is also following a strict regimen of routine. It's not meant to be a replacement for natural energy generated from proper diet, or exercise and it certainly needs to be taken as instructed for the best results. If you are looking for an extra kick that will allow you get more reps out of your lift, this will help.

You can never go wrong with Otterbox cases. Every single phone I have owned in the past few years has always been protected with confidence and style using their cases. The newest entry for the Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge is no different.The case fits perfectly over the SGS6E, and while some may feel it limits the overall style of the initial design, I would not trade that over the protection of my phone any day of the week.Worth every penny.

Wow! I have owned a Forman Grill before, the smaller ones when they first hit the market which I loved before it finally outlived it's usefulness. This grill however blows that out of the water for many reasons. First of which this is a full sized grill which means that you can prepare more food and it eliminates the need of using a grill that requires charcoal or gas which IMO is better. Why? Well you can use this grill literally inside the house, you could never do that with an outside grill. This means year round use rather then use just during the warmer months.Now lets talk about the assembly. At first glance when you remove everything from the box it may seem a bit overwhelming, but once you realize where everything goes (I did this without even looking at the guide FYI), it's extremely easy and quick to put together. You will need a phillips head for the cover.Cooking is a breeze to, I made burgers and for me I am on the Atkins diet so I had been using the outdoor grill which required a whole process of cleaning with the brush, turning on the gas, using a lighter, etc. With the Foreman you simply plug it in, turn up the heat, place your food on and within mins you have perfectly cooked burgers! The other advantage the grill has is the same advantage the smaller grill has, it removes a large portion of the fat from the burgers making them a more healthy choice then using the standard grill.Another advantage the Foreman has over a a gas or charcoal how easy this is to clean which I wanted to reemphasize. You simply pop off the grill from the base after unplugging the power cable and wipe it down in the sink with warm soapy water using a soft cloth and dry it off with a soft or paper towel. No grill needed or steel brush.You can also pop the grill off the stand and use it on a heat safe surface, which also means when you are ready to store the grill after use break down is as simple as setting it up.Save money on propane, and no more messy charcoal!This grill is awesome.Highly recommended!

GolfBuddy is simply put, an amazing device that will improve your game tremendously by doing some very useful things, and I am gonna break it down for you.Lets go over the key features of what it does*Precise yardages - displays front, middle and back yardages of the green, wherever you are on the course*Dynamic green view and pin placement - the user can alter the yardages based on where the pin is located on the green*Digitial scorecard - allows you to keep track of scores*Shot tracking - find out far you really hit that drive*Auto-course and hole recognition - turn it on and head straight to the first teeIt works from the first time you turn it on as you approach the course by logging you in as you approach, but the real magic of the GoldBuddy is it's ability to pinpoint yardages to the front, middle and back of the green from the golfer's angle of approach by simply looking at your wrist.You can even track your shot to see how far your drives are going.Want to dial in yardage to the flag? Yup, GolfBuddy does that too!Look for hazards? Yes sir.GolfBuddy is also very easy to use, and easy to charge.I honestly cannot imagine playing without it.Bravo!

Another knock it out of the park case from Otterbox and it's why I continue to use them with every phone I have upgraded.The reality is, I am clumsy and Otterbox has proven time and time again why they are the best when it comes to phone protection for those of us who are.As with previous Defender cases this one holds up as a solid entry to protect your Galaxy S6Active from accidental drops or another unpredictable circumstances that may put your phone into harms way due to the unforeseen accidents that can plague you when they do happen.I also put this to the test by dropping my phone from 5 feet onto the pavement, yup I did this so you don't have to and I could write this review for you to tell you. The result? Yes the phone was 100% protected with ZERO damage.100% recommend this case to any SG6A owner.

This is a fantastic tooth brush and idea to get kids in brushing after every meal mode. It makes brushing the teeth a fun experience instead of a chore. This does require you to own a smartphone or capable device however in order to make use of the app associated with the tooth brush and after awhile of course you can ween your child off the app and into just using the brush itself which is perfectly built for their teeth and hands.Lets talk about the brush itself a little bit. The brush does an excellent job of cleaning the teeth with the perfect amount of strokes to get into those hard to reach places that little hands may have a hard time cleaning on their own without the aid of the stroke. Just enough power in the charge to get the job done leaving the little pearly whites glistening, even after a hefty chocolate cone. As far as the strokes, we're talking 500 brush strokes per second. The other major benefit is the timer that used to lets kids know how long they need to be brushing those teeth, teaching them that you don't stop until the brush does! Excellent feature IMO.Being rechargeable also means, no batteries needed and the recharge time is generous enough that you do not have to worry about the brush kicking out after just a few uses incase it's not been placed back onto the charger after usage so you'll get many brushes in before it kicks out.Now lets talk about the app. Is it a gimmick? Yeah, sure but your kid does know that or care. It walks them through the process of how to properly brush in a fun easy method that will ensure your kid is on the proper path to healthy clean teeth without you having to be the bearer of implementing this as a chore.All in all this is a solid product from Phillips that I can easily recommend as a great introduction for your child to the world of brushing their teeth on their own.

I have been using these exclusively on my Hofner. Earnie Ball continues to put out a top quality flatwound that stacks up easily to some of the higher priced strings on the market, but at a much more affordable budget conscious price point.Easy on the fingers and easy on the ears. I highly recommend these strings.

I have been using this stuff for a while and can 100% attest that it works! Now I would not recommend if you are a coffee drinker taking this and your coffee, that would be overkill. This also is only going to work if you are actually exercising, and eating a proper diet. It is not meant to be used by itself otherwise.If you are caffeine sensitive, I do not recommend this product, Even though it will not produce jitters, the effect could still be overwhelming for someone who is not used to taking it and has a sensitivity to caffeine. I would also only take the recommended dose.

The trained eye should not have any issue tagging it's mark and getting fantastic footage to replay the finer moments of the hunt, and the kill. The ATN Shot Trak-X HD was a perfect fit and provided clean clear quality footage of our weekend outing. A steady hand of course makes all the difference and a pro is gonna be able to get a lot of out this camera.Take it one step further and download or use any number of the free editing programs that are out there for video and you will be making excellent hunting videos like a pro in no time.Great camera!

Replaced our old cover and fits perfectly over our grill. It also looks great, our previous cover was black and we do prefer the green to the black. It also is easy to store when the grill is in use turning into itself like a bag which is very convenient.My only concern is use over time because the material is much thinner then our previous cover which was a very thick vinyl, but also very old and worn having a tear in it so we were due for a new cover.PROS:*fits perfectly over standard medium gas grill*easy to store during grill use*great colorCONS:*Very thin material which could become a problem over time but no way to know until multiple usage
Looks fantastic in our kitchen (which is grey), and has held up after multiple washings.Nothing negative to report.Great value!

This is great affordable Snorkel set that has held up over much use hence the time I took to write this review. It's held up in the pool and in the ocean. The mask has stayed clear and the snorkel has stayed clean. Excellent value!

Worth every single penny and then some. Elixir continues it's tradition with quality strings and I have not one negative thing to offer here. Any bass player will tell you that the sound you get is not just the guitar, the amp, or the player, it's all of that, but having a solid set of strings is just as important as all the other pieces and can be the deciding factor of if you are getting the most out of sound.These strings are great on the fingers, and great on the pick. I play both ways depending on the song and style. They have a very cool look to them that are a little brighter then the average strings and sound wise they will provide that nice smooth phat mellow sound for the finger, or the bright pluck off the pick ala Peter Hook (New Order).All in all I can highly recommend these to my fellow musicians.

These baby locks are actually better than any I have ever bought before.They are super strong, and none of the kids, or animals can get past them. My cats can't even chew through them (yet) like they have with old locks.I mainly got these because of the fact that my kitties chew through the others I have had. And for when my friends with young children are over. I put them on the cabinets down low to keep the kids and animals out.They are easy for an adult, or older child to operate, but hard enough for a younger child to not be able to operate.I received the 2 pack, but I will be ordering more, and I suggest them to everyone I Know now.These also attach to the cabinet very well, and don't seem like they are going to come off anytime soon, if ever.Overall I recommend these.I received these for free for the purpose of an honest review. My opinion is my own and is not influenced in any way.

I LOVE these headbands. I do love that there are four in a pack. I lose them (more like the cats take off with them, or my daughter steals them) like crazy.These have a non-slip lining of silicone on the inside, so that they don't slide near as easily as any other headband that I have used. They stretch easily, but they don't stretch out, if you get what I"m trying to explain.They hold when my hair is straightened or when it's curly, when it's a mess and just needs to be out of my face. They fit me and my daughter both very well, without any issues at all.They come in four colors, so you aren't stuck with just one. You can get a fourpack mix, or just pick a certain color.I find that they do slide a little bit, through the day, but not near as much as a hairband that doesn't have the non slip grip inside of them.Overall I recommend these hair bands, and I would purchase more.I received these at a discount for the purpose of an honest review. My opinion is my own and is not influenced in any way.

These rings are fantastic for anyone who works in a field where having a real ring could cause an issue. My husband works in the oil field, and if he were to get his ring caught, it could deglove his finger, or worse.I will make a note here that these rings run small. I ordered a size 10 because that is what my husband wears. However, it doesn't fit his fingers at all. It's about a size too small, and I am betting an 11 would fit him just right. They aren't quite stretchy enough to force it onto his finger.Otherwise, these are great rings. You get two colors, so your man could wear either one, or you could each wear one that is a different color if you wear the same size.They are plain and simple, so if they do get caught on something, and torn up, they are easy to replace if needed.Overall I recommend these rings, just be mindful of the size.I received these for free for the purpose of an honest review. My opinion is my own and is not influenced in any way.

There are a few reasons that I love these wipes.First is because they are flushable. I HATE body wipes that are not flushable.Secondly I love that they can be used on any part of your body. They aren't just toilet wipes.Also I love that they neutralize mens body odors. My husband works in the oil field, and sweats a lot. Especially in the summer. these work great for him!I do wish there were more in the box than there was, but otherwise I love them and so does my husband.Overall I do recommend these.I received these for free for the purpose of an honest review. These 'sprinkles' are fantastic!I can now provide my children with vitamins, and they don't even know it! No more fighting with them to take their 'pill' or gummy vitamins. 3:02 Mins I LOVE LOVE LOVE this set. I am an EO FREAAAAKKKK, and was so happy to get this case.The wooden case is made very well, and sturdy. The hinges and latch are golden, which look rather classy on the plain wooden box. The only design on the box i the doTerra name. You could always woodburn, or paint, or draw on it if you wished to change it up a little.Inside the box is dividers so that you can add longer bottles if you want to, rather than the standard 5-15mL bottles that it normally holds. It can hold up to 25 of these bottles.It also comes with a 'togo' pouch and 8 - 5/8 dram bottles. So that if you wish to take some of your EOs with you, you can easily do so. This is a cute little, but fairly loud alarm clock.The pink is bright and vibrant and made my daughter extremely happy.I feel that this will last quite some time with my daughter, even with the wear and tear, because of the silicone cover.This is battery powered, so you can pack it with you and take it anywhere you go.It also has a snooze function for those who are like me or my daughter and slap that alarm a few times every morning LOL.There is a night light on it, So that you can see around the room. I adore this little detangler brush! It's the PERFECT size for fitting into my purse, or my handbag. I have tried so many that were fantastic, but just too big and bulky to carry around with me. I am IN LOVE with this lunch bag!It is well made, and super strong. This item is so good I don't know where to start. This new release is completly loaded with a TON of new features and capabilities that you can't find in other chargers.PRO's:1. Very Easy to use if you'e familiar with Balance chargers. I opened the box and tested out every feature of this supply without even reading the manual.2. Bright, clear easy to read backlit oversized (good) resolution Touch screen Display with adjustable brightness and contrast.3.  Built-in AC to DC Power supply that can also be powered off a 12 volt source. No need to buy 12V power supply or a Big 12V Battery.4.  Built in Current and Voltage Regulated Programable Power Supply worth $80-100 on its own. You read that right.  Not only can it charge batteries but It can power other items directly from this device. The built in programable power supply limits are 1-28 Volts,  1-10 Amps  and 10-80 Watts with a 10 Hour limit. This means you can power most items from 1- 28 Volts that takes under 80 Watts as long as it draws 10 Amps or less. It does have some limitations. If you want to test out a low amperage LED without a regulator you'll run into  problems  as you can't limit current to under 1 Amp, or 10 Watts but you can Voltage limit it.5. 18 Easy to store programable memories Plus one extra for your last charging parameters.6. Built in 6 cell Battery Tester that will test  for both Voltage and Internal Resistance. With the high resolution display you can see the results of 6 cells simultaneously.7.) 5 Volt 3 Amp USB Power Supply that also has a "full page" of features including Current, Voltage, Capacity, Watt Hour and Run time display. This will allow you to charge and test the capacity of all your Rechargeable USB devices. Example. Wondering what the battery capacity of your iPhone is? Discharge it 100% then charge it on this charger. It will show you the the total energy it took to charge the IPhone. Volts, Current, Capacity, Watt Hours, Current Charging Watts  and total charging time. An added bonus is that the output tested at 5.26 Volts.8. I've owned over 30 Solar powered lights over the years and really like some of the unique features of this one making it my new favorite. I also have much bigger and more expensive solar lights but this one beats them out in features and practicality. First off when I opened the box I instantly noticed that it had a little more weight for such a small light. Actually the battery inside is larger then my $40-50 Solar lights. Inside it has an accessible and removable 3.7 volt 18650 1500mAh Li-ion inside. So when the battery dies out 3-5 years from now like it will. You can simply drop in a new 18650 cell without tearing the light apart and re-soldering in some proprietary flat hard to find li-poly cell that costs more then the light. That alone makes this light a great value.18650's are cheap and easily available. Stating at $2 each on Amazon and will give you about 300-500 full charge discharge cycles or and maybe 1000-1500 day night cycles as your light usually won't run out at night. You can even drop in a high end Panasonic 3,400mAh 18650 NCR18650B that will give you over double the capacity.Most of my other solar lights come with a ridiculous tiny little pin hole and pin to turn the light on and in only one position. I always hated that idea as if you have a power outage you can just move one or more of your solar lights indoors for emergency lighting. My other lights might work in a power outage but they will be constantly turning on and off or getting dimmer brighter with motion. That's great outdoors but not if you want to read a book. This one has a nice easy to use 4 position switch on the back. Not only does it have a switch but the switch is useful. You can set it to be on continuously on a lower brightness. Or Low/High when someone walks by. Or completely OFF and then it turns ON high if it detects motion and OFF again in 15 seconds. Since the battery is accessible and this light has a full time ON feature you can use it as an emergency indoor light for many days if you have some spare 18650 batteries.As for the light output. It's very bright  (I didn't test it with my photometric integrating sphere) the 160 Lumen rating seems accurate.  The LED's project a perfect WHITE light with no blueish or greenish tint that most solar lights have. The color Temperate looks about 4,500 Kelvin, about the color temperature of a vehicles factory HID lights or 300 Kelvin higher. The LED's have a great CRI or Coloring Color Rendering Index. Out of all 30+ of my Solar lights this is the only one that gives off a natural looking light that is spot on. It's also  surprisingly bright for it's 8 LED size and beats all my 16 LED solar lights and is equal to my 20 LED Solar lights.As for the solar panel. This is a smaller solar light with a proportionally smaller solar panel. In no way can it gather as much sun as my much bigger lights but the larger battery makes up for it some as it can store more reserve. The Motion sensor is claimed to work at a crazy 26 foot long max distance and 10-16 feet high. I haven't tested those claims as mine are only 10 feet high.I also haven't had it long enough to do full charge/discharge cycles so I can't say of the solar panel has the surface area to handle the light when subject to frequent battery draining motion detection. What ever you do you really need to mount Solar lights in the best spot to gather sun light year round. If you don't, after a few days of use you'll notice the lights will cut off later at night.If this is your first solar light you might want to attach it with velcro. 8-10 feet high is plenty. This will allow you to quickly detach it and use it as an indoor lantern during a power failure or even camping. If you like that idea of using this as a dual purpose camping/emergency indoor light you can pickup 4 spare 18650's (with twice the capacity) and a charger stating at in $9 total. http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss_2?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=18650  I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I had a chance to test these cables out on my new iPhone 6s Plus 128gb that just arrived today and surprisingly they beat out Apple's on cables in how fast they can charge the new iPhones. Most of us want our phones to charge as quickly as possible. Nobody want's to wait hours for their phone to finish charging. I'll tell you how to Charge your cell phone in half the time below but it will come at a cost.First off Apple "intentionally" ships out a horribly slow charger and cable setup with it's top of the line Phones. Don't get me wrong I love my new Plus but Apple intentionally reduced the charge rate on their charger/cable combo to HALF the phones charge rate capabilities. The reason Apple is shipping out slow chargers is to maximize the charge cycles the battery can receive before the capacity is shot. This prevents endless warranty claims and phones that have wrecked batteries in the first 1-2 years.Battery life is greatly influenced by the charging rate. There is a limitation as to how quickly the Lithium ions can enter into the intercalation layers of the anode. Trying to force too much current through the battery during the charging process results in surplus ions being deposited on the anode in the form of Lithium metal. Known as Lithium plating, this results in an irreversible capacity loss.Charging a typical cell phone Li-Ion battery at a slower C2 rate can almost double the batteries service life compared to charging it at C1 or twice as fast so Apple bundled the new phones with a tiny 5 watt charger. A charger that can barely put out more then one Amp at the peak portion of the charging cycle. This will allow the Li-ion cells to take closer to 500 cycles before dropping down in  the 80-90% capacity range. Now charge the cells twice as fast and you can end up with a battery that in just 250 cycles holds less then 50% of it's original capacity. At that point the phone becomes almost unusable. See my random attached li-ion C rate image to get an idea of what I'm talking about here.OK so what about these Zakix cables I'm reviewing here? They use a thicker Gauge wire and work surprisingly well. With a better 2.4amp  USB charger you can Charge your iPhone in HALF the time.For example in my images I have a brand new  iPhone 6s Plus 128gb that was just released today. It's using the stock Apple USB charger and apples stock cable. In the images you'll see that the chargers voltage is already sagging to 4.67 volts at 1.18 Amps for a total of 5.51 Watts.Now I switch over to the lower resistance Zakix cable that I'm reviewing here and a better USB charger that can handle over 2 Amps with out the voltage sag. The output is now 5.26 Volts at 2.06 Amps for a total of 10.83 Watts. So now my new iPhone is charging at almost DOUBLE the speed of the stock Apple Charger/Cable setup.Conclusion.  All 3 of these cables work perfectly for the newest iPhones. They feel solid, they look good and they allow a faster charge then Apples own cable. Will they last? Who knows but for $3 each they are great fast charging cables.I took the time so that you guys can weigh out the benefits of Fast charging and the resulting shorter battery lifespan. I fast charge and I'm willing to swap the battery out in a couple of years.

Shimano is finally replacing it's well proven XT PD-M780 SPD Mountain Bike Pedal line released in 2011 with the new Shimano Deore XT M8000 SPD race pedals. Physically they're a slightly more refined version of the M780's. The M8000's are "claimed" by Shimano to offer increased stability by increasing the Platform contact area width of the M780 by 2.8mm. Shimano "claims" this increased pedal-to-shoe contact area also improves efficiency. The stack height of the platform is also .5mm lower then the M780's allowing a "very slight" increase in ground clearance to help avoid pedal strikes .5mm is about 1/50th of an inch so I don't think it will be noticeable.As for the weight they are virtually identical to the older M780's 169.6 grams each.I weighed these M8000's in at 169.5 grams each. (339 grams for the pair) [Not counting cleats] See images:While these are racing Mountain Bike pedals you can also pair them up with mountain bike shoes for use with your road bike.Mountain Bike Shoes have a fairly stiff sole for efficient pedaling, but have enough flex and a rubber-lug outsole to allow good traction for walking on slick or rugged trails. The cleats on mountain bike shoes are typically recessed into the soles so that you don't walk on the metal cleats. This makes for much easier walking and you can usually walk on your homes wood floors without destroying the wood. Mountain bike shoes are a popular choice for more casual road biking, touring and indoor cycling classes as well. Personally I also use mountain bike shoes 95% of the time on my Trek Madone road bike. With mountain bike shoes you can make bathroom stops, go shopping or even take a hike without the ridiculously impossible chore of trying to walk on the back of road shoes. "clank clank clank". With mountain bike shoes if you break down on your road or mountain bike you can still walk home without a problem. I've walked about 20 feet in the road shoes, took them off and just went barefoot instead of destroying the shoes. I've also walked 10+ miles in mountain bike shoes in a day when several spokes broke. I pretty much only use road bike shoes in racing situations.Pros:(1) These are the refined and updated version of the M780's with no price increase.(2) Relatively light weight at (339 grams for the pair)(3) Slighter wider shoe contact area  (7.7mm) allowing for a "claimed" increase in comfort and pedaling efficiency(4) Very slight increase in stability and ground clearance to help avoid pedal strikes due to the stack height being .5mm lower.(5) The bearings are much better than the lower end Shimano pedals.(6) They come with two Shimano SM-SH51 Cleats but will also work with the optional SM-SH56 Cleats if you need(7) The tension can be set in 20 increments. Each click can be felt and is 1/4 turn or 90 degrees in rotation.Cons:(1) The Pedal Wrench Type is a [hex] 8 mm. This larger size allows the ability to use more torque to remove the pedals but "some" saddle bag tool kit's are limited to 6mm(2) The clip-in tension setting seemed to be randomly adjusted as shipped from the factory. One Pedal side was set at 5 from loosest, the other side 13 from the loosest.  The other pedal was 7 and 9 from loosest.Anyone new to riding an SPD-style pedal should adjust the tension to the loosest (-) setting to get a feel for using them. Practice unclipping 50-100 times with each foot and work the tension up if you find you're unclipping unexpectedly. It's best to error a little on the loose side until your confident you can unclip without falling.Overall, These are excellent pedals with great bearings that should last many years to come. If you already own the PD-M780's you probably don't need to upgrade but if your ready to buy either the PD-M780 or these Deore XT M8000's then buy the M8000's as they are the mid 2015 update to the older 2011 PD-M780's at roughly the same price.BTW:Shimano makes two types of SPD cleats - "Single release" clips the "normal" SM-SH51 SPD cleats that you'll find in this box. and the optional multi-release SM-SH56 cleats.With both types of cleats you have to twist your feet to unclip, but the single-release cleats only allow a twist to the side. The SM-SH56 cleats allow a few more angles of release.

PRO's:These Silicon Devices bluetooth Headphones have a crisp clean sound and surprising bass for such a small package. I found that you can even tune the bass simply by swapping for a smaller or larger size. I also noticed that with the twelve included inserts you can control if these will be closed or open air design to a large degree. While this might not work for you my ears are just the size that when I size down to small these become open air that I prefer as I like to also hear the outside environment more. Even when I went the lower size they still stayed in my ears snuggly with no worries of falling out. Going up a size seals the air and blocks the external sound more.While I don't think these were designed to allow open air listening it worked for me. Open-backed headphones allow air to circulate, which is more comfortable. They also can help give the impression that sound is coming from around you, as opposed to emanating from your corpus callosum, which is a characteristic of closed-back and in-ear headphones. Closed-back models are better at sealing off the outside world, but your ears may get hot from the lack of air circulationWhile my first extended use was with my iPhone I found these also work superbly as a PC or MAC gaming headset. I didn't realize how freeing it would be to not have my headphones connected via the earphone jack or to my Computers USB port. No more cords to rip out and when mountain bike cycling these are a must for me. My iPhone with it's GPS and my Power meter are affixed to waterproof stem mounts so I'm locked in by the cords length. I've broken at least 6 headphones over the last 3 years by ditching my bike (still connected to your ear while the other end is connected to the bike mount) in a jump or by the spokes catching it. I cant even guess how many times over the years Ive knocked one or the other ear buds out of my ear because I accidentally hit the cord.Bluetooth has come a long way in the last couple of years and these are unbelievably light. You would think sound quality would not be as good but these sound better then my much more expensive corded sets. I was offered these at a discount for my review and I was a bit shocked at how far the technology has advanced in the last year or two. When you hear these speak back to you you realize that theres a tiny CPU drawing micro-Watts capable of doing more then the first PC's of the past.These also have a ton of hidden features. Besides the built in human speech prompts, these also can control my iPhone and allow me to jump up and down tracks, pause and even control the volume from my right ear. Pairing was as easy as holding a button down for a few seconds. These also allow pairing of two separate devices so I can switch from my iPhone to my MAC or PC without repairing.I see that these have other functions some I having tried yet like: music playback, pause, skip tracks, last number redial, caller ID and headset operation volume controls. They also compatible with in-car navigation systems.CONS:If I could find faults there are two but they are very minor. The right ear side has a push activated power switch that has a tiny rattle when tapped by accident. This is not noticed when listening, just if you bump the right ears case. Not a big deal.The second fault is the lowest volume setting is not low enough at least with my iPhone. With the IPhone and these Anear's you have about 28 steps in volume. These headphones seem to reach about 120 dB SPL at the loudest setting (way louder then you'll ever need unless you like ear damaging levels) but on normal music and audiobooks with the lowest setting the lowest average db's still seems to be in the 60-70 db range. If your listening to music to sleep or relax another 10-12db lower might be preferred but these headphones don't allow that low a volume.Example of relative sound pressures on the quieter side:Quiet whisper (1 m) 30dbQuiet room 40dbWhispered speech 50dbNormal Conversation 60dbInside a car at 60mph 70dbIf you have an iPhone I found a trick to drop the lowest sound levels about 12db's. Go to "settings" then "music" and turn ON "Sound check" Then turn ON the EQ "equalizer" and set it to Loudness. Sound check is meant reduce the volume of music that's recorded with too much modulation but it tends to have about a 6db cut and so does the loudness turned on. The reason loudness drops the average sound pressure on the iphone is because in order to boost the bass it would cause over modulated audio on the boosted frequencies, distortion and the bass would clip. By dropping the average db down your can boost bass without over modulated audio.CONCLUSION:BUY THEM!

Pre-workout supplements are a great example of the "wild west" approach to nutrition for weight lifters and various other jocks. There is minimal accurate scientific data to back up the individual agents used in the products and no data for the mixing ratios of the components used for the intended "indication".  Most pre-workout supplements are simply various amino acids like Beta Alanine mixed with an assortment of vitamins (typically B vitamins and Niacin) with varying amounts of caffeine to give the workout "jolt". I've tried a lot of these products - Spark, Hydro Hit, NVIE and Dymatize to name a few. Insert an "s" to the word "hit" in Hydro hit and that is the effect it had on me. No wonder it vanished from Amazon.PE1  smells and tastes pretty lousy. It's also a sucralose (Splenda) bomb. The flavor I bought is "tropical punch" and it's far worse tasting than the worst fake juice product you've ever tried. PE1 mixes fairly easily in cold water and it does not clump like the now unavailable "Hydro Hit" product I had been using. PE1 does provide a decent energy boost for lifting and the product does not induce tachycardia (rapid heart rate) or the "jitters" but I use a fairly low dose of the product - 1/2 scoop prior to the gym.In summary, PE1 works OK, is relatively inexpensive compared to most pre-workout products and it tastes lousy. What more can you ask for?

Needed this for neon sign transformer connections. Never used it before - an electrical engineer buddy of mine recommended it for that particular use. It's an unusual type of tape. It's very thin and the adhesive seemed OK but it wasn't super sticky. I used two layers of Kapton tape on my high voltage (6000v) connections and then covered those layers with shrink tubing. It worked great and I have no voltage issues from the connections.

Decent inexpensive headphones. For the folks who cannot tell the difference in the three sound inserts, you must be tone deaf. The three screw in music inserts do exactly what is described in the instructions. I liked the track controls higher up near the actual ear bud. The chest level ones stink for the gym if you are doing any forward facing exercise with a chest pad (upright row weight machine comes to mind)  because the contact between the pad/chest and the controller either advances the track or shuts it off. I'll see how long these last but for $20, it's not a bad product.

This is a quirky hoodie. I'll get to that in a minute. The XL fits me fine but I prefer a tighter fit to a looser fit. I'm sort of large - 6' 1", 225 pounds with a 48" chest and a 38" waist. I've been a weightlifter, hockey player and martial arts practitioner for decades. This H2H hoodie fits snug about the waist and just right around my chest. It's fairly thin and stretchy material - not the thicker, standard no stretch cotton hoodie material.Now for the quirky part. This is not a USA made product - the zipper is on the wrong side and it zips up left handed. I guess that's the better side if you are left handed.  I double checked the description and it says "Men's" and it fits like a men's size unless you a size 20 chick who can wear a men's XL. If you don't like left handed zippers, look elsewhere.The other quirk was that the left handed zipper has two slider heads so you can unzip from the top and the bottom. It was a bit hard to engage the zipper slider at first and I could not get the zipper to work at all. I looked closely at the upper slider and it had some excess paint or something binding the slider head. I cleaned it out with a pocket knife blade and it worked fine. I thought about returning the hoodie but I liked the fit, the cut, the length and the quirkiness grew on me and I hate returning stuff. The body is long and I have a long torso so it fit me well.It smells really crummy right out of the bag - that foreign "sizing smell". It's a very chemical odor but it was gone with one quick wash.Be aware that when you pull the actual hood over your head, it makes you look like the Grim Reaper and there is no hood drawstring. And there is that zipper thing but quirky and weird suits me.

I have bought 4 of these over the past year and EVERY one has leaked after about 6 months. Even when they don't leak, they are hard to hold in place on the upper body or back unless you have a 4-6 inch Ace bandage to wrap them up with. I've gone to a Smart Temp ice pack with a Velcro attachment system. The reviews on the Smart Temp are about equal to this Ace product relative to for leaking but at least the Smart Temp stays in place.

I bought this from Amazon about a year ago and I've had to use it twice to jump cars. It worked great for jumping my neighbors 8 cylinder diesel pickup and my wife's car. I have had to charge it three times. Once when it was new, once after I jumped the two cars and once after not using it for 6+ months but it still had 3 1/2 bars of power left after sitting for 6+ months. Quality build, every iPhone connector available including the new 6 and 6S lightning connector. It also has a lighter charger and the emergency flashlight/strobe is a handy safety device. Overall 100% satisfied. I plan to buy 2 more as holiday gifts for family.
SUPER sharp multi-use drywall saw. Be careful - it's exceptionally well sharpened! Powers through drywall with great control and the best pumpkin carving tool I've ever used.

I replaced my 5 gallon bucket with this low profile wash bucket. I have an Ettore window squeegee/washer combination and it won't fit in a 5 gallon pail. Also great for car washing as well. Easy to see with a small footprint.
Great color, fit well. Used on my lawn equipment

Cryostim Probes are the device of choice for deep tissue icing that and ice bag and cold packs cannot reach. They are "targeted icing" for specific tendon injuries and tendonitis in general and can isolate a spot about the size of a nickel on pulled or irritated tendon. I have had shoulder problems for well over a decade and have had three rotator cuff surgeries. My most recent right shoulder surgery was in 2009 and I had it fully rehabilitated. I aggravated the injury lifting weights in the gym over the summer and really aggravated it this week in a martial arts class.I went to my highly capable chiropractor who identified my shoulder issue as biceps tendonitis or perhaps a slight tear of the biceps tendon with some shoulder capsule damage. He showed me the precise spots on the tendon to ice with these probes and they work much better than general shoulder ice packs. Make sure you use the gel with them - it's a critical component to prevent freezing injury and to allow the probe to move around and target deep tissues like tendons. I have also used these cryostim probes with great success on small burns. Last month some molten solder fell onto my left hand and the probe worked great for treating the affected area.If you are unsure how to use these properly, consult a trained medical professional to best understand how to use these probes for deep tissue icing.

I had about 100 widows to caulk at all different angles inside and outside along with 500 lineal feet of concrete seams that required polyurethane caulk. I grew weary of messing with hand powered caulk guns, especially for the polyurethane, so I sprung for this unit. It has worked great so far (about 40 windows are finished).
