This thing cleared up our 8'x12'x3' (288 cf / 2150 gallon) pond completely - from "pea soup" to crystal clear. It took a few weeks, which was not unexpected. Once clear, the pond remained clear for the rest of the season. Cleaning the filter is easy; rotate the valve and push on the "squeezer" that pushes on the filtration element. The only issue we ran into, which is very minor indeed, is that the pop-up indicator for "time to clean filter" popped up and would never go back down now matter what we did. This didn't affect the filter at all; we cleaned it regularly, about once a week, and it never faltered in any way. This is a great product, kind of amazing for the price. Highly, highly recommended.

I built my own sump for my salt water aquarium out of another aquarium, and these were invaluable parts for that project. They come with rubber seals that seat tightly against the glass and they don't leak at all. The "nut" fit precisely on the threading and was easily tightened. Slip tolerance was excellent, and the filter baskets (I used low-profile baskets from bulk reef supply, also excellent quality) and plumbing aligned and fit perfectly. No rough edges or molding lines anywhere that might cause problems.

This thing is *awesome*. I just couldn't get the kids and the SO to turn the lights off when they left the various rooms and closets in the house. With this, they don't have to remember (and they don't), the light just times out. My lights will last longer, my power bill will drop a little bit, and my aggravation level is significantly reduced. They are trivially easy to install, too -- took me ten easy minutes from start to finish. The blue LEDs make the thing easy to find in the dark and are informative as well (as to how long the light is to stay on.) Pressing the button again resets the timer, so if you need a few extra minutes, you can just touch it and you've got 'em.

Laumer is definitely one of the very best. Retief's escapades make for great reading. But these stories are bite sized; likely you'll find yourself wishing for more. In that spirit, my recommendation:"Retief's War" is the penultimate Retief work, really a tour de force of the diplomatic send-up mashed in with some excellent adventure and a good amount of humor, so once you've read this one, you might want to read "Retief's War" as well.

I shave my head, so I really feel my pillow, and there's no airspace between my head and the pillow surface. This leads to a very hot sleeping experience on a conventional pillow, and it isn't particularly pleasant. Sweating, soaking wet areas requiring flipping the pillow, etc. I've been actively looking for some relief.I saw this mat and thought it would be worth a try. Here's what I found.The mat is heavy-ish and tends to stay in place. So that's a good thing. It's soft and has a pleasant feel when I lay my head directly on it. When I lay on a pillowcase with the mat inside the pillowcase, it loses a considerable amount of its effectiveness, as the pillowcase forms a thin layer of cloth insulation. So I've gone with sleeping right on it. This review relates specifically to that mode of use.When I first lay my head down, the mat is quite cool -- much cooler than a traditional pillow is when you first lay on it. I find that very pleasant. It warms slowly enough for me to go to sleep, as long as I don't read, etc., and get right to it.However, once my head has been on it for a while, the mat does warm up quite a bit, and it does *not* get rid of this heat. I have woken up several times to find it not only as warm (hot!) as a traditional pillow, but even hotter. The gel is laid out in an "S" topology in the mat so that large areas are isolated from other areas, and so the heat can't move sideways away from where my head is. It can't go down into the pillow below either, for the same reason heat doesn't get away when I lay my head on the pillow. From the description, this, I am guessing, is an intentional attempt to let one side cool while the other side is being used.Now, if, and it's a big if, my head was lying on one end of the mat, I can re-position to the other side, get a little relief, and get back to sleep. So in that sense, the design works. One side cools somewhat while the other side is being used.If I *wasn't* exactly at one end, however, a very large portion of the whole mat is warm -- and there's nowhere to go.The flaw with this design is that although it has the ability to warm slowly, it does not have the ability to quickly get rid of the heat that it absorbs from the head. So once it warms up... that's pretty much the end of that.I would love to find one of these that had some kind of heat dissipation mechanism worked into it so that heat that was absorbed would radiate away out the sides. A hollow pillow with a mat on top and integrated heat sinks that extend inside the hollow area, and a fan blowing air by them? Oy. But... something.Anyway, sleeping with the mat is often better than sleeping without it, only occasionally worse (it can get *really* hot if you don't manage to roll away in time), and so I continue to use it. But my feeling is that it doesn't do what it is advertised to do very well -- which is simply to *keep* the head cool, though I must emphasize that it starts out very nicely at first.

Unfortunately, the spacing of the screw centers is not specified here. As it was a 12-terminal strip, I (blindly) bought the 12-terminal jumper connector sold by the same company that... well, looked right. Once the jumpers (slowly, oh so slowly) arrived from China, they didn't even come close to fitting. Sigh. My bad, I guess, but I wanted both to arrive ASAP. Should have waited until I could measure the terminal strip. The 12-terminal jumper does have the spacing specified, so that would have prevented the problem. But. Meh.The terminal strips are... terminal strips. No problems with too-tight screws, etc, as others report. However, the plastic is extremely brittle and you need to be very, very careful how tightly you affix this strip to whatever you're going to mount it on. I used screws  and a powered screwdriver, and with VERY little torque applied, the mounting hole shattered. Lesson learned, hand tighten and not very much, either. Hence the three stars. They're cheap... but they're inexpensive... so... I guess they're okay.

I can finally actually tell what my reef aquarium's ph is. Test strips are useless for this; I have never had any success at all with test strips.I let this run for a month, meaning power on, probe in the aquarium. Then I re-calibrated it at ph 7 and ph 10; it was within 1/10th of where it should have been at both points on the scale. Nice.Has its own power supply, a nice long cord on the probe, an large, easily read display, and an alarm - a blinking red LED and a beeper - that goes off if the ph gets too high. It's easily mounted on the wall, too. Very, very well thought out.Highly recommended.EDIT:  I've not had this running for several months. Still solidly in calibration -- took it out, tested it, didn't have to touch an adjustment, it was still spot-on. So I bought a second one for my non-reef salt tank. Opened it, calibrated it (it was very close right out of the box) and sunk it in there. All good.Also -- my reef tank is *thriving* now. Once I knew what the ph was, I was able to stabilize the ph where my tank denizens were happy, and several things happened: First, and quite notably, my hair algae problem simply went away over the course of a few weeks. I'd tried everything else you can imagine; getting the ph right was all it took in the end. Second, my tank creatures are all thriving.I aim at about 8.3 to 8.4 for my reef tank. The soft corals seem to be annoyed by about 8.2 on the low side, and 8.5 on the high side. The ph consistently tends to rise, so as soon as the meter shows 8.5, I knock it back to 8.3, and everything stays happy all the time. Takes about 3-4 days for the ph to reach 8.5 again. The little blinky "alarm" light makes sure I see that the tank needs attention very quickly, as I'm always walking past the tanks.In my reef tank, I keep fish, sponges, soft corals and mushrooms, tube worms, small clams, shrimp, crabs, limpets, and snails along with a large quantity of live rock.Totally, totally a must-have. Seriously -- test strips are WORTHLESS compared to this.

I don't enjoy writing negative reviews. And I have to say up front that I was successful in getting these working correctly and installed. But it wasn't a smooth process, and it left me unhappy with the product. First, just for reference:The black wire the description confusingly describes as the "main line" is the ground connection.Red and green are, apparently interchangeably, brake and turn connections. Each one lights up half the red LEDs, so it doesn't appear to matter which one you choose.The yellow wire powers the yellow section of the unit, and the white wire powers the white section  of the unit.There are no electronics inside the assembly other than LEDs; it has no "smarts", so you get whatever lights get power and that's the end of it.Wiring:In the US, running lights are typically red. Not yellow. Many states have a law that requires them to be red. So check your local laws before you decide to connect just the yellow lamps up as running lights.Now, on some vehicles, such as my Chevy truck, the brake and turn signal power comes in on one line, and the vehicle manages the on and off, with on always being 12vdc and off being zero volts -- there is no intermediate voltage. If that's how your vehicle works (check with a voltmeter), then you can wire that to the red (or green) and then the running lights to the green (or red.) One to each color.In such a circumstance, you can't use the yellow LEDs alone as turn signals, because the brakes and turn signals are on the same lines going to each lamp.If your brake and turn signals come in on separate lines, then you kind of have to wire the running lights to the yellow section, the brake to the red (or green) and the turn to the green (or red.) Unless you put an active adapter between the actual light wires and this taillight. But as is, this means you don't have red running lights, and there are laws variously addressing that in some states for trailers, passenger vehicles, and haulers. Check! You can connect both the yellow and the green (or red) together to the running lamp power and then you get red and yellow running lamps; that's reasonable. You could do it the other way, and connect the yellow lamps to the brake/signal line and have them light up only on turns and when braking, not too sure that would be a great choice, but it is an available choice.Backup lights -- if you need them, connect them, simple as that. Generally not useful to the driver for trailer wiring, but it does let anyone behind the trailer know you're in reverse, so there's that.So that's how it all works. Here are the issues I encountered:The lights don't mount flush. You need a hole cut to accommodate them, or you'll be fabricating a custom mount (that's what I ended up doing.)The wires coming out of the back are far too short; trying to get them connected can be a real problem because there's no leeway at all to get the lamp away from the mount point once any of the wires are connected.The wires are far too small a wire gauge; yes, they don't have to carry much current, but they have to survive a vibrating, bouncing vehicle environment, and they need to be larger just so they can be handled and connected more easily.After installation, one of mine didn't work. At all. After undoing the mount, I took it apart.In the process of disassembly, I learned there is no weather seal, and so water is going to get into these through the hole the wires go through, which has no grommet or other anti-leak provisions. I'll come back to that.So, the problem: Inside, the ground wire had been pulled right off the circuit board (not by me), along with a good bit of the copper plating. I repaired the board with wire and solder, and attached a heftier wire for all the connections, throwing out the too-short, too light wire.An observation: All of the wires are attached to the circuit board by simply being soldered to the solder-side where there was a handy opening in the solder mask that already had some solder and one leg of an LED poking through. Which is why the wire was able to pull up the circuit trace. Normally, if a wire is soldered to a circuit board, the wire goes in from the top of the board and is soldered underneath. This way, if the wire is pulled, the stress simply pulls the copper tighter against the phenolic, and there's no problem unless the stress is so high as to break the wire itself. But not in this... design. I use that word very loosely here. :)As supplied, the five wires that come out of the lamp are encased in an outer jacket, probably to keep the insulation from being abraded by vibration. Reasonable enough. However, this isn't shrink tubing; it's just... tubing. And the way they attached the tubing to the five wires -- I am not making this up -- was to put a thin, but fairly large diameter, metal washer around the five wires and the tubing inside and then bend the washer right in half until it... sort of... clamped the tubing against the five wires. METAL washer. Which was laying RIGHT on the circuit board. RIGHT over some soldered connections. Good grief.So I took the other light back back off the trailer where I'd installed it, and yes, same thing. I got rid of the washers and the original tubing, used heat shrink tubing instead, replaced the wires themselves with heavier gauge wires, filled the hole in the back and the screw holes and lined the box edge with silicone to actually waterproof the assembly, let it cure overnight and then re-installed them. Using spade connectors to a terminal strip. Because I have a bit of a feeling I might have to change them out sooner rather than later, given the cheapness and clue-free-rigging of the internal assembly.That was my experience. I hope yours is better, or that you avoid the entire process.So. They don't cost much, but in my opinion, you don't get much. I wouldn't buy them again; and after seeing the assembly inside, I wouldn't buy anything else made by the same company, either.
Like almost everything Laumer wrote, this is a great stuff, highly engaging and well thought out.

Fun. Lots, actually. But too few stages, and all the puzzles are low-density; by that I mean that they all look like the one in the picture. So no really tough routing challenges. Still, it's fun. Needs work on stages and density, but otherwise is very solid.
Everything is fine, works like the iPad version, but there's one drawback -- on the small screen, you really need to be able to zoom in. If they added that, this would be a five star review, easy.
It's even prettier in person than the image shows -- just a beautiful bit of jewelry all around. Highly recommended. My lady *loved* it.

It does the job, by which I mean it humidifies the air. And it's decent looking, not a horrible thing to have in a corner.However, the water reservoirs are too small to last long, even taken together -- they don't even last 24 hours -- and too large to carry comfortably when loaded. And you *will* have to carry them. There's no way to load them in place from a hose or feed, because of the way they feed water to the rest of the device.This means that you will be constantly lugging these containers full of water around. You may be well humidified, but your back is going to hate you. A lot. Especially if you put this on the floor.They really could have thought this through further.

Love the yellowish tone; it's very pretty, sort of like a tiny xmas tree.Internally, the LEDs are very precisely positioned, which makes it look like a crystal or a chandelier. The LEDs in mine are all the same brightness as far as I can tell, and again this adds to the perception of the bulb as a single thing with many light sources. We've been running it for months and have had no problems; it's just as pretty as the first day we lit it up.Will probably buy more. :)

This actually kind of an amazing product. Most apps for the phone environment are simplistic, basically mind candy giving you the idea you have some sort of vague handle on something. This isn't like that. Lots of very useful features, and I have to say that the thing that caught my attention was how well thought out they are. Kudos to MPS software for showing (most of) the rest of the developers how it should be done. And yes, I'm a developer, and that includes me. No association with MPS software here. Don't know 'em, never heard of 'em before. Just impressed, that's all.

This is really pretty good -- no funny taste, proper texture and mouth feel, ingredients don't cause it to dissolve or otherwise change consistency. All of which are problems we've encountered with other gluten-free pizza crusts.My only complaint is that this product is very much limited to making a "small" size pizza, suitable for one person at most. I *really* really wish they'd make a full size one crust -- I'm thinking of a traditional NY pizza here, 16" to 18", suitable to feed (at least) a family of four. I wrote them to tell them so; you can easily find them online as I did and I encourage you to do so if you agree you'd be interested in such a product.*** A tip for those of you who really care about NY pizza: with the right mozzarella (made from whole milk, instead of part-skim, low moisture) you'll get the traditional oil run-off, the cheese will stretch properly when you take a bite instead of coming off in chunks and sheets, and -- of course -- you get a proper pizza taste. That is THE key to NY style pizza. Without the right cheese, you CANNOT succeed. This is true even if you're mixing cheese types. Low moisture, part skim mozzarella isn't really mozzarella at all. Find the real thing and you seriously step up your game.

So far, so good. Fit is excellent, and the large wheels roll easily. That's important to me because I have an eleven foot long desk with lots of monitors, keyboards, and a hardware working area. I'm always zipping back and forth (on a low-knap rug) to get to this or that. The original casters on my chair lasted about six months, then began breaking. If these break, you can bet I will update this review. These add a little height -- bigger wheels, but I can't rate that as a plus or minus, I think that varies by your height, and by if your chair is sufficiently adjustable. Mine is, so no problem there.I was looking for something even tougher -- steel, ball bearings, etc., but these seem to be about as heavy-duty as 11mm chair casters get.

Works well, provides consistent, repeatable readings within a very tight percentage range. It takes a moment to start up, you put a little weight on it, it'll announce itself, then a few moments later, it'll say "it's ready" and you can step onto it. You do need to be stable (standing as still as possible), or it won't read out the weight, and the heavier you are, the more this becomes an issue, so keep that in mind.The only down side? My cats love it. They are constantly climbing on it to hear the lady-voice. They're going to cut the battery life significantly, I think. No sign of them getting bored after three months, either. :)

These are really great -- those balls stacked on the top curve of the rings not only take the load evenly, they "hop" over extensible shower rod joints with barely a nod to the fact that they're even there. As soon as we had one set installed and realized how much better they were, we immediately ordered another set for our other curtain and tossed the old stuff in the trash.HIghly recommended!

The Pi (B+) kits I purchase have eight GB cards, and by the time the OS was installed, were already down to six. Based on my previous linux experience, that's pretty tight. So I thought I'd try this, and I was not at all disappointed. In fact, the NOOBS installation on this 16 GB card was newer than the one in the particular kit I had purchased, so the update and dist-upgrade steps with apt-get were significantly faster -- less for them to do.The card came in an adaptor/carrier, presumably for use with a desktop system, but which also serves to protect the relatively tiny card that actually carries the data. It pops right out of there and plugs into the Pi B+ just fine. Very nice.The install of Raspian via NOOBS went perfectly, WiFi setup was a doddle, and I was only using 17% of the card when the update/upgrade via apt-get was all said and done. Lots of room for my various experiments and excursions into Raspian-land now! Time to install midnight commander (mc), sqlite3, and apache2 now!Not directly related to this card, but I am *so* impressed with the Raspberry Pi. I'm no linux newbie, I have a couple big linux servers, plus an 8-core Mac Pro where I spend a fair bit of time in the shell, and a big Windows machine as well. I do a lot of admin on the linux servers, running websites and various user accounts. That's what gives me the perspective to say with great certainty that the Pi, while not the fastest fella on the block, is an amazingly capable and complete system for almost no money compared to (cough) "real" desktops. This 16 GB card just makes it that much sweeter.This is the 3rd Pi in our home -- one controls the air and filtration in my Salt/Coral Reef tank, one sits on my lady's desk, and one on mine. I'm just waiting to see if the grandson indicates he's interested in one for himself. Too much fun. :)

I didn't have any trouble with unevenness in the bubbles, but I did supply it with a fair amount of air. It's very bright, almost too bright for nighttime use, but it sure adds an interesting aspect to the fresh water tank.The only down side I have found is that it is too light, and wants to float up from wherever it is placed unless you weight it down or pin it with a heavy decoration. Probably needs a plastic-encased metal weight inside to be as good as it could be.Overall, a nice addition to the tank, though it does require some fooling around to get it to stay where you put it.
Couldn't make this fit on the main unit. Was a huge problem getting the main unit's original tube off, too. And I'm quite strong. Very poor tolerances in both cases. NOT HAPPY.

I use these to try to keep track of the Ph in my salt aquarium. The Ph range is too restricted, and the color changes are far too subtle to really determine what your actual Ph is. I don't know of a better alternative, but that doesn't make this acceptable by any means. I've tried expensive "ph meters", which are entirely too finicky about drying out and washing with distilled water and similar nonsense, and still require constant calibration with known Ph reference fluids even if you treat them just as you're supposed to. I've tried about every kind of test strips out there, and they all seem to use the same yellow-orange-purple scale which is utterly vague anywhere near the Ph range that a reef (coral supporting) tank needs to operate at. Also a VERY poor match with the color scales they supply to compare to! I am so frustrated. Anyone who has any tips for reliable, precise Ph readout without constant calibration, I'm all ears (eyes.) Please use the comments if you have suggestions. I'll try any product that offers hope. As it stands, all I know from using these things is that my Ph is "somewhere" between 7 and some higher value, what that higher value is I have no idea. "It's some kind of purple". That doesn't match the printed scale at all. Auuugh!

This, unlike some plastic "humorous" coffee cups, is a proper ceramic mug, and I find the idea to be absolutely hilarious. Looks great. People get the joke even from a distance, and always want to read the details off the cup (which are also hilarious.) Proudly displayed in my coffee cup collection, plus I actually drink from it.Highly recommended, I really don't see how you could go wrong if you enjoy this sort of thing.

This doesn't just keep bugs away because it's yellow... it also keeps them away because it's VERY dim. So keep that in mind if you decide to try it. I'm not happy with it, it's just barely a step above having no light at all, especially when you exit the house and your eyes are adapted to normal lighting levels inside the house.Cree makes some high intensity LEDs, I really wish they'd used one or more of those here instead of a bunch of standard "control panel" style LEDs.The one thing is does do right is put the light on the ground, not all out to the sides. If only there were more light, though. Not recommended.

Another great read by De Maria. Spoiler alertThis one starts in 1990 with Maura Dallas.Of course that's not her real name. Her real last name is Dallasio. The Dellasio's run a crime family. Maura  and her best friend Alana Loeb are attending a school in the Swiss Alps.The school is a private school which caters to the kids of the super rich. The children of those that run drug cartels, mobs as well as the children of Senators, Congressmen, and world leaders. Anyone who can afford for their kids to attend Our Lady of the Mountains. Its a catholic school located in Chaminix, France in the alps.Maura is super smart and she and Alana can hardly wait to leave. Which they do to attend college in 1995.College is where Maura has an affair with one of the college professors Lucas Brandeford,Maura broke it off and then found out she was pregnant by Brandeford. She considered and abortion but Alana talked her out of it. Her daughter was named Alana and the daughter would be kidnaped years later.So begins another great read by De Maria.This one has Jake, a Jake who has yet to find anyone to compare to the love of his life Alana Loeb, a man named Luke Willet, the kidnapping of Alana Dallas, a Maura Dallas who hires Jake to find her, the Dallas enforcer Vinnie Anastasia, , a college dean named Regina Russell who spends a night with Jake Scarne, Jakes friend both inside and outside the law, Jakes partner Noah Sealth, his AA Evelyn, crime boss Dudley Mack, a trip to Barnard and Columbia colleges where Jake is looking for answers, a druggie named Barry, a meet with Barry, an attempted ambush, a Bobo who's  Mack's enforcer and a friend to Jake, a trip to Sint Maarten, a PI named Bastian, a shootout at a villa, an Alana Dallas who finds out the truth of her birth, diamond, death and Jake Scarne doing his best to figure it all out and stay alive.Five Stars once again.

Another great read by DeLeo. Spoiler alert.This one starts with Jim and Ellen. The two of them  are currently watching a drug deal go down. The dealers are dealing drugs at the high school they both attend.Of course they were spotted. Two men approached them and tried to take them home. Jim was polite and respectful but wasn't getting in a car with people he didn't know. It was about to get ugly when Rick and Lo in disguise showed up. Of course it ended rather badly for the two men.After the confrontation Rick called Bill Staley. He's their contact man in the police department. Bill showed with officer and arrested everyone.So begins another fine read by DeLeo.This one has Rick, Lo, Jim, Ellen, Temple,  Stace, Trish, Meg, Steve, Bone, the rest of the crews from the security company, a woman named Stuart who has her own agenda, a billionaire named Boros, Muslims from Yemen working on revenge, a boat trip, a shootout on the boat, an ambush where two police officers are killed, a Rick using his sniper rifle, Casablanca night, another shootout, Temple and Jim working on love, a jealous Ellen who likes Jim and wants a relationship with him other than as a partner, the red carpet on premier night for the movie Temple and Jim starred in, Rick and Lo's CIA contacts, death, destruction and Rick Cantelli and Lois Madigan using their skills to come out on top and save the damned day.Five Stars.

One great kick ass read. Spoiler alert.This one starts with Master Gunnery Sergeant Nathaniel Hogan. Hogan is twenty six years old and is 6'4" and weighs around two hundred and forty pound. He's in charge of the eight man marine guard unit at the newly built American embassy in London, England.Hogan is a marine who has seen action in the middle east. This posting is a sort of thank you and unwind sorta deal.Hogan is outside and sees a rainbow of color skitter across the sky. To Hogan it looks like the Aurora Borealis, or Northern Lights which he had seen when he was seconded to the embassy in Moscow.While watching the light show he realizes that everything is quiet. Dead quiet. No cars, busses or any of the noise one associates with a city the size of London. Then planes start falling from the sky. Jet liners are falling all over London. Hogan knows he's seeing the effects of either an EMP or a solar flare. He knows that the world is now changed forever.So begins a damned fine read.This one has Hogan, the deputy director of the embassy Liz Tutor, a Liz who thinks they will be rescued by the American military, Hogan wonders how the hell she thinks anyone is going to get to them, a Hogan who leaves to do recon in the area and realizes they need to leave as soon as possible before the citizens of London start looting and killing, a Tutor who decides she's not leaving, the rest of the marines decide to stay, a Hogan who leaves on his own knowing he won't see any of them again, a Hogan with a drive to head North, an alien named Ammon Set-Bat who's fighting a war on his planet, a mage named Seth, Orcs, Trolls, the Elves they are fighting, a boy named Sam, a caravan of gypsy's  a Doctor trying to get to her parents, a kid named Kamua, escapee's from Belmarsh Prison, and attack by the Belmarsh gang on the US Embassy, gangs, death, destruction, a Hogan learning that he is almost immortal, Professor Jonathan Holt who tells Hogan about his immortality, the fortress of a school where Hogan, undergrads and students live, those that want what they have, people on the hunt for food, Axel, Dom and Patrick Officers in the Queen's Royal Surrey Regiment who were home on leave and are all now stranded in the village, a village which will soon be under attack by the Belmarsh convicts and Gunnery Sgt. Hogan who is way more than he appears to be and a man who will do whatever it takes to protect those around him and survive.Five Stars. Not bad at all.

Liked this one from page one. Spoiler alert.This one starts in the small town of St. Matthews, Arizona. St. Mathews is a town where just about everyone knows everyone else.The St. Mathews police department has four officers. Dan Lowry is one of the officer.Lowry is currently in the jail part of the police station after hauling Frank, a frequent visitor to the jail cells, in for a disturbance at a local bar. The Down Under.  Frank is shouting insults and threats at Dan. A Dan who ignores him. Frank is also coughing and spewing  all over the cell.Dan's relief, Officer Howard Barrett, who's the senior officer in the department,  is in the locker room changing clothes to begin his shift. Dan gives him the info on what's been happening and Barrett is less then happy to have to keep an eye on Frank all night.Dan heads home and as expected he gets a call from wife Julie. He lets her know he's on his way.Dan then gets a call from Howard. A Howard who has a situation at the jail and needs Dan back there ASAP.So begins a pretty darned good read.This one has Dan, his daughter Quinn, wife Julie, Barrett, Chief Turner, Mickey who's another St. Mathews deputy, a plague that has hit the town. a Barrett who knows what's going on, a Barrett who has been taking orders from The Agency for years, a turned Julie who tries to kill both Dan and Quinn, the towns people all turning into the walking dead, the walking dead who's only agenda is to kill the living, a Dan who manages to catch up to his daughter, a fight with Barrett at the police station, a Dan and Quinn who make it to Barrett's house, a house that is loaded with food, water everything anyone would need to survive, a Dan who cleans out the police station for guns and ammo and Dan Lowry and his daughter making their way out of St. Mathews running for their lives and looking for safety.Five Stars, Not bad at all.

Another great read by Kelly, Spoiler alert.This one starts with a Kate who's very worried about her sister who's in Boston living with her abusive boyfriend.Kate tried to stop her from going back to him but Lindsay would hear none of it and left to be with Ice.Kate is still working for Section One and right now they are investigating the murder of a young woman. A woman who was killed using a knife that was the murder weapon used a decade earlier.Kate is also becoming attracted to Noah Foster. Foster is an Iraq war vet who lost part of his leg to an IED. This hasn't slowed him down one bit. He's a animal vet and a guy who takes the time to enjoy life and he and Kate are getting closer.Lt. Oz brings in Det. Kingsley who's a PhD and has been in the department a long time. He works the cold cases and the decade old murder is now being looked at by Section One and the only tie they have is the knife that was used in both murders.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Kate, Bernie, Noah, Lt. Oz, Kingsley, the rest of Section One, a man named Colin Russell, three letters that were left to Kate by her birth mother, Natalie, Mo, Nana and the rest of Kate's wacky friends, the FBI, Kate's old friend FBI Agent Joe Dawson, the swarm, attacks all across America, a Kate who contacts Hud for a time out, a Hud who will be out of the country for a few weeks, a weekend in Hawaii for Kate and Noah, a Kate still looking for her birth Father, a Kate who finds herself drawn to Noah Foster, murder, attempted murder, Kate's sister Lindsay, Ice and Kate Sexton and her crew doing their best to figure the whole thing out and stay alive.Five Stars.

Great read full of great dialogue and some great characters. Spoiler alert.This one stars with Cass remembering when she and Talia went to the Blake party. A party where Talia met Sebastian while trying for an interview with Mina Blake. A Sebastian she marries. A Sebastian who's the illegitimate son of the elder Blake. A Sebastian who was a Navy SEAL.Cass was at the party impersonating a rival of hers. Celeste Carver. A woman who has gone out of her was to make Cass's life miserable. This party and Cass impersonating this woman was to be Cass's payback.Of course meeting Calder, a guy dressed in a Navy uniform and dancing with him wasn't quite what she had in mind. Calder thought she was Celeste and though Cass resembles Celeste quite a bit and the party was a masked affair Cass was so hoping Calder wouldn't discover she wasn't Celeste.Calder and Cass had quite an evening. An evening Cass spent the next years thinking about.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Cass, her Father, Celeste and her family, a Celeste who has a proposition for Cass, a Cass who once again impersonates Celeste only this time at Celeste's urging, an engagement, a Calder who has left the Navy, a Calder who's keeping his distance from his family and his beloved cousin Bash, a Bash who finally gets a clue to Calder's whereabouts, a Calder involved in an illegal fight club, Celeste's sister, her boyfriend, an observer, a Calder and Cass finally getting things straightened out, a kidnapping, Bash finally catching up with Calder and finding out what's going on and Cass and Calder coming together on the way to love and live.Five Stars and then some.

Damned good read. Spoiler alert.This one starts with the death of millions of Americans brought on by a plague that was released by ISIS.The American military is decimated, its men and women dying of the plague as are millions of civilians.Those who released that plague have been vaccinated against it. As soon as they see most of the American military is dying they launch their invasion.The American military does its best but with its reduced numbers they are quickly overrun, killed or imprisoned. Armed Ex military and civilians, also do whatever they can do to fight the invader. Its all for naught. ISIS now controls America.Ben Ford fought as long as he could against the invasion. He's an ex marine Lt. who fought in sandland. He now makes his living working at a speakeasy where liquor can be purchased. With Muslims running America Sharia law is in effect and alcohol is forbidden.The NYPD is still in NYC only now they are auxiliaries of ISIS and are being used as Sharia law enforcers. Kurt Levin was a NYPD detective and he's using his NYPD status to help those Americans still fighting using guerilla tactics.Life isn't easy for any Americans in the Muslim occupied city and Ben Ford knows how to get around, using the sewers, to stay unobserved. He's more than ready to keep fighting the Muslims.Ben saves a young woman being beaten by Muslims. He takes her through the sewers. She's an Episcopal Reverend and Holly Nichols is her name. She and Ben get very close until she's captured and sent to New Jerusalem.New Jerusalem is a place many dissidents, Jews, Christians, rabbi's, ministers, priests and anyone the Muslim's deem a troublemaker are sent. No one ever returns. No one knows and the renegade Americans and Ben Ford will be taking a trip to see what this place is all about and to rescue the captured Holly.So begins a damned fine read.This one has Ben, Holly, Kurt Levin, Moshe and his Haganah fighters, his father Rabbi Goldberg,  the Mutaween, the Caliph of America, the extermination camp called New Jerusalem, Ben and his men looking for proof of what's going on in NJ so they can tell the world, tunnels in and around New Jerusalem, the POTUS, American fighters in North Carolina who are beating the hell out of the Muslims, the New Jerusalem prisoners, hangings, supply trains, trains that haul the prisoners the New Jerusalem, a raid by Ben and his men, death, destruction and Ben Ford doing his best to save Holly, beat the enemy and take back America.Five Stars.

Just a great read with some super dialogue and great characters. Spoiler Alert.This one starts with Talia Murphy who's a very successful author.Talia's latest book is Blindside. the actual story of the stalker who almost killed her. Have to read Scarlett Red to get that story.Talia hasn't seen Sebastian in six months. Talia doesn't want a relationship with a man who only wants a relationship when he wants it. Talia doesn't think he wants any kind of permanent relationship with her or anyone else. She has no idea how absolutely wrong she is.Talia has been receiving threatening letters in reference to her novel, Blindside. Who it could be she has no idea.Talia also has a fianc and a ring on her finger. Of course she caught the fianc, Nathan, with another woman so of course that relationship has sailed. She still wears the diamond ring though just to keep others men away.Talia's publishing house is Midtown Central Publishing and they have arranged for security for her list of book signings, Q&A sessions with reporters, dinners and all other social functions. This is when Black Security and Sebastian Blake re-enter Talia's life.So begins another damned fine read by Michelle.This one has Talia, Sebastian, Sebastian's sister Mina, Mina's daughter Josi, Adam Blake who's Sebastian's Father, a meeting Adam set up with Talia, a Talia who sets Adam straight about Sebastian, Isabel who's Sebastian's step-mother and Mina's mother, the history of Sebastian's murdered mother, gangs, a stalker, a fire, attempted murder, a Sebastian with secrets about his life as a SEAL and why he had to leave the Navy, a Sebastian who now heads up Black Security, Jared who wants a relationship with Talia, a man named Hayes from Talia's past, Talia's Aunt Vanessa with secrets, secrets that Talia is appalled by, misconceptions by both Talia and Sebastian, Adam Blake who acknowledges his love and respect for Sebastian, a Sebastian who discovers who set in motion the murder of his mother, a showdown at Talia's apartment and Talia Murphy and Sebastian Blake reaching for love and life.One super read. Five Stars.

Just a great read full of great dialogue and some great characters. Spoiler alert.This one has Talia Murphy three years after she and Sebastian Quinn, now using his Fathers last name of Blake had passionate sex.Talia was supposed to meet Sebastian the next day and she was there. She heard him in a phone conversation with his SEAL team leader. Sebastian was being deployed. He is a Navy SEAL after all and Talia completely understands what he does for a living.Talia also understood that Sebastian wasn't looking for a long term relationship. That's something Talia won't settle for. She want Sebastian, all of him and not just when he wants her. That's the way she left it and Sebastian never knew that she was there to meet him. He thinks she was never there.Now three years later Talia is a budding author working on book number three of her trilogy.Talia had her dream job with the Tribune but lost it when a story she was working on fell apart and the management blamed her. So an author she became and she's actually a pretty damned good writer.Talia's beloved Aunt talks her into a weekend at The Hawthorne a resort in Martha Vinyard. Talia isn't really interested in going but decides she will.Her best friend is Cass and Cass was supposed to come with her. Cass has her on photography business and at the last minute gets a call for a photo shoot she just can't say no to. So, Talia will be on her own at The Hawthorne.On arrival a chopper pilot is there to meet her. It takes a helicopter to get the the resort. The pilot is supposed to be Trevor but it isn't. The pilot called Bash. Bash says he's a friend of Trevors and he agreed to take Trevors place because Trev went on vacation. Bash reminds her a lot of Sebastian. Same 6'4" size, with black hair though Bash has a short beard. He's in great shape and is definitely eye candy of the super kind.So begins a great read.This one has Talia, Bash, a weekend at a resort, a Bash who turns out to be more than Talia could have ever imagined, a serial killer, a Talia who has a stalker, an artistic kid who holds the key to a stalker, murder, attempted murder, a woman named Regan who delivers a box to Bash, a box with memories from three years ago, the NYPD, a man named Sheehan, a woman named Doria, Sebastian's murdered mother, a woman named Cynthia who's not what she appears to be and Talia Murphy doing her best to figure the mystery out, get her feelings for Sebastian figured out, stay alive and survive.One damned fine read. Five Stars.

Another great Ben Hood read. Spoiler Alert.This one starts with Charlie Noah.Charlie is rich, stunningly beautiful, respected as a writer for newspapers and high class magazines in Austrailia  and around the world. She is married to an extremely successful insurance high flyer and lives in a mansion overlooking Sydney Harbour. Her home is surrounded by well heeled friends who (She thought) respected and admired her.Most of the opulence surrounding her lifestyle came from her husband, Reginald Noah. Her own income was substantial but his bordered on the obscene.All was going well till Charlie discovered her husband was having an affair with a neighbor. One of many it seems. Charlie threatened to expose his affair in one of the magazines she wrote for. Reginald Noah locked her out of the family home and that's when Charlie threatened to expose his corrupt and fraudulent dealings within the insurance company which employed him.Charlie knew she was in trouble and withdrew large amounts of money from her private bank accounts and arranged for the construction of a totally new identity complete with relevant identification papers, drivers license and certificates as well as a new off shore bank account. Its not hard when you know the right people and Charlie knew them very well.Reginald Noah was livid and knew he had to stop his wife from blowing the whistle on his less than savory acts. Stephen Pope is a hit man for hire and hire him Noah does.Ben Hood was bullied by Rod Reid into seeing a psychiatrist, Doctor Jackson Pugh, in reference to his supposed sexual hang ups. Well Ben doesn't have any but Rod sure believes he does. So Ben decided to humor Rod and see Pugh.After the session the Doctor tells him it will take a few weeks to get the results back. Ben isn't sure he wants them back. He is, however, sure he is taking a couple of weeks off.At the southern end of Seven Mile Beach in Port Douglas in Far North Queensland, Australia, there is a beautiful cove fringed with pure white sand. The land fronting this cove is mostly rainforest and privately owned by an eccentric French millionaire who had two pole houses constructed on either end of the cove, almost a kilometer apart and each out of sight of the other. He had named the cove La Place De La Magic, or The Place of Magic. The millionaire rents both houses out since he doesn't use either.Ben Hood will be staying in one of them and Charlie Noah will be in the other.So begins another great Ben Hood tale.This one has Ben, a Ben who's only looking for a vacation but finds a damsel in distress, Charlie, a Charlie who has disappeared with a vast amount of her husbands money,  Reginald Noah who will hire many to find Charlie, a killer named Pope, Rick Turner, a Rick Turner who is wounded and almost killed by the man looking for Charlie, Tara Lennox, an attack on Charlie, a Charlie who then heads for the islands, a bracelet that has to clues to Charlie's destination, a wounded killer, two men who take his place, the Vanuatu Islands, a house on one of the islands that belongs to Charlie, murders that took place around WWII at that house, the bones of the murderer, the bones of his two Vanuatu victims who were young women, one of whom was the daughter of a local chief, twelve missing rubies,  ghosts, ghosts that speak to Ben, a bay mare who is wild but gets close to Ben,  a restaurant, the restaurant owner Christine, her cousin, murder, attempted murder and Ben Hood on one roller coaster of a ride to save a beautiful woman and solve a mystery that's decades old.Five Stars and then some.

Another great read by Molles, Spoiler alert.This one starts with Abe and Lucas escaping their captors at Ft. Bragg. Abe was wounded and he and Lucas are being hunted. Lucas tells Abe to run and he will slow them up. Its a death sentence for Lucas but Abe knows that having Lee's GPS he's got to go.Lee, Carl and three Delta operators land back at Bragg and finds out Abe and Lucas escaped. Lee heads out in pursuit. He shoots Lucas and finds Abe, a badly wounded Abe. Lee finds his GPS and still can't figure out if Abe is still a friend or not. Abe is headed for the hospital and Lucas is dead.Harper Julia and Harpers men  along with Sgt. Kensey and the marines are headed back to Ryder. Kensey stops at a grain silo to tend to Julia. He and his men then kill all of Harpers men and take Harper and Julia prisoner. Harper can't believe what he's seeing and can't figure out why anyone would want he and Julia as prisoners. This is something he will fine out about when Tyler Bowden, the lead on the Hometown Project, shows up.LaRouche is still doing the bidding of the pastor. He and his men have killed many and will kill more.Lee and Amanda have a long talk. Amanda wants more from Lee and Lee just can't give it. He's to busy trying to save those at Camp Ryder a personal life is out of the question. Lee has killed many and even though his friend Tomlin has offered to help take some of the burden off Lee, Lee feels its his burden and he must carry it.Lee has no idea what a s**t storm he's about to walk into.So begins another great read by Molles.This one has Lee, Tomlin, Amanda, Deuce, Sam, Abby, those at Camp Ryder, Col Stearns, alliances,  Ft. Bragg, Lee's GPS, the bunker and what it holds,  Carl, his Delta operators, the pastor and his minions, the marines, artillery, a hospital in Johnson City, a plan by Lee to save as many as he can, Tyler Bowden, Kensey and his marines, death, destruction, betrayal, murder, an Abe who's done what he set out to do, an Abe who Lee calls friend, Harper, Julia, a fight at the grain silo's, the pastors men attacking the marines and their artillery, LaRouche finally getting it back together and doing the right thing, those at Camp Ryder heading for Bragg, Col. Stearns daughter and Lee Hardin finally seeing light at the end of a very long tunnel.Five Stars and then some.

Pretty damned good read. Spoiler alert.This one starts back in the 80's with the escape of Dr. Morozov from the lab where he worked. The Americans got him out and little did they know his work would bring down the world.Kyle Walker works for an armored car company. He and his seventy year old partner, Marv, a Vietnam vet, have been partnered for quite a while. They do deliveries and pick ups with various banks and businesses in the area. The hours can be long depending on how many pick ups and deliveries they have to make.On arrival at work Kyle heads for the vault to pick up the invoices and items for delivery.  One of the items was almost left off. Its a case with an LED light on it. Kyle wonders about it but once he sees where its headed he forgets about it.Kyle and Marv head off but get stopped on the on ramp to the throughway by a massive accident. LEO's are on site.Kyle heads over to see if the officer will let him go around because of the armored car. No luck. The officer is being an idiot and he tells Kyle to get back in his vehicle. That's when the screaming starts.Kids are attacking and biting anyone they can. Those bitten, officers included, rise up and start attacking everyone they can.Kyle and the Officer, Richard, open fire and find the only way to stop these things is with a head shot. Kyle tells Marv, via radio, to get out which Marv does.They then observe white SUV's arrive on the scene. The men are attacked along with everyone else. They withdraw and Kyle sees jets streaking toward them.Kyle, in his military life, was in Air Force Intelligence among other things. He knows what those jets will do and tells Richard they need to leave noow. They get to a police cruiser and take off as fast as they can go to get away from the area.Marv is getting out when a chopper gets in his way. The chopper fires a missile into the road in from of Marv and the vehicle overturns.Marv can't figure out why the chopper is firing at him and the only thing remotely of interest in the armored car is that damned case. Marv grabs it gets out and leaves the area as fast as he can.The jets released bombs that obliterate the area killing everything in that area. Kyle and Richard end up in the overturned cruiser but are alive. They both get out and get the hell out of the area.Kyle and his wife were sweethearts at one time in their lives but grew apart and married others. They met up later and married.Between them they have five kids who are currently with Kyle's family in another State. HIs wife runs a very lucrative day care center for local kids. His wife is tough as nails but has no use for guns. That changes quick when a crazy man breaks into her house and she and the kids are forced to fight for their lives.Kyle and Richard finally find Marv and he lets them know its the case the Homeland thugs were after. The men make their way to the police station and arm up with weapons that were left.Kyle tells them he needs to get home to check on his wife and Marv needs to get home to check on his. Richard goes with Marv and Kyle heads home.Once there he sees his home has been attacked. There is a dead body in the living room and his wife's car is gone. His wife will be on her way out of the area to his parents house. Kyle gets to his gun safe, arms up and heads out to his parents home.Marv finds his wife dead in her bed and knows she's been murdered. He and Richard head out.So begins one pretty damned fine read.This one has Kyle, Richard, Marv, Bishop who leads the Homeland thugs, a Bishop who finds out exactly what Kyle did in the military, missing cases like the one Marv opened, murder, attempted murder, a Bishop who is determined to get those cases back and will use any means to do so, a Kyle who makes his way to his parents house only to be captured, a Bishop who issues and ultimatum to Kyle knowing Kyle can get the job done as he's seen Kyle's service record and knows exactly what Kyle is capable of and Kyle Walker doing his best to protect his loved ones and survive.

Another great read by Hart. Spoiler alert.This one starts with JJ and Jim on their honeymoon. They are on a tiny island and have been enjoying themselves far away from home. The sex has been great and JJ and Jim have been lounging around, swimming and laying on the beach.They are on the beach when they look at their cabana and see someone waiting for them. That someone is the local LEO, the only LEO on the island.The Officer, Joe Kingston,  tells Jim and JJ about a murder that's been committed. Murder isn't something he's ever handled as murders don't happen on the island. He asks Jim and JJ if they can assist him. They both agree though they really don't want to get involved. They decide they will do a prelim and then turn it back over to the officer and he can contact the mainland.The dead man is 99 years old and he's lived on the island for decades. He and his wife are well known and respected by all island dwellers. His murder is something none of them can understand. Why kill a 99 year old man??JIm contacts his FBI pal Ben Carver and slowly the pieces begin to fall in place.So begins a damned fine read.This one has Jim, JJ, Joe, Ben, the dead mans wife, his children, the islanders, a dead man who's far more than he appears to be, a conspiracy by one and all, a Jim and JJ doing the job under less than ideal conditions, the dagger the man was killed with, his past, hatred, revenge and Jim and JJ figuring the whole thing out and leaving the punishment, if any, to others.Five Stars. Great read.

Another great read by Chesser. Spoiler alert.This one starts with a guy named Dreagon. He's a big guy and of Ukranian descent. Its Winter in Eden, Utah and the cold temps have slowed the walker down or downright stopped them in their tacks. Good time to kill them.Dreagon is on his way to the home of a couple who he thinks may know who  killed his daughter and son in law. The shootout where they died is pretty close to where these two live. So far they have told him nothing. Revenge is all he can think of. Revenge will rule his world in the days to come.Brook survived her run in with the Omega virus but she's having to do a lot of physical therapy. Her right side is weak and Glenda has been helping her to recover. Cade is also there to help in any way he can. He's just glad she survived. The cure only works 50% of the time. In Brooks case it worked in Chief's it didn't. Raven carries her inoculation with her at all times. Just in case.Seems Glenda and Duncan are seeing each other. Glenda is also helping Duncan with his alcohol problem. Glenda is a pretty savvy lady with a lot of know how in a lot of different areas. She's already told Cade this cold front won't last and warm weather will be back.Cade decided to head to the pass to fix the breach where all those walkers were getting through and kill as many walkers as he can for as long as he can. Lev, Jamie, Duncan, Daymon, Taryn and Wilson will be accompanying him.Cade is in the best shape of his life. He weighs 180 pounds and its solid muscle. His ankle has healed well and his Sat phone has numerous messages from Nash on it. So far he hasn't answered but knows in time he will. Right now he's taking care of his family and those at the compound. Nash's wants will just have to wait.So begins another great read by Chesser.This one has Cade, Brook, Raven, Max, Lev, Duncan, Daymon,Taryn, Wilson, Oliver who's Glenda's long missing son, Alexander Dreagon, his son's Gregory and Peter, Judge Pomoroy, a plan by Deagon for revenge, a revenge that's aimed in the wrong direction, Sasha who in her usual idiot fashion leads Raven outside the wire, a capture of the two wayward girls, a Gregory who follows his Fathers instructions though he's not entirely certain his Father is right, Chines soldiers in the area that have been turned, a Cade wondering where in the hell these soldiers came from and what they are doing in America, a Brook who push's the showdown at the compound, a Cade and crew who are on the way, a message from Nash and Cade Greyson once more getting ready to fight for his country, life, family and survival.Five Stars and then some.

Just a great read with some great dialogue and some super characters.  Spoiler alert.Talia is thirteen years old. Its pouring rain and she's on her way, far away, from the apartment she and her Aunt call home.People are dead there and Talia knows her young niece is among them. She doesn't know where she's going but she's in one big hurry to get there.Along the way she runs into a homeless man who wants her locket. An expensive car pulls up and a young man steps out. He's dressed in black so Talia calls him Black. Talia figures the young man is around seventeen years old. He gives the homeless man a receipt that will get him meals at a local restaurant. He then asks Talia if she needs a ride.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Talia, a Talia who eight years later is a budding reporter, a reporter who needs to get into the Blake mansion to interview Mina Blake, Talia's best friend Cass, who looks a lot like a socialite and has the means to get into the mansion, a costume party where everyone is masked, a party where Cass and Talia do get in, an interview with Mina, her very protective brothers, a man in a hood who dances with Talia, a Talia who decides to call herself Red, the man in the hood is the same young man who rescued her eight years ago, Black, a Talia who decides she won't tell Black that he already has met her and she him, a Mr. Black who's the first man Talia has ever had sex with, a Mr. Black who is honored to be her first, a Mr. Black who gets a call, a Mr. Black who is the illegitimate son of Mr. Blake, a Mr. Black who's a Navy SEAL who's last name is Quinn, a man named Calder who's also a SEAL and a team mate of Quinn's, a Calder who Cass spends the night dancing with, and a Talis who decides Mr. Black needs to be seen againFive Stars a great read.

Pretty good read. Spoiler alert.This one starts with John Talon and his wife Ellie at home. The baby needs feeding and its Johns turn.John works as a school administrator and Ellie is a nurse who works at a local hospital. She works part time and usually gets the shifts no one else wants.John gets most of his news via the internet but does turn on the TV for background noise. Tuning it on today he catches the news about a new pandemic. Its a disease that started in the Congo Basin in Africa. A disease that will shortly take over the world.So begins one damned fine read.This one has John, his son Jake, Ellie, an Ellie who does go to work that day, an Ellie who contracts the disease, an Ellie who gives John a good-bye call, the walking dead, the Govt. who's response is less than reassuring, the CDC who's leaders are scared, a John who fortifies  his house and stays in it as long as he can, a John who's a member of IDPA where he learned skills, skills that will serve him well in the days to come, a John who has many guns and ammo and knows how to use them all, the walking dead who invade his city, a John who watches and learns that a head shot is the only way to kill them, a John on a bike with Jake making his way out of the city, a John who meets Tommy and Duncan, two men who become friends, allies and traveling companions, a John and crew who help save sixty eight people trapped in four buildings, a John who's a natural leader, a John and crew who take over a school that can be defended, death, murder, rape, gangs, a woman named Sarah who is kidnapped by a gang, a showdown between John and his crew and the gang, and John Talon and those with him doing their best to beat the odds and stay alive.Five Stars.

Another great read by Lundy. Spoiler alert.This one starts with Brad, Brooks, Rodgers, Shane, Ella, Chelsea and the rest of the crew in the Savannah compound.Brad and Brooks are tagged to go on a patrol. A patrol that gets bushwhacked by black clad soldiers. The same black clad soldiers who they have seen when bad things happen.In the ME Turner and the rest of Brads crew are picked up when Col. Cloud makes arrangements to swap the crew for Ella.Of course Cloud isn't keen on this but his General, who's beginning to see himself as a true leader, insists. The general knows Ella is a the Savanna compound. Ella is immune to the plague and her blood is the key to immunization. The General  and his black uniformed troops, who are mercenary contractors,  are there to get her. Failing that he hopes to trade Brads men for her.Cloud throws a monkey wrench in the works when he and Turner highjack the plane after the pick up in the ME.Turner and over one hundred others are now in the C-130 and Cloud directs them to the Savannah compound airfield.Dan Cloud is an ex Marine and has a compound that is under attack by a motely crew of killers. So far Dan and his team have made these idiots look like just what they are. Idiots. Col Cloud is Dan's son and his wife and daughter are in Dan's compound. This is a place Col Cloud will be heading for to check on his wife and daughter.So begins another great read by Lundy.This one has Brad, Brooks, Rodgers, Col Cloud, Dan Cloud, Turner, Hassan the Afghan scout, a trip by Brad and his crew to Dan Clouds compound, a confrontation with the idiots, Brooks, Rogers and Col Cloud on their way to the Denver compound, Brooks and company taking over that compound, a confrontation with the General and his mercenaries,  the walking dead, killers, murder, attempted murder, a cure for the plague, a Shane and Chelsea growing close and Brad not minding that one bit, and Brad and those with him finally seeing light at the end of one very long tunnel.Five Stars.

Another great read by Dixon. Spoiler alert.This one starts with the discovery of murder in Costa Rica.The murdered are a family. The murdered man is a thief who stole millions from investors in America. The police and FBI agent Bill Marquez, who was sent to assist because of the  American thief, know whoever did this used the torture of the two children to get what they wanted.Problem is they left millions of dollars and uncut gems behind. They took nothing and left no forensic evidence of any kind. This tells Marquez that whatever this team was after, they didn't find it. He also thinks they will continue torture and kill in order to find it.Its a few weeks later in another country. This time the there are two victims. One of them, the male, was a squatter in a million dollar mansion. The other, the girl, was a bed mate he had picked up to spend the night with. Of course these two unfortunates knew nothing about the owners of the house and absolutely nothing about what the team are looking for. They were both tortured and killed.Levon Cade and Merry are living in upstate Maine. Its Winter and snow has fallen and more is on the way.Levon and Merry live on Lake Bellevue. Its a community with homes that the owners use a couple of weeks out of the year. The homes are mansions and the owners are wealthy.  Its a community out in the middle of nowhere which is exactly where Levon wants to be.There are few full time residents, a convenience store/gas station and the owner Cecile who lives there full time.Cecile is a hard woman and has no problem taking care of herself and her property. She doesn't suffer fools and has no problem letting people know her likes and dislikes and she could care less what they think about it.Nate Dennison is the homeowners association handy man. He and his family, wife Dannie and kids Carl and Giselle, live on the lake full time. Nate works on any problems the houses may have.Levon known as Mitch Roener, lives in a house on the lake. He and Merry are safe for now.  Levon also has more than enough money and works as a handyman to keep busy.  Merry has made friends with Carl and Gisele. The three of them see quite a bit of each other. They are the only kids on the lake.Merry is being home schooled as teachers have shown to much interest in her background and family. Merry is one savvy little lady and knows how she has to play the game so she and her Dad stay free and survive.Lee is a woman who Levon helps get home after she gets stuck in a snow bank. She's staying in one of the unoccupied houses and has told everyone that she has the permission of the owners.That of course is a lie. Lee has her own agenda. She's waiting for the men to arrive.So begins one damned fine kick ass read.This one has Levon, Merry, Nate, Danni, Carl, Gisele, Cecile, Lee, a blizzard, murder, attempted murder, death, a team of eight men on a mission, the one eyed leader of the team, two members of the team who are already at Lake Bellevue, a team everyone on Bellevue thinks are artists, a flash drive which is the ultimate prize,  a night when Merry is at Danni's house, a night when the men arrive, a night when they murder almost everyone on Lake Bellevue, a night when Merry escapes and cross country ski's to the store, a night when Levon realizes murder is taking place, a night when Levon Cade takes matters into his own very capable hands and a night when an eight man team finds out that killing and torturing unarmed civilians is a far cry from killing a man with more skills and ability than they ever thought possible.Five Stars and then some.

Pretty darned good read. Spoiler alert.This one starts with McLean Ferrier who works part time for a medical company. He delivers supplies as needed to medial facilities. Things have been slow as the economy still sucks.Right now McLean is on his way to a homeless shelter. Of course Carrie Alford works there and McLean would really like to get to know this lovely lady much better. Problem is McLean is kinda on the shy side when it come to women and hasn't really had the opportunity or guts to ask her out.Once on site Carrie welcomes him and tells him the shelter is closing due to no money and new Govt. Regulations. McLean is taken aback by this as he knows the facility is needed for the homeless in the area. It provides food, shelter and medical aide.On his way out he spots the Mayor of Denver and a news crew talking about how places like Carrie's need to close so the Govt. can take over. Of course McLean knows that a load of crap because nothing the Govt. has ever done has been done cheaply or well. He manages to make those facts knows to those viewers watching the Mayor. A mayor who's an idiot who likes the limelight not answering questions that put his views in doubt.McLean has a 76 F-250 truck and on his way out at a stop light all the lights go out and all vehicle he can see just stop working. He also sees a plane fall from the sky.McLean is a prepper and he knows that America has suffered and EMP hit or a solar flare. Either of which would cause what he's seeing. His vehicle is a 76 and is still running just fine.McLean decides he has to get out of Denver and meet the rest of his prepper pals at his ranch. On the way he remembers Carrie. He can't just leave her in Denver. He does a U turn and heads back to the shelter where she works.So begins a damned fine read.This one has McLean, a stay at Carries apartment, another EMP hit that knocks McLeans truck out of commission, Carrie, her mindless friend Shauna, Shauna's work mate David, a group of black clad men shooting and causing chaos, black clad men that seem to have an agenda and are working for someone, who that someone is McLean would like to know,  gang bangers who will rob and kill you, a Denver burning and full of murder and chaos, a trip to a horse ranch, meeting some of McLeans prepper buddies, JD and DJ, the loan of horses by the owner, a trip through mountain passes, a Carrie who thinks McLean and his pals need to help everyone,  a Carrie who doesn't realize you can't help everyone if you want to hang onto your supplies and stay alive,  death, murder, destruction and McLean and his friends making it to his ranch and all of them looking to stay alive.Five Stars.

Great read full of great dialogue, action and humor. Spoiler alert.This one starts with Nelson and Michelle Jackson who are ex Army. They were both MP's and Nelson and Michelle did several tours of duty in Iraq.Nelson also was in Afghanistan. He trained to become a Ranger but left the military before doing so. Nelson is also a college grad who held a 4.0 average all through college. He's far from a dummy.Nelson and Michelle have three kids. Gavin age 9, Olivia age 5 and Devin age nine months. They are devoted parents and love their kids.The house they own is in a nice community. Their house is the smallest one in the area. Nelson and Michelle decided long ago that having a big house meant spending more on the house and they prefer to put their money into the future. Gold and silver.The Jacksons have to German Rotties. Zeus and Hera are attack trained and are part of the family. They are also an effective deterrent to anyone looking to rob the house.Nelson is the District Director for an outdoor company that sells guns, ammo, fishing supplies, camping supplies and anything else you can imagine an outdoorsman might want.Michelle is a nurse. She's also intelligent and beautiful. She and Nelson are very much in love.Nelson and Michelle are also preppers. Everything they own is paid for and they currently are buying gold and silver.Matt and Ashley are good friends of the Jacksons and are preppers as well. Matt is an LEO in Springfield, Missouri and Ashley is a dispatcher. Both families are concerned with the current state of affairs in the US.Both families also have getaway cabins that are a three hour drive from Springfield. The cabins are on a farm owned by  Bernard and Nellie Parker. A Bernard and Nellie who are preppers and feel both Nelson, Matt and their families are right. Bad things are coming and they will be prepared.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Nelson, Michelle, Matt, Ashley, Gerard who is a twenty five year Army veteran most of which was in Special Forces, his sister Nicky who's brilliant with computers, a hacker who can hack anything and any organization,  Bernard, Nellie, a market crash for both China and Japan, debts being called due, a Govt. led by an idiot POTUS who takes peoples 401K's, IRA and anything else they can take to pay those debts, Homeland Security, FEMA detention camps, riots, murder, Americans losing their freedom, a Govt. out of control with an agenda to control all Americans, a Nelson who cleans the guns and ammo from the store where he's based, guns and ammo that will help train an army,  a tricky ride to the farm, police officers who try to stop them,  neighbors, the crew at the farm hardening their defenses, Nelson, Michelle and the others finding out they are wanted as terrorists and Nelson and his crew getting ready for the fight of their lives as they try to save and defend America.One super read. Five Stars.

Another good read by Via. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with Austin Michaels who's a member of God and Days very effective task force in Atlanta, Georgia. Michaels loves his job working for the best drug task force on the east coast.Michaels comes from a long line of law enforcement officers. He has a masters degree in psychology and it  helped him make detective ten years faster than either his father or his grandfather. At thirty two he's a detective on the most decorated and highly regarded task forces in law enforcement. Michaels has been on the team for three years.Michaels is gay like many of his teammates. He loves his job but sure doesn't like no one to share his life with. Hell God and Day, Green and Rux and the team Sgt. Syn and Furi are all lovers, partners and all but Furi are cops. Michaels also has to put up with his grousing father every time he visits. Of course all his family knows he's gay and they could care less. Its just Michaels who's having a hard time finding someone.Michaels is beginning to be viewed as anti social by Day. Day knows something is bothering Michaels and he's bound and determined to find out what that something is.Judge is a bounty hunter. He's the go to guy for Duke who owns the bail bond business.Judge is big, bearded and a guy who always gets his man. He's a natural born tracker with fifteen years in the Army. The last five as an Army Ranger.  He and his one hundred and fifty pound highly trained Great Dane, Bookem are a team. Though Bookem is getting older he's all the partner Judge needs.God knows Judge and calls him when a druggie escapes a well planned sweep taking the drugs with him. He needs a tracker and Judge is the man.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Michaels, Judge, Bookem, God, Day, the rest of the team, the hunt for the drugs and the druggie,a Judge an Michaels as a team in pursuit of the drugs and druggie,  a Judge and Michaels coming together, a Judge who takes off without a word, Judges father, a history Judge just can't forget,  a Michaels who nearly loses his life, a God and Day and team set to kick Judge's ass and Austin Michaels finally finding a man he can love.Five Stars.

Another fine read by Lund. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what's in the book.This one starts with Delta operators, Chivo, Apollo, Odin and Zennie. These men have worked together for years and are now making their way out of Mexico, where their last mission was, back to the States. Its a tough row to hoe as there are walking dead, the cartel and many others who want to kill them.Zennie is killed when someone blows a hole in the roll up door to the warehouse where they are currently fighting for their lives. Of course they shoot Zennie in the head so he can't come back as a walker, take his body and make their way out of Mexico and back into the US.They lose Odin as well when he's bitten and leads the walkers away from his brothers. That leaves Apollo and Chivo to make it home, contact superiors and hope to survive.While in Little Rock, Arkansas, Pulaski Heights, Amanda Lampton, the Secretary of Agriculture is at home and getting ready for a weekend without her children. The kids are with their Dad and Amanda has only her two cocker spaniels as companions for the entire weekend.That's when FBI Agents Smith and Johnson, not their real names, appear at her door and tell her Babylon Shield has been initiated and she has to leave with them immediately.They advise her the country is under attack and they have to get her to a secret location as fast as they can. Amanda leaves with the two agents for one hell of a ride filled with danger and the walking dead. Amanda will become a seasoned survivor and killer before she gets to that locationIn Cortez Co., Jake and his wife Sara are enjoying the evening when the lights go out. On looking out they see all lights are out and neither the iPad or the mac book will work. Jake knows something is wrong and it isn't just a power failure. He turns on his shortwave radio, a radio he's protected with a faraday cage. He gets the FEMA emergency broadcast channel advising of ill people and the warning to stay away from them and if family members to report them for help.Jake thinks an EMP has hit and he's worried about the "ill" people. Little does he know what he and his band of preppers and those who come to him for aid are in for.Baxar Reed, his wife Jesssie and their young daughter Keely were fleeing Big Bend National Park after a gang of bikers, the Pistoleros, killed their friends. The biker gang has been robbing, killing and doing exactly what they want to do since the EMP hit. They kill to get whatever they want and have woman held as sex slaves.Bexar had contacted a man named Cliff using a shortwave radio that set up in the hills at Big Bend. Cliff is presently at area 51 a place that's secure and has supplies, electricity, ammo and weapons. Its a place Bexar is going to try to reach with his family.Area 51 is secure and AF Major Wright made it to 51 in a C-130 when Peterson AFB was overrun. His pilot was Acuni a guy who really only  a pilot trainee but turns out to be the only game in town. He and the airmen he brought with him and Cliff are about the only people in the complex. Of course they had to kill all the walkers who had been the area's personnel but now they are secure.Cliff, who isn't really Cliff, has a mission. That mission is to save as many civilians as he can. There are other agents like Cliff all over the country and they are doing the same. Trying to save civilians.So begins another great read by Lund.This one has Bexar, Jessie, Keely, the Pistolero's, Clint, Amanda, Cliff, Chivo, Apollo, a woman named Lindsay who Chivo and Apollo rescue. a Lindsay who turns into one hell of a fighter and companion for the two Delta operators, missions to rescue civilians, three PJ's who are recovered at an airport,  Amanda and Clint who make it to safety, an Amanda who becomes the POTUS, a Cliff who's shot down in a C-130 and damned near loses his life, a Bexar who takes on the Pistolero's to save his wife and daughter, Chivo and Apollo who are tasked by Cliff to rescue Bexar, a Jessie who thinks Bexar is dead, a tragedy for both Bexar and Jessie, death , destruction,  and groups of survivors doing their best to continue to survive and stay alive.Five Stars.

Another great read by Feehan. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with Gavriil Prekenski. Gavriil is in a world of pain and has been since he was stabbed seven times while defending his client. Its pain Gavriil has learned to live with.Prekenski is currently in Sea Haven. He's there to warn his brothers especially Ilya, the youngest. Those in power want all of them dead. Four of his brothers are married and living in Sea Haven. The women they are married to have power. Power that makes the farm where they live an impossible place to get into.The moment Gavriil stepped onto the property, the large farm with his brothers and the six women living on it, he'd felt the ripples of power and knew the farm was protected, not only by his brothers, who were dangerous, but by the elements.  Earth, Air, Water, Fire. He even felt spirit.Of course all the Prekenski men have power as well. Ilya, the youngest, is the most powerful and Gavriil is here to warn him that he's now on the kill on site order along with the rest of the brothers. There are seven brothers and they are all on that list.Gavriil is currently watching a young woman moving through the corn in his direction. She moves with grace, and a fluid easy manner, occasionally stopping to pull one of the ears down to inspect it. He couldn't take his eyes from her or the way the plants leaned toward her, as if She were the sun. She had long auburn hair very long and thick that fell past her waist.Prekenski knew her. He had always know her. He'd know she was somewhere in the world waiting, and the itch in his palm and the pain paralyzing his mind told him this woman belonged to him and only him.
