How completely unexpected and unacceptable was that.Lexi Thompson is that young woman and she's now going to check on the acreage that they had purchased to add to the farm. The farm is producing far more than Lexi imagined it would and she needs help to manage everything. The rest of the girls all have their own business's to run  and Lexi feels she can't ask them to give up their business's to assist with the farm. But she needs help. She works from sunup till sundown and sometimes longer to make the farm a paying enterprise which it now is. They are comfortably in the black and that's how Lexi wants it to stay that way.Lexi comes from a less than stellar existance.Lexi was taken from her home at age eight by a psycho named Duncan Cain.  Cain is a religious fanatic with cult followers in many compounds.Caine made her his wife at age eight and forced sex on a child. An eight year old child who was no where near ready to have sex with an adult male.Cain treated her like a slave and eventually she escaped but he killed her entire family in retribution.Lexi went into to witness protection and Cain's compounds were raided though Cain and some of his most trusted men did escape. Now he's back.Of course he has no idea that Lexi now has a powerful protector. Gavriil Prekenski is a killer. A killer with powers that Cain has no idea exist.So begins another fine read by Feehan.This one has Gavriil, Lexi, a Lexi whose element is Earth, Ariana, an Ariana who's element is Air, Max, Illya, Levi, Thomas, Blythe, a Blythe who wasn't bound to an element but had incredible gifts of her own, Lissa, Rikki, a Rikki who's element is water,  Judith, a Judith who is bound to Spirit and married to Stephan, a Lexi with loads of baggage from her time as Cain's slave, a Gavriil who binds Lexi to him in the Prekenski way, a Gavriil who takes things slow with Lexi and shows her love and sex can be something far from pain and slavery, another attack by Cain's minions, those seeking to kill the Prekenski brothers, Jonas Harrington, and Gavriil who will do his best to convince Lexi to be with him, protect his brothers and stay alive.Five Stars.

Another great Ben Hood read. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with a body. Medical Examiner Dawn Stone is speaking with Sergeant Ross Davidson. She tell him the man was tortured before he died.The body was found in the Australian Gold Coast. The victim was a screenplay writer. A man who was writing that screenplay for a movie to be shot in Australia. The movie is a Chinese production. John Cheng is the mans name and why someone tortured and murdered him is the question Sgt. Davidson will be looking into.Rodney Reid, owns the VIP protection agency in Australia. Ben Hood his best investigator and has arrived at Rod's house after Rod asked him to come over.Ben is looking to take some time off. He's quite wealthy and doesn't have to work but does take some assignments from Rod now and then. So far some of them have been extremely dangerous and Ben would like to spend time as his farm.Rod wants Ben to take a job. According to Rod the job could be dangerous and it involves Lilly Yong a famous Chinese actress and a movie about a missing reporter.So begins another great Ben Hood read.This one has Ben, Lilly Yong, her sister Lixue, Rod, Rose, Akira, Bell, John Wei who's Yong's male body guard, Jia Bao who's Lilly's best friend, a group of Chinese with a mission, the Dragonfly Project, a supposedly closed and deserted  mine in Australia the Mary Kathleen, uranium, a reporter Chi Nuan who disappeared and is presumed dead, a woman named Joanne Santos, helicopter in flight in the middle of the night, another woman this one named Mia Zhang Ben's old friend Detective Jeff Mallard, Ben's spook acquaintance Major Curtin, murder, attempted murder, intrigue  and Ben Hood in the middle of another damned fine who dun it.Five Stars.

Another good read by Kelly. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with LAPD Detective Kate Sexton and Hudson McKenzie in a chance meet.Hud is an ex US Navy SEAL. He travels all over the world on missions for his company. Kate and he had a brief fling. Hud advised Kate that as soon as she figured out whether she and her boyfriend Jack Bautista still had a relationship then he wouldn't be seeing her.Detective Kate Sexton is an LAPD Robbery Homicide Detective and works for Section One. Section One is a specialized unit that handled the department's most difficult and high profile homicides. Kate and her K-9 partner Bernie have found a home in Section One.Pearl Kramer is Kate's sometimes partner and a guy who retired from the LAPD and now works for Section One on a part time basis. Pearl is a man Kate has the utmost respect for and he's a damned good cop with years of know how.Right now she and Hud are interrupted by a call from Pearl about another Hollywood murder. This one involves Olivia Ashcroft a very popular TV personality. Seems she came home at around 11 PM to find both her husband and her stepdaughter dead.So begins another damned fine read by Kelly.This one has Kate, Bernie, Pearl, Natalie, Mo, Nana, Olivia Ashcroft, Olivia's dead husband Marty Ashcroft, her dead husband's brother Victor Ashcroft, a pedophile, a pair of robbers, Ashcroft's best friend Brandi Hart, Ashcroft's sister in law, Detectives Alex Hardy and Christine Belfont also of the Unit , a Chris who turns into a pretty good friend to Kate, ME Brie Henner, Kate's half sister Lindsay, Lindsay's problems, Kate's commander Lt. Oz, crime analyst Selfie Rogers, the unit secretary Molly Wingate, a woman with a mission, a mission that includes murder, murder, attempted murder and Kate Sexton doing her best to figure it all out and make sure justice prevails.Five Stars and I sure hoped Pearce Landon would be Kate's love interest. Oh well. Hud is a hunk. LOL

Just a great read. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with NORAD getting readings of one hundred and fifty  aircraft headed for America. They are flying over Canada and headed straight for the United States. Those at NORAD think these bombers are drones and they belong to China.  Two Fighters already in the air shoot down many of them but many are left.Bexar Reed is a motor cycle cop in Brazos County, Texas  and is working the day after Christmas. He's getting ready to turn in his tickets at the station and head for home. He's wishing he'd taken leave time so he wouldn't have to be a work today.Bexar's wife Jessie is a teacher and she and their young daughter are at home spending a lazy day doing nothing. Its a day that won't be repeated for some time to come.On his way home Bexar gets an alert from dispatch that America is under attack and all officers are to report back to the station. Bexar had pulled over to the side of the road. After a few moments of thought he gets his cell and texts WINCHESTER. A text that will get his prepper friends moving toward their rally point. Bexar won't be gong to the station.So begins one damned fine well written story.This one has Bexar, his wife Jessica and daughter, Jack Snyder, his wife Sandra and son, Malachi Laing and his wife Amber, an EMP attack, drone aircraft dropping an oily substance across America, the walking dead, marauders, a safe location at Big Bend, Cliff and his run to area 51, AF Maj. Wright and his C-130 headed for 51,a scientist still at 51, a Malachi who's radio's were protected by faraday cages, radios that let Bexar and his companions communicate with Cliff, a Cliff who's one hell of an agent,  a Bexar and his companions in a fight for their lives, death, destruction and Bexar Reed and his wife and daughter doing their best to stay alive.Five Stars and then some. Super read.

Just a kick ass read. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with Army Captain Scott Repp. Repp is thirty seven years old and in a year he will retire from the Army. Of course that was before the death flue and the walking dead.Repp is 6'4" and weighs in at around 225 pound. He's currently with his battle group headed for Columbus, GA to try to save the city from the walking dead. The dead who came to life after a flue pandemic hit the US and everywhere else. This flue has killed millions of people and those millions have reanimated killing more. Once you are bitten you become the undead swelling the ranks of those the military has to fight.Repp was married but came home to find his wife in bed with another man. Repp had no problem picking the man up and throwing him against a wall and then beating the hell out of him. He and his wife were divorced post haste. He has two kids who are currently with his Mother and Father in Rogers Corner, Michigan. Repp was there on a two week leave until he got orders to head back to Ft. Benning  for briefing and an assignment to Columbus, GA.Jed "Jack" Sherman is a killer. He's a killer and a sociopath  but he's very selective on who he kills and for what reason.Jack's current girlfriend, Sunshine, is a beautiful woman. She and her son Bret are trapped in the relationship. Jack turned from a great guy into a beater of woman. Of course he was always like this and friends tried to warn Sunshine but she saw only what she wanted to see. Hence her being trapped in a relationship with a killer.Repp and his command ran into more than anyone bargained for in Columbus. Thousands of walking dead made it impossible for the military to save the city. Repp and two of his men finally managed to get out of Columbus but most of the Army was overrun by the walking dead.Repp picked up civilians along the way and they made it to the Johnson Ranch. A place with cattle, horses, chickens, pigs and crops. A place that Repp decides will be home until he can get back to Michigan and his family.So begins one damned fine well written book.This one has Williams, Sunshine, two doctors, a kid named Arni, assorted civilian survivors, ham radios, a group of motorcycle marauders called Locust, Jack and his plans for Sunshine, Jack and his group who make it to the Ranch, Jack's brother and sister, civilians with abilities that come in handy at the ranch, military men who drift into the Ranch, a group of the undead numbering in the hundreds of thousands, plans to meet survivors who made it out of Atlanta, a man named Hector and his group, death, destruction, a tank, the Leader of the marauders and Captain Scott Repp leading the way to protect what they have and stay alive.Five Stars and then some.

Damned good read. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what's in the book.This one starts with Marine Staff Sgt. Terrence Williams coming to after being in a wreck. His driver Graham is hanging above him still in his seat belt. Leverone the skinny PFC is behind him in the vehicle which is laying on it side.Williams and his men were on the way to Springfield, MA after leaving the Boston area where they were assigned. All of them decided they were fighting a losing battle for Boston with the anarchists and gangs who were fighting themselves and the military. Williams and his men decided to head for home to take care of their families.They were moving fast when they hit a barricade which caused their vehicle to land on its side.Williams has a concussion and back pain, Graham and Leverone are okay except for minor injuries. They all decide to see if they can get the vehicle upright. That's when Munson and his band of anarchists jump them.Williams is taken prisoner by Munson and Graham and Leverone are taken to a gym where other people are already prisoners there. These people are mostly women and children. Several people have been hung on an oak tree beside the school gym.Williams has done his best to save his men's lives by telling them about a depot that Muson and his men might want to raid. The depot contains food, arms and ammunition. Munson falls for the lies but keeps a close eye on Williams and makes sure his men at the gym contact him every five minutes leaving Williams no way to get at Munson without risking his men's lives.So begins one damned fine read.This one has Williams, Graham, Munson, Leverone, a teacher named Laura, a communist named Phyllis, a gym full of prisoners, a Williams who's doing his best to save his men, mens who's welfare is being held over his head,  and get home to his family, a Graham and Laura who come up with a plan, a Leverone who is badly beaten, a group of anarchist with guns who aren't quite as good as they think they are especially when facing real soldiers, a Williams who's in for one hell of a surprise when he finally makes it home and Williams and his men doing their best to stay alive and save the day.Five Stars.

Pretty Good read. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts in winter in a snow storm.Nick Agostine and his team, Jonesy, Achmed and Mac, on their way to Syracuse University. The mission is to procure manuscripts and info from old books. Anything that command thinks they can use to fight the dead.Nick was in the Army and did multiple tours of duty in Afghanistan.Six months after he got home the apocalypse happened and he was forced to kill his wife who ate his daughter. A wife who did her best to eat Nick. Nick was forced to kill her and it was the worst day of his life.The walking dead will do their best to eat anyone who is alive. The only way to kill them is with a head shot. If you are bitten or scratched you will become a walker.Nick is now an irregular Scout and his team is composed of military and civilians.His commander is a Colonel and Nick thinks he's an idiot who has no problem killing civilians.The Colonel can give orders to Nick and his Scouts but nothing says Nick has to obey his orders. Nick isn't the only one who dislikes the Colonel and his methods.Nick is separated from his team and ends up fighting for his life against the undead. A woman named Brit saves his life and joins he and the team as they head for home base. There are forts and bases set up all over NY in which Nick and his team can rest, take hot showers, get food and resupply but right now Home Base is where they need to go.So begins one pretty good read.This one has Nick, Brit, Mac, Jonesy, Achmed, the idiot Colonel, survivors, a prison, reavers, a new Lt., a medic named Mia, a Native American named Redshirt, the dead, men on horseback, a prison full of slaves, an attack on that prison, the Air Force, Choppers, bombs, death destruction, a Colonel who does his best to kill Nick and his team, revenge, Nick's safe house, a reporter and his cameraman, a plan to take back NY from the dead and NIck Agostine and his team doing their best to survive, stay alive kill the dead and take back NY.Five Stars

Another great read by Weber. Spoiler alert for those who don't want to know what the books about.This one starts with Colonel John Mack, a veteran of the Iraq war,  in Oneida. An Oneida that survived the battle with the Chinese. The Chinese who withdrew after suffering heavy casualties. Oneida is loaded with burned out vehicles and debris but survived.John is over by the pigeon coop. Carrier Pigeons that are used as messengers.  Pigeons that have been used for thousands of years. The last time they were used with success was in both WWI and WWII. They are now being used again for the very same reasons they have always been used. Who the hell even looks at pigeons?? Practically no one.Wilbur Powell is the man who owns the pigeons and he lets John know where the pigeons can be used and where they will home to. Its info John needs so he can get messages out to those who need to see them.Oneida is practicing strict radio silence so the carrier pigeons are a godsend. A way to get messages out without having to send a runner.  A runner who stood a very good chance of getting killed before he got to his destination with his message. Carrier pigeons would get there quicker and be ignored by most people. A win, win for John and his team.John is still heartbroken that he hasn't been able to rescue his son Gregory and he's getting ready for a mission to Y-12. Reese the sniper and Jerry Fowler the weatherman from Y-12 along with an armed escort will be heading to Y-12. John is now headed for the airport and the plane that will get them all to Y-12. He asks  Moss to let his wife Diana and daughter Emma that he'll be on a trip.Reese is armed with a Barrett M82 .50 caliber sniper rifle and has an M4 hanging from a two point sling. Reese is an expert marksman and often provides overwatch on missions. He's one capable guy and one John appreciates big time.General Demsey has assured them that once the reach Y-12, Oak Ridge, soldiers from the 3rd Infantry Division as well as scientist from the research facility would be there to greet them. After that is was a question of rigging the warhead to a balloon and sending it high into the atmosphere. A warhead that would send an EMP strike to the Chinese just like the one they sent to America.So begins another fine read by Weber.This one has John, Diana, Emma, Reese, Jerry Fowler the meteorologist, General Demsey, Billy Ray Bryant the pilot who turns out to be one hell of a fighter, Moss, Devon, Ray Gruber, the warhead that delivers the EMP strike, the Chines commander General Wei Liang who's based in Nashville, TN,, Americans being held in slave labor camps of which a captured Gregory and his friend Brandon are now part of, slaves who plant, tend and grow the food for the Chinese Army, slaves who are beaten and shot for any infraction, slaves who need a way out, a Col. Mack who comes up with a plan to get them out, an Army veteran named Dixon, a spy called Phoenix, guerilla warfare Col. Mack practices using horses, Diana and Emma finding a way to print leaflets to be dropped at the slave labor camp, General Brooks, a General Brooks who's more interested in looking good and stealing the thunder on all successful missions, a fact that Col. Mack could care less about, Col. Higgs and the rest of the Military staff, a raid on the labor camp, steam locomotives, UN troops, a battle royal between the US Army and the Chinese, a traitor no one would have ever suspected and Col. John Mack and his team beating the odds for life and liberty.Five Stars and then some.

I've used Brita water filters in the past. I enjoy and appreciate the idea, but not always the design. This pitcher is no different.It takes forever to filter water because of the capacity of the filtering section. I get it. I really do. I'd rather have more filtered water and less water in the process of filtering it - until it's time to fill up the pitcher. And since I (and the rest of my family) drink a LOT of water, we have to fill it at least twice in a day.I've learned that you do NOT press on the little lever to pour water. It doesn't work the way you'd expect. Just pour. No pressing. You'll have better results.It's definitely a space saving design. It's thin, lightweight, and small.I'd like to love this pitcher, so I can get my dad to stop buying cases and cases of ridiculously expensive bottled water, but this won't be the one that makes him stop.For the price point, it's not bad, but it looks like I'll have to save a long time for a Berkey in order to have lots of available water to filter and drink in a timely fashion. Then I'll still have to use a pitcher to chill the water in the fridge.You have to prime the filter before you can use it. That's normal. Oh, and you'll get charcoal inside the pitcher.So, again, the idea is great. It has great potential. Just not a great design.

I thoroughly enjoyed reading and responding to the words in this book.The author provides entertaining, and raw, stories from multiple perspectives of people who stepped out on faith and lived stories worth telling, including ones in which their families or friends didn't want them to tell.Each chapter presents new and challenging questions for you to think about and reflect on. It took me several days to read through this book because I decided to write out all of the questions (in Word) and answer them as well. Obviously that's what the author wants you to do but I'm guessing the majority of readers will NOT do.By the time you finish the book and answer the questions you'll be questioning your past and making challenging decisions about your future, so that you, too, may enjoy a story worth telling.Great read. Captured my attention and brought my faith to the forefront with insightful questions and ideas. I want to thank the author for writing this book.

My family has been using this tissue for a few weeks now.What we like:It's soft. Not as soft as either of the Charmin tissues we recently reviewed, but it's certainly soft.It's thick. Again, not as thick as Charmin, but it's thick enough for when you need the security of thick tissue.There's a lot! This is a huge box. Each pack hold 12 rolls and there are8 packs in the box.What I don't love:12 rolls in a pack. I live in an apartment and storage is at a premium. Storing a single pack of 12 isn't easy. Under the sink and it takes up a lot of space. In the linen closet and I have the same problem.  A smaller pack would be helpful. Keep in mind that they tell you upfront that there are 12 rolls in a pack, so it's not the company's fault, just something you may want to keep in mind.If you're unable to use Charmin because it's so think that it messes with your sewer system, this is a (little) less thick, (little) less soft alternative.

I've had some really good and really bad tweezers. This brand is right in the middle. The tweezers will actually cut the hair at the tip of the tweezers, but I have trouble getting them to pull the hair out. So the tweezers are sharp, but maybe too sharp since I can't use them to pull hairs from where they shouldn't be. I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I've been a regular user of Master Lock brand locks for years. My oldest started middle school this year and wanted a 2 pack so she would have the same combination for both her regular and gym lockers. She spend 2 days memorizing the codes until she was comfortable unlocking them quickly. Good quality, good product, and good idea to make 2 with the same code. Thanks Master Lock!

This pure lemon oil is great for use in a diffuser. It makes your home smell clean and fresh. Its a crisp scent and we love it. I received this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

Unfortunately it arrived with a hole in the lid so it was leaking upon arrival. The scent is so strong I had to move it clear across the room because I couldn't sleep. It definitely opens your sinuses, but the aroma isn't enjoyable. I received this item discounted or free in exchange for  a product review.

We use this brush for our maltese/shih tzu mix and our maltese/lhasa apso mix.  The brush is pretty, economical, and works well to keep their fur untangled. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my review.

I've long been a fan of wipes with the soft-sided packaging. At home I usually use the hard-sided cases, but for traveling or just being outside the home, the smaller soft-sided packages are just easier to use. They don't hold as many wipes, which makes them easier to travel with. Because they're soft-sided and smaller, they're easier to pack.These wipes are thick, absorbent, and clean well. Now that my girls are older, we don't use wipes to wipe bottoms, but they do come in handy to wipe hands and faces when soap and water and a washcloth aren't nearby. They're convenient. When I keep them in my car, I do put them inside a ziplock-type back to ensure they stay moist and don't dry out, since we don't use them quickly enough to use them before they'd go bad.I've used them to wipe up spills (fresh and old) in my vehicle, to clean my hands after a meal on the go, to clean faces after a bout of crying when a sink isn't nearby. They're good for cleaning counters, sinks, and toilets when you need a quick clean but when you don't want or need to use a spray. If you do have children you can also use them to clean the tables at the restaurant before you sit your child at the table.No complaints on quality or smell. Works well.

Steve Tobak's story is as interesting and varied as his leadership abilities and skills. His book provides several examples from his own life of how being different leads to opened doors and new opportunities.He really hones in on the point that you can't keep doing business the same way and expect new results, new customers, new relationships, and new opportunities. You have to be ready with new ideas, new ways of doing things, and new expectations. You also have to be prepared to fail.

I think this is the cutest little lunchbox with the 2 separate sections and a collapsible handle. My 11 year old wasn't keen on taking it to school for lunch at first, but it quickly became the one she grabbed.It has two stacking containers and a lock on the side which holds them together. The carrying handle is cleverly situated flush with the top until its time to use it.The kids have been in school for two weeks and one of the handles has already broken. At this point my daughter still uses it but she carries it inside a plastic grocery bag.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

My puppies are 3 and 8 pounds. I really didn't mean to purchase XL puppy training pads LOL!The girls have been using these pads for a few weeks now. Because they're so large we do not have to replace them as often. Having said that, they are made for larger dogs (not a problem). They're large enough that when I first put them out, the puppies decided to lay on them and there was PLENTY OF ROOM still available.They have not leaked a single time and they do not tear when the puppies start playing with them (I wish they'd stop already!). As it states in the product name, they're super absorbent. 2 puppies. 1 pad. Normally the puppies would win, but the pads got this one.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is my 3rd Sentey product and I truly enjoy the quality. While I use the in your ear ear buds when I'm out of the house, I like the larger ones for at home and so does my youngest daughter. So we were both excited about the opportunity to use these.They are well made. No quality issues.The headsets are soft and well-fitting for both my daughter and myself.I can hold a telephone conversation and I can also use them to listen to music or audio books. I can hear what I'm listening to and, in the case of a telephone call, the other party is able to hear me.I use them with an Android phone and my daughter uses them with her iPhone, so it's compatible with both device types.White's not my favorite color since they seem to attract dirt a little easier, but that's my problem, not theirs, since I purchased it knowing the color.The most surprising part is the price. Good headphones usually cost at least $50. These are good quality at a fraction of what someone would normally expect to pay.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I love Plant Therapy and I love this Spring Cleaning set. It wasn't spring when I purchased it, but that doesn't stop me from loving it. The 6 included essential oils are citrus burst, germ fighter, lavender, lemon, peppermint and tea tree. I was already familiar with PT's germ fighter since I purchased it individually for my family a few years back. While I'm familiar with the other oils, I haven't purchased the PT version of them before.The oils are packaged well enough to give as a gift without any additional fanfare. You don't need wrapping or tissue paper or even a gift bag if you didn't want to go through the trouble. It also comes with a list of several recipes, none of which I'd tried before. I was very excited about this.PT oils are pure and not pricey. When I was introduced to the brand I was intrigued because the review raved about the quality. I was expecting an unaffordable price that would be a splurge for me. Instead I was pleasantly surprised. It seemed as if the only purse oils being promoted were through MLM companies and their prices are jacked up so high that the average consumer would not be able to afford them. Not PT. They were the original company (in my opinion) that brought EOs to the masses.With pets and kids at home, I turn to EOs before I turn to chemical products. There are lots of recipes online which teach you how to incorporate EOs into your cleaning and health and this is a perfect set to help you get started.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Between myself and my daughters, extra stuff seems to just magically accumulate in my vehicle. I normally hang a plastic grocery bag on my shifter, although that's pretty lazy. Prior to that I would open the glove box, put a portion of the bag inside, then close the box so the bag was hanging out. It made for even more awkward conversation when someone was riding in my passenger seat.This bag, which I line with a plastic grocery bag, sits on the floor in front of the passenger seat. Surprisingly, it doesn't move around on the floor. When it gets full I simply discard the bag inside it and replace it with another one. Easy peasy. And my trash is no longer in my cupholder, the door pockets, or on the back seat floor. Well, there's still some on the backseat floor. That's still a work in progress. The girls are 9 and 11 in case you were wondering. Their bedrooms don't look much different than the back seat floor. Just sayin.If it gets dirty, just wipe it off or rinse it off if its that bad. It's waterproof too. I know this because my plastic grocery bag had a hole.I don't use the 2nd small bag that attaches to your vents because my vents are vertical instead of horizontal and its also a bit redundant. I could have used it for the back seat but there's NOTHING my kids need to throw away that's that small. All their trash is large.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

No home, auto, or office is complete without a basic first aid kit. I even carry a mini kit in my purse and laptop or backpack.The first thing you'll notice is the material of the carrying case. It feels like some kind of lightweight cardboard material as if its heavier than a brown paper bag but thinner than cardboard. The carrying handle and seams are stitched together. The material makes it pliable as opposed to stiff and a little more squeezable into tight spaces.The second thing you'll notice, which I was already aware of, is that when you purchase a first aid kit, the majority of the "pieces" in the 250 piece kit are assorted bandages. So the description breaks down as follows:12 alcohol prep pads. Expiration 11/201712 antiseptic towelettes. Expiration 04/20171 instant cold compress (large)1 tweezers (large, black, plastic). They don't seem like they'll be able to remove anything like a splinter, but I haven't tested them out yet.3 large safety pins3 antibiotic ointment. No expiration date3 burn cream ointment. Expiration 03/201810 non-aspirin. Expiration 05/201710 aspirin. Expiration 08/20173 insect sting relief pads. No expiration date.20 cotton tip applicators (2 packs of 10 each in a plastic zipper lock bag)2 finger splints (large popsicle sticks)50 adhesive bandages (1 1/2 x 3/8)20 adhesive bandages (1x3)75 adhesive bandages (3 x 3/4)12 butterfly closures1 paper tape roll6 sterile gauze pads (2x2)4 sterile gauze pads (4x4)1 sterile trauma pad (5x9)2 examination gloves (1 pair in plastic zipper lock bag)1 first aid guide.This is a (approx. 12x12) guide folded into 3rds and folded again which provides CPR instructions;  treatment information for commonish first aid incidents (bleeding, burns, drowning, electric shock, fainting, fractures, frost bite, gas poisoning, heat exhaustion, shock, stings, and sunstroke; and a place for you to write down important emergency phone numbers (ambulance, doctor, poison control, hospital, etc.). The back side has the same information in Spanish.I've counted twice and I come up with 251 items (maybe the guide shouldn't count?), but 145 are bandages - and 50 of those would only cover the smallest of cuts.The expiration dates are at least 1/5 years away, which is pretty good.The carrying case has a handle, is zippered, and is sturdy. It's also easy to identify as a first aid kit.There are both large pouches as well as small pockets. The large pouches hold all but the aspirin (and non), sting relief, burn cream, and antibiotic ointment.There is room in the kit to add a  FEW missing items like - scissors, children's medications, more exam gloves, a thermometer, additional OTC meds for diarrhea, allergies, and other stomach ailments), tissues, and hand sanitizer.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

My favorite team ever! And not just because I was a student there a long time ago...That's a lie! It's EXACTLY because I was a student there a long time ago!On to the cups:They're a good size - since they're 18 ounces they will hold a full 16 ounces with a few ice cubes. I like that. I drink a lot of water, but they'll work with beer and sodas as well.They're sturdy. Although they're disposable cups, they are not flimsy. You don't have to be afraid that you'll grip them too tightly so they'll collapse and spill. Not gonna happen.They're reusable. I don't use the dishwasher so I can't comment on that, but I can wash them by hand and not a single one tore. I did not pull the one cup my oldest daughter put in the bathroom trash. Why was there a cup in the bathroom trash? I didn't even ask.They represent my favorite team - and Hefty doesn't make them for Ohio State. LOVE THAT!They were perfect for Thursday's game against Utah (and they held up better than our football team) and will be perfect for the rest of the season. I've already told my daughters GAME. DAY. ONLY.

I thought I would get this in anticipation of Halloween. I don't think it will last that long. Not because there's not enough paint, but because my daughters spend their weekends taking turns painting each other and the other kids in the neighborhood. None of us are as artistic as the people who drew on the kids' faces in the product photos, but that hardly matters. It's the fact that its Face. Paint.Hours of entertainment. Hours of fun. Hours of experimenting. Hours of creativity.You do have to add water. My girls did it by putting a few drops in each circle. You could also dip the paintbrush in water instead. If the paint doesn't seem to glide right on, add more water. I found it easier to get the paint on the brush by running the brush near the outer edges since that's where the water seems to collect. You can mix the colors to make new ones.I wasn't sure, but it does wash off easily. I just tell my kids to wash their faces well in the shower and they come out clean.Very good product. The paint lasts and doesn't crack if you apply it right.Disclosure: I received this free in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

This Radha tea tree oil comes in a generous 4 ounce glass bottle. Although it arrives with a screw on cap, you can easily change that out for a dropper top instead. The bottle is a gorgeous blue color.Tea tree oil is handy to use around the house especially for cleaning the kitchen, bathrooms, and laundry. I use it to scent my dryer balls. I switch the scent out with lavender and lemon. I use it in the kitchen and bathroom with both commercial and DIY cleaners to add that extra cleaning and disinfecting power. Although I've tried it in a diffuser, it's not my favorite scent, and since I have many to choose from, this one has moved towards the bottom of the list. I like it for its cleaning abilities, and I associate its smell with clean, but I'm leaning more towards peppermint, lavender, and lemon for the diffuser.The product is pure and natural and smells just like the other tea tree oil products I have and use.I'm looking forward to reusing this bottle once the product is completely used up.Disclosure: I received this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

The travel containers for your pets are well made, durable, and collapsible. The containers hold a few cuts of water or food for use when away from home, and store easily when not in use. They are also easy to clean.What I didn't expect was they aren't really made for the tiny dogs or puppies. I have a 2 month old and a 4 month old. One weighs just a few pounds while the other weighs 8. The bowls are a perfect height for the 8 pound dog but too large for the 2 pound puppy. Based on the picture I expected it to fit a smaller dog, which it does not.Good product though.Disclosure: I received the product free in exchange for an honest review.

Surprisingly, both of our girls LOVE this! I wasn't sure what to expect since they are only 4 months and 8 weeks old. They've stopped eating their old food completely. I like that it has no grains and no fillers. I don't it's more expensive than other natural dog or puppy foods; the price is right in line with them.As soon as I come up with a recipe we'll  go to raw, but this is a good kibble in the meantime.

My daughter loves this. My 11 year old daughter loves all things coffee, so she could not wait to try this in the aromatherapy diffuser. Could not wait. And then there's me - the not so coffee lover. I don't drink coffee. Never will. Buy my 11 year old? Ugh! I hope she doesn't start the habit.Anyway, she woke up last Sunday morning and added several drops to the diffuser. My aunt woke up, went straight to the bathroom to shower and get dressed (she was visiting overnight). She came out and was looking for the coffee. She really truly thought we made her a pot of coffee. Good thing I have a Keurig.Smells just like the real stuff. As usual, great quality from Plant Therapy. Customer for life, especially since they helped my daughter trick my auntie.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

At the end of a long day - or long week - sometimes all you want to do is chill. In the bathtub. With the door closed. And no kids knocking. Or screaming. Or Existing. On the other side of the door. With a good book (or kindle), some music, candles, and some nice bath salts.This is it right here. They're natural, light, and it feels so good to run them through your fingers until they dissolve completely in the hot water. With the sensual and scents of Ylang Ylang, Jasmine, and Lavender Oil to take you right out of your real life and into your fantasy world. For just a few minutes. It helps you zone out until the water runs cool. Then let that water out and fill up the tub some more. Then climb out when your all wrinkly, dry off, then go straight to bed. Clothes optional.Perfect.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

We have a Keurig b48 Elite brewer for occasional use. In addition to using the pods, we want to be able to brew our own tea and coffee.The reusable pod fits into the dispenser with no issues. It makes both coffee and tea quickly and easily. With the coffee you just have to measure out the right amount of pods for your preferred strength, and then REMEMBER how much you use. Once you've got that all figured out, you're good to go. With tea, you can use a prefilled tea bag or loose leaf tea. I use both. I like to make sweet tea (hot) then cook it down with ice. Then I'll add a mint leaf or two (delicious!). Soon I'll try hot cocoa but not til the weather is cooler. Rinse the pod well, and reuse. The loose grounds or loose leaf tea can get caught in the sides, but that can happen with any reusable filter, so it's not a deal breaker for me.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

My daughter has an iPhone 5c and goes through charging cables quickly. Not necessarily her fault since she traveled a lot of the summer, but still. So it's nice to have extra cables for when you realized you lost another one. Plus, with school starting and the school allowing the kids to carry electronics as long as it doesn't interfere with class, having a charging cable in her backpack is super handy. Also, cables wear out.I like the length. Easier to find and easier to find a plug that you don't have to be sitting on the floor in order to both charge your phone and use it at the same time. Between the length of the cable and that fact that it charges well without any connectivity issues, I would recommend it to someone who is looking for an extra cord for their newer Apple device.Disclosure: I received a discounted product in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

I have sensitive skin and I'm not a regular makeup wearer, but I do like to look nice for special occasions. And, one of my bloggy friends sells an MLM product called Younique that costs $30. For my limited use, that price doesn't make sense for me. At $21.99 this makes better sense - as long as it works. While I can't specifically compare them, I can tell you that it works pretty well once you get the hang of it.With regular mascara, you simply prime the wand a few times inside the tube, then apply.With this, there's multiple wands and multiple steps. Apply the gel first. It's clear. You can feel it going on but you can't really see it. Next you apply the fibers. This is the weird part because it's leaving actual fibers on your lashes AND because you don't apply it all the way to the base of your lashes. That's something I'm NOT used to doing - starting halfway. Then the last step is to use the gel again to lock in the fibers. After that you're supposed to separate your lashes but I don't have an eyelash comb.I like it. It's a bit overdone for me. It doesn't look natural, but it doesn't look like you layered on 10 gobs of gook either. Make sure you have the extra time to let it all dry. Surprisingly, like I said earlier, it doesn't irritate my sensitive and allergy prone eyes, which is a huge plus. Plus, its a less expensive alternative than those other brands.It takes a little longer to dry because it's thicker - which is also the point - that your lashes look longer and thicker.Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

I started using this product about a month ago. I use the Retinol serum in conjunction with Hyaluronic acid and Vitamin C serum. This is my favorite of the 3 products, but when combined together my face is not too oily nor too dry. 2 ounces is enough product that I don't think it will go bad before I've finished using it, but not so little that I feel like I'm buying it all the time. I probably have about 1/2 of the bottle left with once per day use.The pump makes it easy to use and I use a squirt at a time. I do rub it from my forehead down to between my boobs - don't want no wrinkles down there and I don't want to skip my neck. It absorbs quickly. Well before I leave the house my face is complete.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

I'm not an espresso drinker. I'm not a cappuccino drinker. I'm not even a coffee drinker.But my dad drinks all 3. So when he asked if he could move in with us and this opportunity came along, I took a chance.It was well worth it.My observations: This machine is sturdy, looks GOEGEOUS on my counter (although its kinda big for my kitchen), and is easy to wipe down. You simply take a wet cloth and wipe down all you can see (and can't see behind the machine) (in addition to cleaning the inside every so often). I was concerned about milk spoiling. Not to worry, you simply remove the milk carafe/container and place it in the fridge. Also, it doesn't need to be full to make the frothy part, so if you don't use the machine too often, you won't waste milk by trying to keep the container full.My dad's observations: He used to own restaurants and he said his last machine cost about $13k. This doesn't come close to that cost (although it's still expensive in my opinion). He said it's a solid value for the price point, and that it has a great presentation for your home kitchen.  He said depending upon if you're familiar with how to use such a machine, that the results are pretty comparable to what you'd get in a restaurant whose main business is NOT coffee. But if you're used to multiple options from a real coffee house, this will not compare.You will have to set up and prime the machine before you start, so this is not INSTANT coffee, but once you get used to it, you'll feel like a pro and your visitors will think you're one too.He said there are more options than he ever used on his restaurant machine, but the employees may have used more than he did.  But if you have the time and inclination (and follow the detailed instructions) you can get an after dinner drink that's highly enjoyable, and truly customizable. It can be overwhelming at first, especially if this is your first introduction, since the company that sold him the machine for his restaurant provided detailed training. If you're not used to this type of machine OR if it's not something you'll use frequently (at least several times each week), it's probably not a good choice, and you should find something at a lower price point; there's no point in having a fancy, but costly, machine that you won't take the time to learn to use.

I have this generator for those times when the power goes out.  Living in North Carolina, there is always a chance that a storm may come inland and knock the power out for a few days.  I dont really know much about generators, but this one became available, so I jumped at the chance to get one.If you are sitting next to it while running, its loud. You dont want to sit next to a generator for a long period of time anyways, so if you leave it outside and run an extension cord inside youll barely hear it in the house.Its about 100 lbs, so not very easy for me and my friend to move on our own, but the once the wheels were put on it moves around much easier.  It easily fit in the bed of her small pickup truck (once we were able to lift it up there.  We are not very muscular individuals) so we know wed be able to take it camping with us.It seems like it would be something that would be great to take camping, but the noise will be a bit of a deterrent to keeping it too close to the campsite (ruining the whole nature vibe), but if you really need electricity you could do a lot worse.I havent really run it much, more of just a turn it on to make sure it works kind of thing, but it seems to run well, and started right up the first time we tried.  As Ive mentioned, my friend and I are not very strong people, so if we can get it to turn first try, it is nice and easy.

I've been using essential oils for almost 20 years. I believe in their benefits, although I do take OTC and prescription medications when I need to do so. But my preference is to use more natural remedies before I resort to those.I'm excited that lesser known companies are stepping up and bringing less expensive remedies to the marketplace so more people who previously could not afford to do so can enjoy the benefits of essential oils.I've been using this best Health Shield product all over the house. I use it in a spray bottle of vinegar to spray the door knobs (on both sides of the doors) weekly. It allows me to keep germs and sickness away by cleaning the surfaces we touch most often. I use it in a diffuser in the hallway and living room to help clean and clear the air as we walk through the main areas of our home. I use it in our all-purpose cleaning spray to add an extra layer of uumph while we're cleaning, especially on the kitchen table and sink, and bathroom sinks and toilets. I use it inside the toilet paper rolls because I love the scent. At work, I use jojoba oil instead of lotion and I've poured about 10 drops in the 3 ounces I have left and I simply shake it before each use. This allows me to moisturize my hands but keep them clean without resorting to chemical hand sanitizers that my co-workers are so fond of (although I keep telling them how harmful it will be as they get older and need the protection).This is the best time to start protecting your family from germs as the weather starts to turn and we head back to school. As suggested in a previous review I will put a drop on the soles of our feet each day (or night, depending upon when we shower) so that we're ready to face the germs.And it doesn't hurt that this combination of oils smells delightful and refreshing and uplifting. It's a great addition to our natural medicine chest.I like that it has the same or similar ingredients to the Young Living Thieves Oil. Although there are many recipes for thieves oil, I believe that all of the oils in this brand are beneficial for fighting germs, infections, fungus, and bacteria (Cinnamon, Clove, Eucalyptus, Lemon and Rosemary).Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I thought this would be fun to buy for my daughters. It's more liquid-y than I expected, but that's not an issue at all. The spray come out of the bottle nicely and easily with no clogging issues.You can run it into your skin and your hair. You do have to use a generous amount if you want it to last all day, but even with that this bottle will last several months.It's glittery, pretty, sparkly and its not thick or irritating to your skin. It's certainly fun to wear!Disclosure: I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

I didn't catch that this product was geared towards men when I ordered it, but once I did realize that I gave it to a guy friend of mine. He eagerly accepted it. Grooming is definitely important to him. He said the moisturizer works well, and doesn't leave his face shiny. He said that it doesn't have an unpleasant odor. He likes that the packaging is black because it definitely makes it feel like it's for a man and he's comfortable leaving it on his bathroom counter. He said he'd buy this at full price once this tube runs out. Lastly, he's been into using more natural products so the fact that it states all-natural made him want to see if it works better than others. He's not sure that it works better than others, but he feels like it works at least the same as other products, but without unnecessary chemicals, so that makes it a winner.Disclosure: I received this item free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Oh, I decided that I liked the smell immediately after opening the bottle. Not too strong, but definitely "manly". I gave it to a (male) friend who also said he likes the smell and who, while he rarely grows a full beard, uses it on unshaved facial hair that's only been growing for a few days. He said he likes the smell and moisturizing qualities so much that he also uses it on unshaved skin.The container is a 2 ounce amber glass bottle with an opening designed to keep the product in the bottle until you give it a little shake into your hand. Rub the oil into the palms of your hands then use a wiping motion to apply to your face or beard.Disclosure: I received this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

I was not sure of the effects of enzymes. However, I was sure that it would have something to do with breaking down the foods and or other things that the body would have a hard time digesting.  This was becoming a slight problem in this particular area for me.  After a few days of using Vita Pure Advance Digestive Enzymes, I experienced less bloating, heartburn and feeling stuff after each meal.  Not only did I feel much lighter, not stuffed, but it seemed like my energy level was beginning to rise.  So instead of falling to sleep after meals, I did other activities like, cleaning, washing clothes and watching an entire movie.  I definitely will take the use of enzymes more serious, as it does affect many areas of my life.Disclosure: I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

This is an interesting little candle. You light it until you have a layer of melted was across the entire top layer of the container. Once that happens you can blow out the candle. After that, pour out the candle and massage onto your partners skin. At first you're a bit fearful of the heat from the candle, but it's somehow specially formulated to be just hot enough to melt and pour but not so hot that you burn yourself or your partner. The scent is a mixture of peppermint, eucalyptus, and basil, but it's not overpowering especially when you consider its intended use. It's subtle. It doesn't leave a waxy feel to your skin when you use it.Disclosure: I received this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

Majestic Pure delivers again. I use essential oils almost daily if not every day and I use them in cleaning, homemade soap products, and for diffusing into the air.  This frankincense has a gentle, purifying smell. I've added it to cleaning solution when cleaning the counters and tables, to the diffuser during the evening when I'm looking for calm, and I'm trying to figure out a way to combine it with myrrh for the holiday season this year.The product comes in a 4 ounce amber bottle with a screw on lid and a dropper lid. The dropper lid makes it easy to use the exact amount you need. There's a 2 year shelf life on this product. The date is listed on the outside of the box before you open the product.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

This is part 1 of a 3 part skin care system.First you use the hyalauronic acid serum in the clear bottle. It helps to restore the hyaluronic acid your body used to make but slowly stopped producing as you got older. Next you use the Retinol in the blue bottle. Last you use the Vitamin C product in the green bottle. When you're using this combination you no longer need any other skin care products! And use this twice each day (assuming you have a pre-bed routine). Don't forget to use each product on your neck.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

Beauty Aura products are quality oils. They're pure and natural and work well on your skin. I've used on my hair as a pre-shampoo and post-conditioner moisturizer and on my skin. It's light and gets absorbed easily.Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review.

I've been seeing these windshield sun shades for years, but didn't think they really worked. I mean, really? But why would so many people use them so religiously if they didn't. So I thought I'd give it a try.I live in Charlotte, NC and while it's not as hot as it was in Columbia, SC it's still really hot. I mean it was almost 100 degrees for an entire week and that was just June!I've been using this windshield sun shade for several weeks when I get to work. Normally my car is so hot when I get back in it at the end of the day. Not after using this. It's so weird but it works. My car isn't as hot and I don't have to run the air almost all the way to the freeway before it starts to cool off. Now it's starts to cool off before i even leave the parking lot. That's a different of about 3 to 5 minutes. It doesn't seem like a long time but it is when its in the 90s outside, you're leaving work, and the last think you want to do is fight traffic and the heat at the same time.The only part I hate is the size. I get that you can't make it any smaller, but it's just annoying to fold up and place in the backseat if you have people in your back seat or in the trunk every time you go to get back in the car.Disclosure: I received this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

This is the second Elrique toner I've used recently. I love that it contains Vitamin C and other natural ingredients. I expected it to make my sensitive skin dry, but it doesn't do that at all. I spray a light mist directly onto my face (with my eyes closed) and it dries shortly after application. I follow up this toner with a light moisturizer and go about my day. This product helsp keep my skin glowing and fresh-looking, and dare I say, young looking.Disclosure: I received this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased product review.

I prefer Continental 32-36mm touring tubes for my 32mm Ribmo tires and bought this one as an alternative. Might be ok if you used 25 to 28mm tires but didn't last long for me. But then I'm a heavy commuter rider and am tough on my gear.

They put a ping pong table in my office and my desk is behind the wall! So to keep people from body slamming the wall, I bought this and another ping pong poster to put on the wall. Worked too!  A little smaller than I wanted but the price was right.

They put a ping pong table in my office and my desk is behind the wall! So to keep people from body slamming the wall, I bought this and another ping pong poster to put on the wall. Worked too!  A little smaller than I wanted but the price was right.
Now that I have a smart phone, I use the GPS on that, and "Don't Panic" software which I think is "Tom Tom". So this is no longer used. After all why bring two gadgets on a trip when one will do?

Yes they don't have as much pull power as the red bands but who cares? I'm just plinking with rocks, not hunting rabbits. These bands were a perfect fit/replacement for the originals which had rotted away.
Seriously, my kid was wasting 1/2 the strawberry using a knife to cut off the leaves so I bought them this tool. Then I started using it and now I no longer use a knife to hull strawberries.

Minoura engineers have the clamp figured out. It totally adjusts for a wide range of handlebar sizes. It's not really a clamp and release mechanism because to hold a full waterbottle you need to first get it close, clamp it, then tighten the hex head nut. Then it won't move. But no other clamp I've seen has been designed this well.Minoura also makes an offset version so if you want the bottle mounted midpoint for your handlebars, look for that. Same price, same clamp style.
I like the all stainless version of this grater. It works great! and I own all three sizes. Wonderful tool, stays sharp if you don't run it through the dishwasher.

Or one like it. I got this one because it folds down as I only build a wheel once every 4 months or so. I've got the full Park T2 Jig and even so, needed this tool to make sure that the rim was centered over the hub.

We've dropped the phone a number of times and it's survived in this case. (all by accident, I'm not actually trying to test that part out.) I had a defender case and it's too bulky so moved to the commuter case and it seems to work well enough.

Javascript, the language that should have been a lot better. Fortunately there are enough good parts to make it workable but ugh. This book will keep you from making those terrible mistakes that allow hackers to take over your web pages.
I've got all three sizes and I love them. They are the first tool I go to in the kitchen when I want to grate something up.

I've been using KMC chains for a while and this is the first time I've broken the master link. So it may be just a manufacturing defect so a 4 star vs a 5 star rating. Still beats those replaceable pins for Shimano chains.Update: I have since broken the master link again only another 500 miles later. It may be that the Shimano chain has too much play but I was using these master links and they were holding up with KMC chains and now this package of 10 is cr*p.Recommendation: Buy another brand.

I wanted an alternative input device for my phone when I had it hooked up to a monitor for a larger display. This, plus a stand, and a blue tooth mouse, and an HDMI cable and I've got portable computing in a very small package.Connected to the phone with no trouble at all. Key board is big enough for my large fingers and has a nice feel to it.
I'm not an audiophile so I can't tell you whether this recording is one of their best, but I liked the collection of songs and am happy I bought this CD.

Although the non skid tape on the top of the bottom piece is peeling up. That doesn't really matter all that much as the angle of the holder keeps my phone in place. I use this on my desk with a blue tooth keyboard and blue tooth mouse and a HDMI cable from my phone to my monitor to have a portable computer set up.

It's not super secure, as it's soft everywhere, but inside of my shoulder bag it works to keep the keyboard from being wrecked by the other things in the bag and it's light enough to not notice it on my shoulder.

With HDR it's very helpful to hold your camera very steady. With this gadget and a tripod and my BBRY phone, I was able to take some great shots. In fact some of them came out better than the ones I took using a DSLR. (Sony a55)  Definitely useful gadget for low light conditions. Now if my phone camera only had a timer, I could do better selfies and group shots. But maybe early next year when BBRY releases 10.3.x.x OS.

These are the genuine part. If you buy a cable from Shimano it should come with one of the right size cap. But heaven help you if you drop it, the buggers are small and run off and hide. Having a package of 100 means you can search for it but it isn't the end of the world if you can't find it. (Or if you need to adjust the cable and the end cap falls off. It's easier to put a new one one than reopen the old one and resqueeze it back in place. A small wire brad nail and some patience and it can be done, but seriously my time is worth more than that and the second squeeze usually cracks the end cap. Third squeeze is right out.Recommended. Only a little more expensive than the smaller package but you get a near life time supply for the home repair person.

You may find that if you are using the thinnest tubes, you can't really patch them with any patch, but I'm running the thicker commuter tubes from Continental and these patches hold on very well. I've gone through several tires with one patched tube and each time it's leaked, it was from some other thing poking a hole in the tire, not the patch failing.Be sure to sand the tube, the surface has a material on it designed to keep it from sticking to the tube mold. You need to scuff that off before putting on the vulcanizing fluid.  Then be sure to let it get tacky before applying the patch. Go ahead leave the clear bit of cellophane on the patch, it won't hurt anything and it helps keep the patch from peeling back off if you try to remove it before the patch is 100% adhered.Recommended, but carry a spare tube anyway, unless you like to walk, as some flats are not repairable.

I have a frame fit pump (Zephal HP-X) and it fell out of position with just one velcro strap holding it in place. It spent enough time between my frame and the front gears to grind up the end bits of plastic which I had to order replacements from France. (Zephal's website) So to prevent that from happening again, I bought this pump holder and it's working great.

Lost the original stylus so set out to find a decent replacement. Am very glad I bought these as they are as good if not better than the original. (Which I found after these arrived. oh well, now I have extras.)

I've read several of Mr. Egan's other books and each one gets better and better written. I only knew some of the trivial stuff about Edward Curtis and now I feel like I could carry on a dinner party conversation about him with any photographic historian.We clearly all owe a huge debt to Mr. Curtis for his single minded pursuit of "The North American Indian." Now if that book were only available as a reprint...sigh.  Mr. Curtis clearly knew that time was running out to gather this material and spent his life doing his best to get it at great personal cost, his fortune, his marriage and all of the joys of being a parent to young children. For us, it was worth it, for him, there was no other choice he was driven to it.May we all find a pursuit that drives us to the same level of excellence.Highly Recommended

I love books which detail what life was like when and this book rates right up there. My understanding is that it was written yeas after the fact but it reads like it was written as it happened. I have yet to find the definitive book on WW1 that compares with Slade's In with the old Breed" a first person account from WW2. But this book comes close. However alot of the book details the young life of Mr. Libby. And as such it's a great read just the stories from his boyhood are worth the time.Some people are downgrading the rating because he doesn't cover in detail his WW1 flying and the fighting but it might be because those memories were extremely painful. And by the time he wrote it, WW2 had come and gone and it made WW1 seem all that more senseless.Still highly recommended.

I was a 60's kid and remember when Nixon was forced out of office for Watergate. This movie is a trip back in time. What is amazing is both watching people of my generation in the crowds and the reactions to Nixon working the crowd. It's also interesting listening to the tapes which are played as voice over on some of the film. (With subtitles so you can understand it.)Now of course looking back, he wasn't as bad as certain other more recent presidents who got us into undeclared wars, started us on this massive debt spending etc etc.. And the bits with Daniel Ellsburg and Nixon's reaction remind me of Edward Snowdon. The film doesn't go into how a guy who campaigned on getting the USA out of Vietnam could let the war drag on for another 5 years. Nor does it cover his "war on drugs" which is on the tapes as being a way to disrupt the liberal left and the black leaders by arresting them on drug charges.  It also doesn't cover his creation of HMO's and part of the reason health care is still as messed up as it is now. (See Sicko [HD] which has those tape clips in it.)This film is home clips with the tapes and it's great. It's like looking at movies of your own family if you happened to have a dad who was president of the USA.I also can't get that opening song out my head either... Tracy Ulman's "They Don't know about ..."Still a complex man done in by an act of unnecessary criminality, he would have won in 1972 without the dirty tricks. Although it might have been different if Muskie wasn't eliminated early and that was one of the things CREEP worked on.

Also remember that the Post office sends images from processing the address when they scan it to apply the bar code to the envelop to the NSA.  So remember to mail it from somewhere else!And didn't "Breaking bad" cover how to get rid of a body?

I had the previous STI Shimano 105 shifter and it broke. So rather than look for a used or older but new in the box I opted to replace the right shifter (back derailer) through my local bike shop.First off the design changed in the routing of the brake cable that hasn't been a problem, the shift cable on the other hand eats the cables. I'm replacing it every 1.5k miles. Although I do a lot of shifting, it's the design of these shifters that is the problem. When you thread the cable through the housing you have to be super careful not to kink the cable and there is this tiny bit of plastic that covers the shifting mechanism that you need to remove to get at the entrance for threading. This plastic bit is fragile, while I haven't broken it yet, it's time is surely short. It's just a terrible design, should have had a screw to hold it in place vs the snap tabs.Lastly without the cable coming off to the side, the hood slides around. Yes I am a strong rider but it seems like every ride I spend some time while riding trying to drag the rubber hood back into position. It's again a stupid design. Thirdly the opening on the inside of the housing isn't covered well by the rubber hood leaving places to rub your fingers as you shift. So far I haven't pinched myself but then I wear long fingered gloves nearly year round.When this shifter breaks I won't be replacing it with this identical model.

1.4 amps vs 0.8 amps of the standard charger. Nice if you are running a bunch of power hog apps like music & mapping & hotspot all at the same time. Plus it charges your battery a bit faster. And it has an extra port for those who have custom usb to device cables....that's you APPL fans.1 star off because BBRY should have shipped this with the phone.

If you buy the speaker and want to pack it around in a case vs just wrapping it in some flannel and tossing it in a ziploc bag, this is the case for you. I only gave it 4 stars because a) it should have come with the speaker, b) it's expensive for what it is.  However it does fit exactly and has a separate pouch for the charger and the elastic closer is cool. So some allowances for cool design should be reflected in the cost. (as well as the limited production run....)

I bought this as a gift for someone who has an iphone and an ipod touch (version 2) It works well with both devices, but not at the same time of course! In testing I get a range of about 30ft before the sound starts to break up, so you can position each device quite a ways apart and still have it work.I am not an audiophile, in fact I'm pretty tone deaf so you'll have to take other reviewers word for the sound quality, however if I was a living in an apartment and wanted a compact setup to play music you'd be hard pressed to find a more compact setup and quality package than an ipod and this speaker. (Or your phone) the only drawback to using the phone is that there is some power drain when playing music. The ipod seems to last about 2 hrs before the battery gave out and I have to plug the ipod in. However with the distance those two devices communicate it's no trouble to do that.Build quality does appear to be good. The case feels solid. It's heavy no doubt due to the battery and speaker magnets. The battery is replaceable but it's in a "Boise" special package which no doubt will be higher than an off the shelf garden variety battery, but that's life in the portable electronics world. At least you CAN replace it.I have a BBRY Z10 phone and the bluetooth connection worked well with that. (being curious I just tested it, and reset it afterwards.) The Z10 battery monitor seemed to indicate that it could pump out the music for about 5 hrs... but I didn't test that.As others have mentioned, with Apple and others changing their ports with each release of their product it's probably best to pick a speaker that uses Bluetooth or a usb-mini port (this speaker has both) And while Bluetooth standards change at least those standards are multi-industry.On volume, yep pretty loud, not ear drum shattering but plenty for inside a house, or out on the deck. You can control the volume from your bluetooth device and the speaker itself. (very handy)I suspect but have not tested this yet that with a bluetooth transmitter on my old stereo/amp/AM/FM receiver I could use that to transmit the music wirelessly to the deck. The beauty of that system is that the speaker can come in for the night and stay out of the rain vs buying/wiring outside speakers. It wouldn't be stereo unless I put two transmitters in... but hey it's the deck who is really paying attention to that?Pro:CompactWorks with my bluetooth devicesReplaceable batteryCharger folds flat, (the prongs fold into the unit)Seemed to reconnect to the same device after powering both off without having to do the full setup. (not fully tested though, and it is easy to connect devices.)Con:Custom battery package.charger is not a usb design, so you can't use your phone charger to charge the speaker. (seems dumb, but hey maybe phone chargers don't put out enough Amps.)Need to buy a second item, the nylon case if you want to transport it. I suppose they could have included it but if you didn't take it away from your home you wouldn't really need that.Recommended: buy. especially vs those docking station speakers.

I bought this clip for my office Nerf wars. There are others with disk shooters so I needed to be able to return fire with the ammo on the floor around me. This clip holds 10 disks which the right amount when you've run out to scurry around and refill during a "battle."Disk guns in general aren't very accurate, nor do the disks fly far, but if you need a clip to hold extra ammo this is your ticket.
Nice map. I like these maps printed on a "waterproof" paper and even though Santa Fe is in the desert, I ended up being there during 3 days of rain and this map held up great.

These darts are the best for a home made blow gun. Use normal 1/2"x10ft water PVC pipe (it's white and cost around three smaker-os.) cut the pipe into thirds, file the edges smooth and use these darts with a good set of lungs for the most accurate, farthest flying least expensive, longest lasting Nerf gun. Best value ever. Once you get good at it, you can reload and fire faster than any of those automatic reloading guns that Nerf sells. My aim at 40ft is a 6" grouping. With in 3 shots I can hit and knock a soda can off a cubical wall at 40ft. (the variability is that flat fronted foam darts will veer a bit.)I highly recommend these darts and the blow pipe for hours of fun.

Beats buying the direct replacements from Nintendo. Last set lasted 3 years so that's not too bad.The strap interferes with the charger so you would have thought they would put a grove in the base for the strap to sit in... but no. So it's trickier than it needs to be to get them to recharge.

I bought this to return the disks shot at me by my fellow office mates using Nerf Vortex Proton Blasters (a single shot nerf gun). I like that it's easy to reload the clip, that you can buy extra clips (although I wanted to buy the big 40 disk clip which comes with a nerf Pyrogon... they don't sell the clip alone).Pros:Stores in my file drawer easily with the shoulder mount unclipped.Fast clip replacement.Easy reload of clipsYou can buy spare 10 shot clipsWith this reasonable amount of ammo you can keep them hopping while they search for more ammo off the floor.Medium:Range is ok, maybe 40ft max.Cons:Accuracy is poor as a flying disk has a tendency to veer off like a frisbee does.2 in 10 shots leave the barrel with a flying wobble that makes it drop within 10 feet. Unknown reason why.No slam fire, only single fire mode, ie. pump, shoot, release trigger, pump.I rate most Nerf toys against using a 1/2" x 3ft PVC pipe and some Nerf suction darts which have a range of 60ft and I can knock a soda can off the cubical wall at 40ft within 3 shots. (slight variation as they fly, grouping is 6" at 40ft.)In general it's fun, and probably the right price/fun ratio of the disk shooting Nerf toys.

After breaking nearly every Nerf gun/toy I've ever owned I went looking for something that would be fun and hold up to abuse and lots of play time that's when I discovered PVC water pipe and Nerf darts. The PVC pipe is inexpensive, you get 10ft for about three dollars. Cut it in thirds, with a hacksaw, file the ends smooth. Now you have a blow gun that won't break unless you run over it with a car. I can shoot with precision nerf mega darts about 50ft. Some of my friends get 75, depends how good your lungs are.Also these darts work well with Barnett Bandit Toy Crossbow. The darts that come with that crossbow are not good for playing as they are hard plastic and will shatter if they hit something hard. These Nerf darts work well though.

I bought mine to go with the Pro Tool Industries 284 Woodman's Pal Military Premium Fixed Blade Knife as it doesn't come with a sheath. It does the job well, repels rain, hold the blade tight, yet is easy to hang on your belt when walking through the woods. You may prefer the nylon sheath, I like this one better.

When running the navigation software, "Don't Panic!" it's a power hog, you need to have the phone plugged in. This holder makes the BB Z-10 into a great in car navigation system. With "Don't Panic!" which pre-loads the maps, you don't need internet connectivity to navigate. I don't have a blue tooth headsets, so I haven't tried in car phone calls but I've heard reports that it works well.On the IBOLT dock, holds the phone securely to my windshield yet it's easy to pop out when you get to your destination. The power cord comes with a loop of velcro so even though it's longer than I need, I have it looped up and secured out of the way.Recommendation: Buy if you plan on using any of the navigation apps on your phone.

Like other reviewers, I had trouble with the built in screen protector. It has too big a cutout for the front camera. I tried putting an iSmooth screen proctor under it, but the dual layer gave me trouble swiping the screen to get apps to iconize. So after a couple of days, I just popped the Otterbox screen protector out, leaving the iSmooth protector in place and it works better. I still suspect that there is a bug in the BBRY OS (I'm using a 10.0.9.422, and it's better than the previous release) that makes swiping not work perfectly.On the Otterbox, it's bulkier than the "Commuter" series, but then Otterbox doesn't offer a "Commuter" version for the Z-10 yet. I'd prefer a less bulky case as while I can be hard on phones, I'm trying to take good care of this one, and the bulky case actually makes it harder to use, ie get in and out of my pocket. I also hate holster holders so that's still in the drawer at home.So I'm giving this a qualified 4 stars, as it it could be better, but some of the failings are not of the Defender series, except the screen protector but of the lack of Otterbox alternatives.I got this case as part of a package deal from my phone company, along with the iSmooth screen protectors so shop around before you buy it here.

I wear out a set of cogs every 5K or so (3 chains worth) so I don't really care if I have the lightest set around. These seem to last as long as the more expensive Ultegra set but I'm trying to keep the costs down so I picked these over the next upgrade. Don't seem to make any difference in shifting, coasting, or weight that matters. yes rotating weight makes a difference for racers, but for the rest of us, durability and cost are more important.

The clamp on this thing won't fit the drop bars on my bike. I wish Crane made one that fit those bars, and there does appear to be one that fits the stem as a spacer but this one doesn't work. And to boot, the bolt is stamped in place so I can't unscrew it and mount it on the bolt that on my stem bar. (a way worse bell.)What's great about this bell is the ringer. It's easy to hit even with gloves on. The sound is loud and distinctive, good for warning pedestrians of your presence.Recommendation: Great Bell, but measure to see if it fits before you order.

Coming to JAVA from C++, I was thinking, hey, I need to read up on JAVA Generics, they are like C++ Templates and will help me program better.
